qKiojkMvqXZNWaOIjI9nAg.text: When asked about the level of noise it's at 100% with great Ambiance, DJ playing while you enjoy amazing Korean food. Must try Kali, prawns & carnitas tacos. Fantastic shareable plates. Will return to try the test of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0xKu7UIdjifmkPUgMhrs4Q.text: Best Friend by Roy Choi is a fun and funky restaurant in the Park MGM. (Unlike a number of the other restaurants in the Park MGM - such as Eataly, which you can see from the outside of the hotel - Best Friend is inside the hotel casino so it can be a little tricky to find).  I went with a friend and we both ordered the LA Love Story prefix. (The restaurant offers two prefixes, the LA Love Story and the KBBQ. I asked if I could order one prefix and my friend could order the other but our waitress would not let us.) Both prefixes offer A LOT of food so only order the prefixes if you are EXTREMELY hungry (or if you want to take home a lot of leftovers).   LA Love Story Prefix: (1) Elotes - 3/5 - The elote was decent but nothing special. (2) Kogi Taco - 4/5 -  The kogi taco fantastic, I thought this was a great fusion of Korean and Mexican cuisine. (3) Carnitas Taco - 3.5/5 - The canitas taco was good but nothing special. (4) Slippery Shrimp -  4/5 - The shrimp was crispy and juicy and the sauce was delicious. (5) Chego Belly Bowl - 4/5 - I really enjoyed the pork belly in the bowl. (But at this point in the meal I was pretty full and did not try anything else in the bowl.) (6) A-Frame O.G. Ribs - 2/5 - I was fairly disappointed by the ribs. I may be a little bit of a snob when it comes to BBQ (having lived in St. Louis where there are a lot of fantastic BBQ joints) but I thought the meat in the ribs was a little dry and the sauce wasn't great. (7) Medjool Date Cake - 5/5 - PHENOMENAL CAKE and the best thing about the meal. The cake was warm and gooey and the ice cream on the side was the perfect addition.  Overall, I enjoyed my meal and had a great dining experience. With the number of great restaurants in Vegas, I'm not sure I would go back. (The only reason I would is for that Medjool Date Cake, so be sure to save room for dessert and order that if you go.)

Zp0O7GRD02nlYjC7kXxDPQ.text: I love everything about this place. From the design of the old school bright yellow advertisements littered throughout Vegas, to the Asian grocery storefront facade, the smell of familiar food when you walk in, and complex taste of the fusion style food. Yum.   Before we get to the food, I'm going to list a few of the things I appreciated. Right outside the restaurant there are Best Friend slot machines. Unfortunately, we did not win money from it, but that was cool. The fake storefront reminded me of the Asian grocer on Sunset street next to Jack's parent's home in Echo Park. The posters from the 90's. Going through red plastic blinds? Idk what you call these things, but they further reinforce the grocery feel. The menu is a binder filled with pictures that looked like pictures I have from home. The hanging plants. The servers in green adidas track suits. Jurassic 5, Fabolous, and Chromeo playing - track list was catered to the souls that grew up in the 90's. Everything about Best Friend made it feel so personal, like Roy Choi trying to express where he came from. Even the wall painted with Kogi trucks. Damn, I remember when they first came out and standing in line for hours just for a bulgogi burrito.   Food was freaking delicious. It was like that feeling when I first had a Kogi taco at the parking lot of some rando warehouse, but now I'm older and my tastebuds have matured, and I'm sitting in some fancy dining establishment still being blown away by this food.  So we ordered the kimchi fried rice arancini, eggplant schnitzel, uni rice, spicy pork, and bingsu. The kimchi fried rice arancini was my fav, the yuzu in the uni rice made the uni taste yum, you can never go wrong with the spicy pork. Our waiter was knowledgeable of the menu, so if you have questions, feel free to ask them.  I'd come back again fsho. Make reservations!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bingsu
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni Dynamite Rice
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Big E from the OC

z1VvFKrpJBfRr54kSPfkQA.text: Don't get me wrong the food was good. My only issue with the place was the food portion sizes. They felt like they look like all appetizer sizes. So I felt like I was kind of getting gypped pricewise. I understand it is in Vegas and things are priced a little bit more. Also Roy Choi is also all about making Asian food not feeling like it's cheap. Which I commend him for. A lot of people think Asian Food is supposed to be cheap. It is actually high-quality food. So good for him on that part. Food was very tasty though. The Uni Rice was very good. I've got the high end the fridge. Also very good. Just portion sizes were very small. Other than that as far as taste everything was very good. Had no complaints on flavor. Just portion sizes.

b1HVW67J-z_GWui3021IAQ.text: Best Friend just opened in Park MGM which recently took over the Monte Carlo Hotel.   Best Friend is located towards the back next to the Sports Lounge.  The front of the restaurant has the theme of a 90s throw back in a bar with neon lights.   It's a cool place to hang out while you have drinks and food at a bar.  You also have the option for a full service dine in experience located in the back.  The full food menu is made for Asian/Mexican fusion and also family style for sharing.   All the dishes were good but I felt the portions was a little small to share as family- style.  I was a bit disappointed on the outrageous prices.  But I guess that's the premium you have to pay these days when you're eating at Vegas.  So a plate of 3 taco was $12.50.  It was a good size taco.  But seriously not worth $4 a taco.  An order of slippery shrimp was $16 for not more than 10 small pieces.   Note that the restaurant closes at 10 pm.

QAQ-kLF7JeGdHRNQc707Pg.text: I'll make this really easy, if you're thinking about it then just go, Roy Choi is your Best Friend.  Now for an expanded review: When you enter the restaurant the receiving area looks like an old school bodega, you can buy goodies or drinks while you wait for your table or reservation. Entering the restaurant feels like going to a back door then you'll see all the open space and the nice LA lay-back decoration with plants hanging from the ceiling.  The Food, recommendation, try to go with a group, plates are very sharable and you'll able to try more that way. If you are unsure just order a bunch and talk with the servers they'll help you with portion sizes and will let you know if you need to order more or less.   Order: Hawaiian buns - (Free) - Now, you probably have tried these and thought, there is no way to make this better, just wait and try these...  Eggplant Schnitzel - A really weird combination of flavors that just work, great for the adventurous type Dumplings - They're good, but nothing out of the ordinary Kimchi Fried Rice - Amazing, spicy but with lots of flavors, great for mixing with meats Spicy Pork - A MUST - This is great, it's like a perfect blend between meat/bacon, season spectacularly (This alone is worth the visit) Slippery Shrimp - This is very spicy, more than I'm used to but really good. Cucumber Drink - Really good and works really well with spicy food, probably can do ten of these Bingsu (Dessert) - Sorry that the picture is not great, my mouth was burning so started eating as soon as arrived, it's raspberry sorbet with shaved coconut ice, dragon-fruit and like a foam, very very good, perfect for cooling down.  Service was amazing, sorry that I don't remember the waiter name but he was incredible. This is great food at a great price with amazing service, will become a stable of my places to eat when in Vegas.

idrsIkVROxFaMWg7bFpZhQ.text: The new Nevada outpost of this popular LA eatery did not let us down, and chef Choi was in the house in the flesh. It should be noted that at 8:30 on this Saturday night in mid-June the music was playing so ridiculously loudly that any sort of conversation (even with someone seated at your table directly next to you) was a definite struggle. The cocktails are a nice collection of creative takes on classics and a few new concoctions--very tasty. Our tastebuds first touched food here when the fresh rolls were set down, and they were deliciously warm, buttery, and yeasty with a pinch of salt on top. It looked like every table around us ordered the beef tacos, as did we. Good Lord they are out of this world fantastic! We also had the slippery rock shrimp--easily the best version of the dish I've ever tasted, probably because the sauce was the spiciest I've ever had on rock shrimp. (I want more...right now!) Chili pasta is dish that was quite good (seasoned ground meat over tornado noodles) but lacked a little of the pizzazz that most of the other items radiate. I will go back anytime for another experience (when is the music not deafening?).

j0m7subw7ArA4FpdNxU7Mg.text: This restaurant is located in side Park MGM. Chef Roy Choi brings his style to Vegas not only in the food but the decor.   Right when you enter I was blown away by the atmosphere. The dining area has a DJ who plays old school music, mainly hip hop. The volume is perfect not too loud where you have to yell over the table to hear your friends.   @bestfriendvegas by @ridingshotgunla inside @parkmgm   The #hibiscussoju & #strawberrymangodaiquiri were delicious & so refreshing.  #elotes the most delicious!!! #kalbi #galbi always yummy!!! #slipperyshrimp disappointing  #kogishortribtacos delicious!!! #chegoporkbellybowl good  They were out of Uni Dynamite Rice

lbCG6mY4WoOfjH24g0CDdg.text: The ambiance was super cool. If you grew up in la in the early 90's you will feel nostalgic. When you walk in the lobby area it is set up like a Korean liquor store. The. When you go to the back there's a dj and lots of tables. As for food I recommend the kimchi fried rice and the salad. We also got the short ribs but none of us were very big fans. For the price of the ribs I wouldn't say it's worth it, especially if your expectations are for tender Korean Kalbi. One down side was it was FREEZING in there! Bring a jacket just in case.

lOUX0ZXdKFexYX1qjuT5CA.text: The hostess are RUDE with a nasty attitude, the management and waiters are great and friendly. It's a very different take on Korean BBQ but the unique flavors and dishes will make you come back again and again

0AOqnpgc78SYcH6huyf_0g.text: Best Friend by Roy Choi is a great restaurant in the Park MGM. It's tucked away and from the entrance looks a bar styled in industrial fashion.  But once you go beyond the two sets of industrial plastic strip curtains the restaurant transforms into lush and spacious area. There is a ton of art work and plants that bring a unique personality to the restaurant.  Our party of 10 had a reservation and we were graciously accommodated with a private room. There was plenty of space and even a fancy mirror that can take pictures of the group.  The staff was amazing and did a great job of serving our large party.  Our group was adventurous and all agreed to $55 a head for the chef to put together a tasting menu. We had some dietary restrictions (vegan, vegetarian, no pork and they delivered!).  We got A LOT of dishes. I don't remember them all but here are some of my favorites.  Dry Aged Steak - Delivered with the rib bone of the cow (about 2 ft long). Delicious and distinct dry age flavor. 5 stars  Grilled Whole Fish - Ours was a fresh sea bass. Great flavor. 4 stars  BBQ Shrimp (prawns) - Wow, these were huge prawns packed with flavor. 5 stars  Korean Wings - Very good flavor. Not quite the traditional double fried wing I was expecting.  Ban Chan - Was decent 3 stars  Kimchi Fried Rice - Overall great with the poached egg. I always wish the egg was more runny but with hot rice, it's gonna cook :) 4 Stars.  Best Friend by Roy Choi was great food experience! Ours was quite special given our large party. So my recommendation is to come with a lot of people and take advantage of all the dishes you can get family style.

AQfAlkap3RTk6rgiJFtn6w.text: Such a cool resturaunt! The decor is awesome! The staff all wear track suits and they play great music (beastie boys, trap music etc.) The food is amazing. We got the all you can eat. We had slippery shrimp, rib eye, chicken and ribs. So so good! I'll definatley be going again on my next vegas trip!

JmOM0NX1i_3Bv8KQ_2YcHw.text: The bomb. The atmosphere is so cool, laid back and not stuffy - the feel was like a great clubhouse. Having Kogi from going to LA, I knew I was in for a great food experiment. Yes it delivers with Kogi Tacos -$15 for $3, Short Ribs, the wings - wow. There was no one around us that was not enjoying all of the menu. The slushy drinks were also good. You want to pace yourself when ordering, as the food is so good - you can over order. The food comes out quick. Have a late nite menu as well. Yes - the prices are higher than the LA locations. The service is outstanding and the vibe was so great, can't wait to go back.

KsVSxfpHEQyCJmhmNYjzCg.text: I've been wanting to try this place for forever, it was great! It's always so busy so make sure you make reservations..luckily there were spots at the bar so we didn't have to wait. The food came out so quickly, and it was all incredible! We ordered the broccoli, dumplings, slippery shrimp (so amazing), and short rib tacos. They also have alcoholic slushies which are fun and actually strong. Definitely bringing friends here when I have visitors in town!

BCfeAhOSf_0_iL9g0tZ80Q.text: I'm glad the LV strip finally has a Korean fusion restaurant! My boyfriend and I had the street tacos, street corn, kalbi, and kimchee fried rice. The food presentation was similar to the food you would get at any good Korean restaurant. As a modern 'hip' restaurant they played a lot of loud EDM, which I didn't mind much but it did make it pretty hard to have a conversation. The food came out VERY quickly, which was a good and bad thing. As for the food itself, The kimchee fried rice is a bit spicy for me but my Korean boyfriend loved it. Everything else we ordered was delicious but nothing really stood out. The only reason I'm giving this place 4 stars is because of how expensive it was for street style foods.

lChgU3z9amaC6210veGDjQ.text: BEST FRIEND by ROY CHOI is located at the Park MGM near the casino area.  You walk into a gift shop and bar stools.  It's quite confusing since the dining area is hidden behind the back.  Add your name to the list.  Once they take you back, there you'll be welcomed to a fun trendy ambiance with DJ included!  Definitely LA vibe.  The servers are all dressed in Adidas track suits which was fun to see.  Food fare were delicious, especially the free bread that they offered.  Our favorite were the short rib tacos.

9h9cWYrWbwyhz4MUe2yXyQ.text: So my best friends and I decided to check this place out for a girls night. Loved the entrance and decor of the restaurant when we first walked in and enjoyed that behind the register/host stand were tons of old school goodies I remember eating as a kid. Upon going into the actual restaurant I too loved the decor and set up. The wait staff wore Adida replica jumpsuits which was pretty cool. I liked that the menus looked like high school binder. Came complete with the tabs that we used to separate our classes and even included old school photo's of the chef and his friends from back in the day. We all ordered drinks and the server was nice and helped us with the menu and even suggested some tips to cut costs. We all almost ordered the same thing but I ended up switching mine up so we didn't all have the same food on the table.  The were out of the elote which was very disappointing but it was okay. Everything we ordered ended up being worth not having it. The Hawaiian rolls they give were delicious wish they kept them coming as a complimentary item. For the price you pay they could afford to do so.  Overall, ambiance was great, service was nice and food was pretty flavor.  Would like to come back and try other menu items but it would definitely be around tax season again! Haha J/K

62e-R7vRPumP8hbtbMQiew.text: Was only able to try the Pork Belly Rice Bowl and I'm in love. It has a perfect combination of sweet and spicy, with fresh vegetables, crunchy peanuts and fatty pork belly.  I came alone and pretty close to closing time but the manager still suggested I join the dining room and the bartender (Danny, I think?) was amazing.  There's a Korean supermarket with a counter bar at the front, before passing through red refrigerator curtains into a darker dining area with an open kitchen.  There's an area for a DJ, modern art along the walls and hanging plants from the ceiling.  Definitely want to go back and try the rest of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XjDhOk_rtblCv5naxdug3w.text: Roy Choi does it again.   I should probably preface this review by acknowledging the simple fact that I have been a card-carrying True blue Roy Choi fanboy since the first time I tried his Kimchi Quesadilla over ten years ago after chasing down the Orange County Kogi Truck. Since then I have visited every single one of his restaurants and with the exception of LoCoL, have adored every morsel he has brought forward. Simply put, he is my most beloved Chef on earth.   Best Friend is another concept right out of the Choi playbook that has successfully married Asian and Latin flavors for over a decade now. The restaurant sports a bodega-style liquor store in front, complete with a counter for ordering swift take-out orders and other wares for sale. Patrons are then ushered into the main dining room to find some of his most notable dishes from Los Angeles, observed on an "LA section" of the menu, as well as newcomers such as large-format, sharable plates meant just for the glitzy Las Vegas scene.   The item list reads like a love letter from Los Angeles to Las Vegas and highlights what we have come to expect: From the thinly-sliced Pork Belly with a spicy Gochujang Sauce to an iteration of the Slippery Shrimp with Walnuts and Spicy Aioli you always cherished back home at Yang Chow. I found items from each of his major locations in California (A-Frame, Commissary, Chego, POT, and of course, the OG Kogi BBQ Taco Truck -- you know, the one that started it all).  Suddenly, you notice some newcomers. A Tomahawk Steak with Salsa Verde? Kimchi Jjiggae? A Tamarind Hot Pot that can feed four and Chili Spaghetti? Wait... Caviar Tostadas? What the hell is going on here? It will be around this time that your server donning an Addidas tracksuit fit for MC Run or DMC explains that they have constructed a custom dry aging room just for Kimchi. Yes. Just for the Kimchi.   Genius.   Even the beverage program has swagger. Each Sinatra-era and 1980's Cocktail brings something really nice, something really proper, and -- most importantly -- something really funky to your table.   All of this is in a pleasant, carefree environment highlighting the best music from the golden age of Hip Hop spun by an in-house DJ and there even a nightclub located next door. My only question for Mr. Choi is why this is not in Los Angeles or Orange County; where it belongs.   Best new restaurant in Las Vegas?   No.   Best new restaurant period.

7uVDfyfLibbDItDdsI2l5Q.text: I gotta give props to Best Friend for bringing that 90s 'old school' vibe to the Strip.   Don't trip 'cause there's a gift shop in the front and I thought, "My bad... I must be in the wrong place." You just gotta roll through the red PVC curtain that reminds you of a drive-thru carwash until you peep the dining room.   All the servers be sportin' red or green Adidas track suits. I was like oh snap!! Even the menus looked dope with fly pictures of Roy Choi and his homies from back in the day at Saddies and Prom.  Everything we ordered was all that and a bag of chips. I was so full that I wanted to head back to my crib and take a nap. The following is what me and my homies shared:  Kalbi "Bryant" beef (A) Kimchi fried rice (A) Street corn (A) Spicy pork (A) Veggie root (A) Dumplings (A) Fries (A) Shaved ice (A) Sundae in a bath tub (A)  You go, Roy!

x246G_8BdonWQDHn66PxgA.text: Of course everyone us talking about BEST FRIEND... and for good reason. It's simply  amazing, awesome food and throw back 90s vibes. I came here expecting just to order one dish, but after talking to our server he suggested trying many dishes and sharing. We had four people with us,  everyone left happy and full!! Everything we tried just kept getting better.... dumplings, short rib tacos, pork belly bowl, garlic chicken, and the street corn.   The garlic chicken was literally the best chicken I have ever ate in my entire life. I'll definitely make this spot a regular Vegas stop. So far most memorable and favorite Vegas meal!

PYUvZP8TjhmTESdC_AYaXg.text: Wow, there was a lot of hype about this place online.  So, when it came time to choose a place for a birthday meal we decided to try this place.  We made a reservation in advance (highly recommended).   The reception area has a unique and very cool design like a Korean grocery store with shelves full of cool and sometimes cute items.  When we approached the receptionist, there was zero eye contact whatsoever.  She didn't even look up.  She checked us in without looking at us at all.   I don't know if they're going for a pretentious, snobby sort of vibe.  If so, they were right on the money.  The table was ready fairly quickly.  The inside is small and loud with constant booming Korean rap music.  It would've been nice if they lightened it up now and then with maybe some K-pop.  The waitstaff are all wearing colored track suits (a fun touch).  The menu was reasonably sized though divided strangely into odd categories.  One thing that stood out immediately was a $4 charge for Banchan (Korean side dishes).  That is almost sacrilege at a Korean restaurant, since it is a tradition that these sides are included (and replenished as needed) with the meal.  This seemed like a naked attempt at increasing profits.    We ordered quite a large variety of dishes.  Everything except the Sundubu was pretty good.  The Sundubu was odd to say the least and had almost no tofu in it.  When we pointed this out to the server he explained that they use only very small pieces of tofu in it.  He didn't offer to bring more tofu or anything.  Oh well.  It also had a chocolatey taste - possibly since the restaurant apparently tries to do Korean-Mexican fusion.  The garlic chicken was my favorite.  I am not usually a fan of chicken thighs, but these were pretty good.  The Kalbi was decent though tougher than what we have had at much less expensive Korean BBQ places off strip.  They served dinner rolls with the meal (unique) which appeared be like King's Hawaiian rolls with salt on top.  Not bad.  Overall all the food was quite salty, and the server agreed saying, "Yeah, everything here is pretty salty."  They were kind enough to bring a slice of birthday cake with the meal, and we ordered some other desserts as well (eg mango pudding) which were not bad (though not spectacular).  Soft drinks and frozen drinks were served in what looked like red plastic cups, but they were actually a fairly high quality cup made to look like a cheap cup.  A fun touch.   Overall, this place turned out to be much more hype than quality.  And there are honestly much better Korean restaurants off-strip.  If you are stuck on the strip, though, this is just about the only choice for Korean BBQ or Korean food in general (slash Mexican fusion?). But there are far better choices just a short Uber ride away.

rVnbY_vRBEfjmqR0oRC14g.text: Walking from the restaurant lobby to the dining area was like being transported from from Las Vegas to a backyard in Los Angeles. This whole restaurant feels like an ode to LA.  If you haven't seen the Netflix show Chef, you need to see it now. I've been a fan of Chef Choi since the first time I ate at the Kogi truck close to 10 years ago. The show, however, has given me an even bigger appreciation for his work. In fact if you consider yourself a foodie you must stop what you are doing and go watch Chef the Show and Ugly Delicious.   Now back to Best Friend. The Hawaiian bread they bring out is so buttery and sweet. The Kogi tacos reminded me of why I would stand in eternal lines to eat at the Kogi Truck. The spicy pork is so flavorful and the onions soak up all the juices, finger licking good! The Kalbi ribs were perfectly marinated and cooked to a heavenly delicious goodness. The one complaint is that the cast iron plate wasn't hot enough to cook up the onions to a caramelized yumminess. It's too much raw onion.  The watermelon drink, tequila infused with sesame seed and fresh watermelon juice is all I ever want to drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kogi Tacos, the original

NBzLGoNi5DrqAAXIgS-0hw.text: Ahh my reason for tricking my own bestfriend to coming to Vegas for her bday lol. I needed to try this place as soon as I heard it was opening! I swear I made reservations as soon as I could and I'm over the moon that my expectations were exceeded with my experience at Best Friend.   First off, I dined alone because my bestfriend and I flew in at different times. No worries, the upbeat, friendly attitudes of the waiters/waitresses and entire ambiance of the restaurant made it super comfortable to relax, chill and bob my head to the impeccable hip hop playlist that was on until my food came.   Trust me I wanted to order everything off the dinner menu. However, I knew we'd be going out later in the night and didn't want to be overly stuffed and sleepy. Heres what I tried:  Complimentary house Hawaiian buns sprinkled with sea salt were an awesome way to start.   Short Rib Kogi Tacos (5 STARS, DUH) - as my waiter said "you don't build an empire off a taco that's not amazing!" He was so right. The best taco I've ever had. I ate all three. Everything about this was perfect. I had mine with a little kimchi on top and was in heaven.   Broccoli ban chan/Kimchi ban chan (5 stars) - love love love. Ban chan is a must order here guys, these were so good. Best kimchi, best broccoli ban chan I've ever had.   Slippery shrimp (4.5 stars) - I love the sambal flavor and spice used on these and the quality of the shrimp couldn't be better. Honestly I have to say this was better than the rock shrimp at Nobu. Very heavy for one person to eat a whole order of tho I know I left a good amount behind. Bring friends for this dish.   Watermelon cocktail (5 stars) - I wish I could make this at home. It was by far my favorite cocktail of the trip and I know it's early, but probably will be my favorite cocktail of 2019. Loved the spicy/salty rim and the not-too-sweet flavor.   I will be back here as soon as we're back in Vegas which is probably not long. I can't help myself I love Vegas foodcations and Best Friend just made my "Must Eat At" list.

tispSMNY6RPiCsjCbQeR3A.text: If you like spicy, then this is your place!  REALLY cool decor and theme - fun, old school, funky, and hip hop!  Honestly.. this place just wasn't for me, food wise. Spice was just over powering every single dish we ate or tried.  Yes, I know Korean food CAN be spicy, but I like a little kick where I can still taste the food I'm eating. I couldn't get pass dishes that were drenched in the spicy sauce and that's all you taste, is the spicy sauce.  We ordered :  *Slippery Shrimp - deep fried rock shrimp in spicy mayo sauce. *Kalbi - marinated short rib. Don't agree that it's worth $28 for the 5-7 pieces you get. *Chego Pork Belly Bowl - found maybe 3-4 pieces of pork belly in my bowl, everything was drenched in the spicy sauce. Not my favorite.  The sweet, warm Hawaiian buns the give you for the table is phenomenal! I could have a whole bag of those!!   Again, just wasn't for me because of how spicy or drenched in spicy almost everything was!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FNP2cJBoeR6OYf2yLdvHMw.text: Probably my favorite spot I've eaten while visiting Las Vegas. Checked this spot out because of the hype and Timothy DeLaGhetto. Your expectations are definitely met when you first arrive! There's truth in the hype, trust me.   I highly recommend the TACOS and KALBI. Trust me, it's a must have when ordering food. Roy Choi has a famous taco truck, so you'd definitely be missing out if you don't get them. As for the kalbi, it was probably the best quality meat while being cooked to juicy tender perfection.   Also, don't skip out on ordering the kimchi, it's a must have with any BBQ option you end up getting. Overall the food here is amazing and I'm already looking forward to the next time I'll be able to go.   I'd definitely put this restaurant at the top of your list when you come to visit Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0o5hqWqsEioiEitdlQgu4w.text: The feels to the restaurant is on another level, nothing but good vibes.  Loving the atmosphere and the live DJ playing r&b hip hop, yes and yes!!!!   As far as the food, the complimentary bun - not going to lie it was delicious and wanted more; the spicy pork was pretty flavorful; garlic chicken - it was okay, nothing to special about it; Korean wings - it was good and basically fell off the bone; and the Los Vegas Salad - it was okay; Fruity pebble Rice Krispie treat...loved, simple but soo good.   You can't forget about the Jaymo & Ginger Slushie, this adult beverage is a must have.

1AsEzup6JaEnKgwCfUarbQ.text: This review was going to detail a wonderful experience describing delicious plates and a fun, hip atmosphere. However, because of a mindless server, this review will only cover her failings. I'd love to have reviewed the food but when the experience is this bad, it ruins the meal.   TLDR: Food was good. Server didn't listen.  Rarely do I rant about the service of an establishment. Even if it's a worst case scenario, I'll sit through a meal to the end and give them chances to redeem any faults. But in this case, it felt like it was one thing after another. Hopefully the faults can be corrected and next time friends are in town, I may them back to this restaurant on the world famous Las Vegas Strip.   Side note: I'm a fan of Roy Choi's L.A. eateries and since the announcement of this Vegas spot several months or even a year ago, I was looking forward to this night for a long time.   First of all (not at the server's fault), the dining room was empty at the 5pm opening. Yet, we were seated in the farthest corner of the room, next to the restrooms and kitchen (see photo). "Okay....", I tell myself, but whatever.  Server Stacey arrives at our tiny table for two and takes our drink order and first plates: two boozy slushies ($18 each at 16 oz.), Los Vegas Salad ($13), Elotes ($10) and Dumplings ($12). I clarify to Stacey that this is already a bunch of food from the "Must-Haves" (appetizers) menu and we'll order more later. She nods and leaves to put in the order.   Minutes later, before the appetizers arrive, she returns to take our other orders, and now I'm confused. I thought we were going to order more later? Stacey stated the dishes will be timed out and will come out steadily; they just want the orders in. "Weird...", I thought to myself but she seemed confident so we went with it and ordered BBQ Kalbi ($28) and Chego Pork Belly Bowl ($18). Before ordering the bowl though, I needed to clarify if the red font on the menu meant it was spicy (see photo), otherwise it would be no problem to order something else. Confidently Stacey says, "not spicy".   Before the salad and dumplings arrive, complimentary Hawaiian sweet bread arrives to our table. Everything's tasting great but just as I presumed, plates are eating up the table space: two glasses of water, the pitcher, two slushies, two sharing plates, a salad plate, a bread skillet, and dumplings take up every inch of the table. A ton of food, but I can still enjoy it.   Then the Elotes, two corn cobbs, arrive and now my anxiety is rising because there's no place for it, but I manage by dropping it onto my sharing plate. No big deal but now we have to eat fast so we can clear space for the next dish. At that moment, the Kalbi arrives. What the f---! The dumplings haven't been touched and is probably getting cold. I'm utterly annoyed at this point. To my friend I say, "That last bowl better not arrive."  Well guess what, seconds later, the final bowl arrives and the dude is just standing there holding it. Where should we put it, on my lap? We end up having to mix food onto other dishes just to clear the plates - bread sitting on my salad and kalbi flavors mixing with dumpling dipping sauce while clearing plates to the empty table next to us... exactly how I imagine Roy Choi intended his flavors to be served.   So remember this pork bowl that Stacey said is not spicy? I took one bite and it was FIRE. I immediately begin to sweat and so does my friend. The second bite was a hard pass. To Stacey I say that it is spicy, and she responds with a big smile saying, "Well, it's the good kind of spicy, right?"  We paid the bill in full, bit my tongue and didn't say anything about the service to the staff on the way out. What I did leave with, was a full stomach and an intention to not return for a long time. Sorry Roy.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We were sat at the farthest corner of a near empty dining room, next to the restrooms.
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar/Merch at Entrance
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hA3DSgMRiaJ5LOBFQuIE-g.text: Oh hey Roy Choi, I see you in Vegas. We naively showed up to Best Friend thinking it would be easy to get a table. Reservations for tables were fully booked, but we lucked out by being able to find 4 seats at the bar. This turned out to be a blessing for us as we had the most chill server, who entertained us the whole night (wish I caught his name)!  It says a lot about a restaurant when the decor is thought out and has the intricacy you'll find at Best Friend. The hanging planters, the wall art, the discreet entrance all elevated my experience here.   The menu, though it comes in a binder reminiscent of grade school, is not that extensive. Being established Kogi truck fans, there were a lot of items we've tried already which narrowed our decision making more. First we dug into some complimentary Hawaiian rolls. When you're trying to keep things low carb, but Hawaiian rolls are staring at you, you don't say no. My husband and I shared the kimchi fried rice bowl and the spicy pork BBQ plate. The marinade on the spicy pork had the familiar flavors from Kogi truck that I love. Our kimchi fried rice complimented the BBQ nicely.   At the price point, I'm happy I can find a Kogi truck locally to find equally delicious food. However, it's also good to know there's an establishment with extraordinary service, bomb food, and a unique ambiance tucked in the corner of Park MGM. Roy Choi fans should be proud of this one.

6v-Cz8e32OE6AHUEEF0KfA.text: Roy Choi's Best friend restaurant at Park MGM is awesome.  I love the way it looks when you first walk in the restaurant.  It looks like a bodega in Korea Town.  The back part of the restaurant is equally nice.  I love all the plants and the artwork.  I love the menu with all the old pictures of Roy Choi and his family and friends.  We sat at the bar area and the bartenders were great.  Everything on the menu sounds delicious and I wanna order all of it.  Settled for a salad and the grilled whole fish.  It was delicious.  The fish comes as a whole fish with the head and bones.  But it's very flaky and tender.  The bartender helped us get all the fish off the bones.  The sauce that it's in is very simple yet it gave it so much flavor.  The drinks were on point, service is great, the food is tasty.  It feels like LA in Las Vegas.  I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UPpMVZvBx-JMKavTSSAcIQ.text: The ambiance, staff, drinks, food. There wasn't anything that was better than another - it was all so bomb.   We ordered (for 3 people, shared)  - kogi short rib tacos - kimchi fried rice - kalbi - slippery shrimp - eggplant schnitzel - && for dessert: date cake - && to drink: hennessy & cola + fuzzy   Definitely worth the try and make sure to get a reservation. We went on a late Sunday evening and it was still pretty busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g4jLBD5hXPd0C3sqLsQQqg.text: LA on the Strip! LA is Koreatown, Mexican food, fusions and innovative cuisine and I'm so happy that a restaurant of this caliber is on Las Vegas Blvd.   The restaurant is a cool experience. The entrance to this restaurant looks like a Korean store you'd see in an LA strip mall. The inside is designed to look just like the Commissary, Roy's old restaurant.   The cocktails are delicious, innovative and a must get. They are all themed, and every drink you get comes in a complimentary container.   The food - delicious! There's a reason why Roy is such a bad ass chef. I ordered the home made kimchi and it's delicious. It's light in flavor and the sesame seeds add a nice taste. I got the pork bbq with a side of rice. The bbq flavor is delicious. Since it's pork belly it's not as overwhelming or super greasy. The portion is good for one but easily can be shared.   Overall this is such a cool place to eat and check out. It's a total must. I love Roy Choi and have been following him since he started Koji (they have the koji tacos on the menu too!!!!). I think this new restaurant is setting the wave for the rebranding of Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Pork, homemade kimchi, rice and a Hitachino. Along, with St. Judas. I feel like I&#39;m back in LA!

QFATlSfF2xFIZPU82bhIHA.text: One of the perks of staying at Park MGM was Best Friend! Such a great addition to the revamped casino/hotel. At first, I just walked through the front, eyeing the goods and taking in the "liquor store" feels. But on a whim we decided to go and there were only reservations available at 5 PM (opening time) so we took it!  Upon entering, we went through the red butcher plastic and arrived in this majestic setting. Loved all of it, the graphics on the wall, open kitchen, long bar. We sat in the swivel seats, which were comfy, but being short, I felt really low compared to the table.  Absolutely loved our service from beginning to end by Geremew, one of the best waiters I've ever had. He gave us such a great experience and one of the highlights to our meal! The first thing I asked him was if Chef Roy Choi was in the restaurant, and he said he had not seen him so probably not.Darn! For the 3 of us who weren't super hungry, we ordered the chego pork belly bowl, kogi short rib tacos, and the big E from the OC. We also ordered two slushies and I had the watermelon "cool AF" drink.  We were quickly served water and complimentary hawaiian rolls. The salt on the hawaiian rolls were genius! The drinks came out so quick, and my friends really enjoyed their slushies. I tried it and it was tasty. My watermelon drink was so good too, wish it was a little bit stiffer. However, $18 for a drink is a bit absurd, but it is Vegas!  The chego rice bowl came out first and it was sooooooooooooo good! So many textures and flavors, all went together perfectly. That was my favorite of the three. The kalbi tacos were good at first bite, but I felt the sauce was a bit overwhelming to me. The Big E from the OC was tasty too, but as much as I love ikura, it was a bit overpowering over the kimchi rice aranci balls for me.  As we were wrapping up our meal, low and behold, Chef Roy Choi to the right of me! Geremew surprised us by sending him to our table! I was so star struck, and uttered, you're not supposed to be here! Total fan girled, and was the highlight of our night! Thank you Geremew and Chef Roy Choi for making our night!  My friends said this was the best out of our 5 meals we had in Vegas, so glad they enjoyed it as much as me! Really fun wall to take a photo of, and cool items to purchase in the store too! Highly recommend for a fun experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary Hawaiian rolls
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. With Chef Roy Choi himself!!!
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Big E from the OC

cI8S_YJxaIGbgBvCxJ47sw.text: absolutely loved EVERYTHING about this restaurant! i binge watched the chef show recently so i just had to come here. made reservations since we had a big party of 8 people. but 2 friends couldn't make it so we showed up with 6 which wasn't a problem.  we ordered the chef's menu because we wanted to try everything. but also ordered the korean fried chicken and elotes on top of the chef's menu. started off with banchan which was soooo good! the kimchi was my favorite (and i'm usually not a huge fan of it lol) but the persian cucumbers and the spinach were also top contenders. we also got some hawaiian bread to start with.  the kogi tacos were everything. i wish i wasn't so full at the end because i totally would've had another.  the slippery shrimp was prob my favorite entree. it was crunchy. spicy. sweet. amazing.  the korean fried chicken was soo good! super crunchy and seasoned well. it paired well with the honey mustard.  the chefs menu included 2 bbq plates: spicy pork and garlic chicken. both were great. huge plates. had leftovers.  the elotes were good. small, but good. i just love corn so anything corn i almost always order. especially if it's elotes!  the kimchi fried rice was also one of my favorites. the rice was perfect. al dente. seasoned perfectly.   the medjool date cake was amazing. the cake was so moist. the caramel ice cream and the crunchies (i think it was toffee something idk) but it was just a perfect dessert to end the meal with. it wasn't too sweet. never going to forget this dessert. lol actually, i'm craving this now.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spicy pork! came out sizzling.
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. k o g i . t a c o s
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. elotes!

rsGnV7-6oedDRIeOsTPhMQ.text: I wanted to give Best Friend 5 stars, but for me, if there are some dishes or sides that miss the mark even slightly, you can't get 5 stars. I went during Restaurant Week and got to taste a lot for only $50! Was soooo stuffed.. and let me tell you my service from Christina was incredible. She was really attentive while being likeable/relatable.  LOVE LOVE LOVED... - the feel and decor and music.. the VIBE (Maybe because I'm Korean, maybe because we had a market, maybe because I love hip hop, this place really has that chill home feel. Even the servers are wearing track suits. There's no pretentiousness here.) - the bread rolls (OMG. like homemade hawaiian rolls but softer/fluffier and brushed with butter and a sprinkle of salt.) - the kimchi fried rice (You cannot NOT get this if you go!) - spicy pork (flavor spot on, not too spicy) - medjool date cake (at first I was bummed because I might've thought I'd want something less weird sounding but this was the dessert on their Restaurant Week menu... AH-MAZ-ZING.. I was so full but still felt I had to devour EVERY LAST MORSEL)  LIKED QUITE A BIT - mixed tempura (very yummy but you can get good tempura at a lot of places so it wasn't a super standout) - garlic chicken (loved the BBQ char but some parts honestly a little dry/burnt/overdone.. and maybe wanted more punch in flavor.. like let it marinade a day longer?) - slippery shrimp (super yummy but tasted more japanese like the spicy mayo on a dynamite roll.. so it was a little off in terms of harmony with the "Korean" meal.. but I realize maybe this is because I'm maybe a purist who doesn't understand "fusion" well..?) - kogi short rib tacos (super yummy meat but just a tiny off for ME with the corn tortilla)  MISSED THE MARK - banchan (liked the amount of variety.. but they weren't amazing.. I felt they were underseasoned, especially the broccolini)

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medjool Date Cake with Salted Caramel Ice Cream &amp; Strawberry Cheesecake with RIDICULOUSLY GOOD Strawberry Sorbet
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant Week 2019 Menu
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchi Fried Rice. Will return for this.

AdG1zr_5S9tEnxzJfUj9-w.text: Ahhh! I'm so in love with the interior of this place. The entire concept was awesome. You really felt like LA was in Vegas. The menu was also a treat to sift through. We had the short rib, uni dynamite, picked daikon, kogi tacos. Everything was pretty on point and the portions were a good size so I felt like we got our money's worth. The short ribs were amazing quality meat, cut pretty thick as well. The uni dynamite was yummy but a little too spicy for my liking. A couple next to us did one of the family style meals and it looked so good but soo much food! I really liked this place because after doing a ton of Vegas restaurants this felt a little closer to home. I would want to go with a big group and do the family style meals. At least stop in for the amazing interior!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oldbgqyV41_vxrOGLj_5Eg.text: Love Ya Like a Sister (LYLAS)  Stay Sweet + Never Change  Keep In Touch (KIT)  And of course... Friends Forever!  Best Friend was a big ol' flashback to the 90's. Yes, I went to high school in the 1990's. But instead of the cringeworthy moments that I want to forget, it was nothing but the greatest hits from Roy Choi.   Even if you dine in the front bar area, you're in for a treat. Slushy boozy beverages, reminiscent of a snow + peach Schnapps drink my high school gal pals and I concocted, are available on demand. Fried bologna sammies? Hell yeah! And look at all the Roy Choi/Best Friend neon merch... so much merch.   Venture further into the space, past the plastic curtains, into the dining room. Live DJ or hip hop blaring, like a really good h.s. house party. Only we're adults and the cops aren't going to bust this shiz. Must order the tacos, uni rice, cucumbers, and carrots. And duh... of course I'm drinking some white wine like a classy ass grown up.  Such a fun dinner and unique ambiance. Though I didn't get my yearbook signed or a commemorative t-shirt, Roy Choi is definitely one of my new best friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside the resto
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front bar

q7LF20heuZvSNq_3vQcHzg.text: The food here is obviously awesome. Love this place. Tacos are bomb!!!! The short rib is very tasteful. And got a cool bar inside. Some nights they have a dj. Very cool spot to eat at. Thanks Roy Choi for this other great food spot. Just be warned.... The food aint cheap here. You got to pay to play. Go in the afternoon if you want a bigger menu. At night the menu is a lot smaller. But great food and really cool staff here. Our server was awesome. Check out pics of food and other stuff on my ig @socal.experience. if you want to see how to do vegas.

aX5blrq5a-rut-mTClc1xw.text: 5*****s!!!  Great ambiance, great music, amazing service and excellent food. Started with the Strawberry Mango Daq for the wifey and a Macallan 12 w/ pinapple back.  Appitizers were bean sprouts with sesame, dumplings and commisary carrots. Excellent!  Then we ordered the kimchi fried rice, pork belly and kogi tacos! Delicious!   Finally we finished with the date cake and strawberry cheesecake.   Great experience highly recommended!

61SdUlIu6aOaa7vd34seow.text: From the moment you walk in you know this place is going to be good! We were able to make reservations so we were seated very quickly. But if you can't snag a reservation, the bar serves the full menu too! The drinks were strong and tasty and the food was drool worthy. The slippery shrimp and kimchi fried rice were definitely highlights of our meal. The shrimp had an amazing spicy kick to it! I love that you could tell they used a wok to fry the kimchi fried rice too! Something about those extra crispy rice pieces in the fried rice just made you want more and more. If you're in Vegas def check out this new hot spot!! You won't regret it. Oh and the dj spinning the music was soo good! Everything from 90's hip hop/rnb to current jams! The dj alone made me want to stay longer!

EqI8SNTHfWK3svcbyecFmA.text: Absolutely love this place. Came back 2 nights in a row during my Vegas stay. We tried as much as we possibly could. GET THE CLAMS!!! Would've never thought to order a clam dish here if my server didn't recommend it. They were phenomenal. Date Cake for dessert is a must too!

EIKJEkhjSLuh6zYdfgCOvA.text: The atmosphere in Best Friend sets an amazing mood for a dinner that will awaken your senses! After a long day of walking the Vegas strip, gambling and drinking, the spice and flavors of the food will revive even the most tired Vegas patron. Try the Cucumber mixed cocktail for a refreshing cocktail that is the perfect blend of smooth and sweet. Then fire up the Spicy Pork with a side a rice. Trust me, order the side of rice!

FANhaNp9JKNG5a-MQdTh2A.text: Showed up late Saturday night to the DJ'ing sounds of "Sir-Mix-Ya-Deaf"...seriously you could not hear the person seated next to you or across the table... the staff was very friendly... our waitress seemed to be the only one waiting tables in our section and did her best to get everyone's orders in but missed our drink order completely as I am sure her hearing has been damaged by the dance club level sound system crammed into a 75'x75' area... luckily when our food arrived DJ HazU-Deaf finished his set... even the Jesus candle on our table said a prayer of thanks... the short ribs had a tremendously awesome flavor... however you discovered that as you had to chew for hours to break down the meat... pricing seems rather pricey for around 10 short ribs, a bed of cooked onions and a bowl of rice... table desperately needed soy sauce (or others) to bring just a hint more oomph to the meal... decor, lighting, tables all well done.... gives you a sense of the 4 hour drive you just made from L.A. to get a taste of something you could have grabbed back home... but I get it, its Vegas... built to take your money (and hearing)...

PRA43ZO-DfHcbyz9i-rJuA.text: If your looking for more authentic Korean Food this is more like American Korean. This restaurant is not bad but just different, we got the Kalbi and Korean chicken. The Kalbi was good but the wings were a bit salty and sauce was not as described, the menu said blue cheese but we received too sauces on the side when the wings were delivered to our table and they did not have blue cheese or ranch in the restaurant.

cjvsMUAdst5CPNKbeBbCWA.text: The sexiest place in Vegas!  So hip & Alive. We had an awesome time exploring Chef Roy's menu.  The night turned into a culinary journey that will never be forgotten.  Great music and awesome staff!

IWbUDAFb7Td9wgB3aWdw3g.text: Our waitress was very friendly and attentive to us. We got short rib taco and pork belly bowl. Both were freshly prepared and pretty good.

Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib taco

cub5HpWiY90v5IXCoGoGAA.text: Had an incredible meal with a party of 4! We did the chefs tasting BBQ menu and it was stunning. Every single dish was full of flavor and very creative! We love Korean food, and this was a great spin on it with some LA flare.   Several reviews say the portions are too small and it's too spicy. Dumb. Portions were right. And heat level was totally on spot.  Vibe is super fun and quirky. Loved everything about this place.

Wfj9mmw7h9DdW5MeSad7Qg.text: Awesome place! We got the elote, slippery shrimp, kolbi, and kimchi fried rice. Our favorites were by far the slippery shrimp and kolbi. Those are a must. The place is really cool/hip and the waiters are really friendly! Came here for my brothers birthday dinner and he was really happy! good for all ages

tQHy6_dcc06ht03RJQ17eQ.text: Hands down, Roy is a genius and has the coolest concepts for his #bestfriendslasvegas! The Kogi short rib tacos and the braised & charred octopus were amazing in their own. Then when I combined them to make a surf n turf taco ... hands down a Roy suggestion to try out. Tastebud bonanza with a side of kimchi kick  Thanks Roy for your creation and genius ideas

Y4VIomBOuQQY-gQym4mc4Q.text: Nothing beats being transported to the time that shaped who we are today better than the 90's and High School, drinks and food and MUSIC. I had the absolute pleasure of having that very special feeling last night. We stumbled into Best Friend and immediately knew we made the best choice. The DJ spinning 90's hip hop my heart melted. The grub was better than expected. The OG drinks I'm still smiling. The binder menu took me back... way back.   All the while Roy was in the restaurant overseeing things and just chillin .  Highly recommend this spot.

ahtmxCRCOZ36cSsj_MAvrg.text: I'll start off by saying the food was FANTASTIC and the atmosphere is so dope. Everything about the aesthetic made me want to stay longer. It is very hip, and feels very LA (which I believe is the purpose here). I am a huge fan of Chef Roy, and was so excited to try Best Friend. No doubt we would come here again. The Kogi Korean Short Rib Tacos were a delicious start to our evening and a must try for me  - I'm sure they're even better on the original Kogi truck! I appreciate the work and effort put into this place by Chef Roy and his whole crew. That being said, I did mark it down one star due to our service. There were multiple order mix ups and we felt like we were being over charged in sneaky ways. Our server corrected everything when we addressed it, but had we not looked for it, we would've walked out paying $20+ what we were supposed to. The service wouldn't stop me from coming to Best Friend again, we will absolutely be back. Just a minder to watch your tab and speak loudly to your server so he/she/they can hear you over the music (in-house DJ = high noise level!).  Thanks Chef Roy and crew for a delicious dinner!

X0SYL9J9AAIKuFh7z2JIoA.text: I came here in Vegas during my bachelorette and absolutely loved it. The casual signage and entrance doesn't make the restaurant look like much, but Roy Choi really created something special with this place. And to stand out in Vegas really says something. Our reservation was honored on time and the manager even came to greet us once seated. We took the waitresses recommendation and shared what felt like a ton of delicious food, but ended up being the perfect amount for our party of 8. Even for the picky eaters, the food was upscale yet simple enough to satisfy all. For example, the garlic chicken entree was served on a skillet over onions, yet itself wasn't spicy or too seasoned. It really felt like the BEST Chinese chicken I've ever eaten. I also have to rave about the street corn. Going back, I would just eat this as a meal (everyday if I could)! They take it off the cob which my teeth appreciated and was just perfection. For drinks we got an array from wine to the frozen Jameson and ginger slushies. I can speak for the frozen drinks and say they were delicious without being overly sweet. A friend mentioned to the waitress that we were celebrating out bachelorette and they came over with two ice cream sundaes and a round of shots all of the house. The ice cream sundae came in a bathtub and even had cotton candy on top (I was a happy kid). In a city where everyone is celebrating something, this restaurant made us feel special and set itself apart because of that. I would go back here anytime and furthermore, would go to any Roy Choi restaurant based on how fantastic this experience was.

4bEfRBs8OR9SXGxOYgrJ3g.text: Delicious! Would definitely go back again. The whole experience is perfect, from when you enter, to the service, food, and drinks.

B7tJj25EPuHCxGzBjBbeBA.text: The food here was very underwhelming. We had high hopes given the celebrity chef name, but save a trip because the food is forgettable. The service was also pretty poor, which was a surprise. One of our party had their food come out a full 25 minutes after everyone else's food which was obviously pretty awkward and hindered enjoyment of the meal.

5SMUPI0H_eF8JTeX3GOGGQ.text: The food, the music, the service is all awesome. I will definitely come back here again. The food is pricey but it's going to be my treat to myself. If the prices were lower, I might would buy some merchandise lol

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8CRvWKpZY3xkBovoDqylHg.text: Maaaan let me tell you about this place, it's is the shiznit! The ambiance of this place is excellent from the music to the art on the walls. Hell even the waiter uniforms are dope AF. Now the food, my hopes were high and I wasn't disappointed not at all. Our waiter Daniel broke the menu down and suggested some good items (kogi tacos, Korean wings, elote ie Mexican street corn for the uncultured and the kalbi ribs). This is definitely going on my top recommended list of places to eat on the strip. Oh and last but not least they serve your drinks in a red cup, bruh a RED CUP!!!

GU9Ahbe4lJsp2sJnsvuYTg.text: Phenomenal meal with great ambiance.  Lobster was excellent.  Lamb Chops even better.  Kudos to Chef River and our server Gabriel.  Job well done!  We will return.

sJa-cIyQAoxMxmM9sF0wbw.text: Sorry, but a big disappointment for me, someone who loves Kogi and grew up in southern CA eating Korean food. It's Korean food just with the added $$$. And even worse, dishes were so salty!! We had the Vegas salad (it was probably my favorite dish which is telling in itself), the uni fried rice, the kimchi fried rice, the tempura, fries, and Itaewon (like a kimchi ramen soup with lots of meat/veggies). We ended up taking the last dish home, added some more things to it to make it less sweet, and ate it again.  One plus was the cocktail (fuzzy navel?) and I liked the throwback music along with the personal touches on the menu (ha!). But the food was really not to my liking. I'll stick with Chego and Kogi in LA!

UrMY-1-zffic1YTIwAZkwQ.text: Super cute and fun place to eat. The front is very trendy and eye catching which looks like a liquor store hangout. As you walk through the "freezer door" there's a DJ spinning music which gives a different vibe inside. We had the pork belly bowl, elote, and Korean wings (gluten free option which is just kinda the breading). The bowl was well flavored, and the pork belly was very juicy and tender. The gluten free option of the wings did not do it any justice but they tried. The watermelon drinks were a bit strong which explained their price at $18, but that's what you get when you're on the strip. Would definitely come back to try other non-gluten free options. It's a fun place for a group dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon drink
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly bowl

vo5jOQNLCnkSA-0cW6_3Fw.text: chef menu A is simply delicious. an eclectic, family style meal that was on the table in less than five minutes and kept coming through dessert. great vibe as you step into the back dining room and away from the chaos of Vegas. staff was super friendly. I don't know if I'll ever enjoy some one else's fried rice again! it was that good.

8n3Ut-s4rTVqmAAI-OWIFA.text: My sweet friends surprised me with dinner here for my 40th birthday and it was the best! The staff is super friendly. We got a great table and were very impressed with the atmosphere. So fun!  The drinks come in the coolest red solo cups and they are yummy! We got several plates to share but the kimchi fried rice and street tacos were my favorites.  I recommend making a reservation. This place is amazing!

M_EJDnhv0atM_nQpYdCQJg.text: Huge fan of Roy Choi! Korean fushion rocked my mouff! My favs are garlic chicken, salmon enchilada, kogi tacos and kalbi. The dishes I was not a fan of was the tamarind blackened cod stew, kimchi fried rice, Korean wings and slippery shrimp. There are so many great choices and I wish I had the stomach to eat them all. I will definitely go back to try more, but if the salmon enchilada is on the menu, I will always order it. We had two desserts, strawberry Cheesecake and date cake, hands down the date was the winner.

Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Cheesecake

DdOjnVBk6sKXgCLfYkZPFQ.text: This is a happening spot lol Korean Mexican Mesh. It was fun to sit at a table with bit plush chairs. The servers were decked out in track suits, a dj was going and overall was an awesome vibe. The garlic chicken was delicious! The short rib tacos were a bit spicy but still great. We also had the Korean wings which had tasty seasoning. The cost was what is expected on the strip, but it was such a great atmosphere and the food was good so we felt it was worthwhile. I would definitely recommend if you are in a fun and funky mood.

Ml32qSQmqL06bC1C6CH4Aw.text: GREAT SERVICE....That's why they get 5 stars. MEGAN, the assistant general manager really took care of my party. This place is popular so a lot of people will want to try it. Started my experience on a bad note, Had reservation for 8pm. When I got there they said "I already sat". Supposedly someone said they were my reservation and stole my table. I came in heated when I heard that. Why this place gets 5 stars is because after this complication, this restaurant did EVERYTHING POSSIBLE TO MAKE SURE I HAD THE BEST EXPERIENCE. Decor here is hip and modern, food here is above average. Although I didn't hate any of the dishes I ordered, nothing blew me away. Food wise, I would give this place a 3-4 stars, But the reason I give this place 5 stars is because of the service and hospitality. Definitely worth a try.

C435Fz5n6sY5hwoD4P0yaQ.text: I really like this place. The stawbrrry cheesecake is sooooo good. Last time I was there the food took a bit long but nothing to complain about however they felt bad so they gave us all our food for free! Can't complain about that! It's super cute and fun inside.

t8M8A3uBBNIqzGJ90k32wg.text: Came in for dinner, party of 5. We were sat within 10 minutes, earlier than our reservation. Our waiter came over and took our drink order. He also answered our questions about the menu. They brought out free Hawaiian bread rolls.... DELICIOUSNESS!!!! We ordered the kimchi, brussel sprouts, marinated cucumbers, pot stickers, spicy pork belly bowl, elote, garlic chicken, and kalbi short ribs. Entrees were brought out at different times. All food was savory and delicious! No complaints on any food items!! Service was good. Atmosphere has a nice vibe though it is pretty loud that we couldn't really hear ourselves. Restroom is very clean.

LazLkxCrHroyEOFPjUXkqg.text: Had a reservation with my two best friends at best friend yesterday and we had a wonderful time!! The atmosphere is sooo cool and overall just so beautiful! The food was really good as well, we ordered the short rib tacos, the corn, the ramen dust fries, & the slippery shrimp! We can't wait to come back, we're so glad we live in Las Vegas! And lastly another highlight was our son making friends all night long! Food really does bring people together lol!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EkCb_Fjikr9oI7WwxsZLzw.text: Kimchi rice is a must! Dumplings are delicious, don't get me started on the tacos :) A little bit of LA in Las Vegas. Roy Choi is your best friend!

XoEn66AAFgZk02sMHy2qyA.text: I have been looking forward to going to this place for quite some time, I'd heard such great things and was super excited to go for my birthday. We had a party of five, we were a little late but my friend that was early let them know and they still accommodated us which was great. The servers are dressed in track suits which is a quirky weird thing, the ambiance was really dark and very LA themed. Our server took a while to come over, her name was MC, she wasn't overly friendly, just stayed professional however she was hardly ever at our table. She took the drink order for myself and one other person, walked away for 10 mins and then I had to tell her that other people wanted to order drinks, and my mom was at the table and she never even spoke to her or asked if she wanted anything to drink besides water. She was flexible when my drink was really sour and when there was an issue with one of my friends dishes but let me tell you, the menu is SUPER VAGUE,give brief descriptions and obviously you have to ask questions but when some thing is listed as yuzu shrimp and one is slippery shrimp but then one dish you get tail on, head on prawns and then the other is small little dried shrimp, it's really irritating. What else i don't understand is why the servers don't describe how the menu works when they talk to the table, i know this isn't your average concept of a restaurant but give us some basic facts on how everything works, and maybe train your servers so the dining experience is better.   My friend and i shared a few things, the spicy pork, which was delicious, Kim chi fried ride, also delicious. Slippery shrimp, good but not amazing. Cold seafood noodles, bleh, not delicious at all. Yuzu shrimp, not good, fell apart not flavorful but the worst thing was the lamb.. I absolutely love lamb and it was cooked perfectly but it was incredibly bland. The menu said kimchi chimichurri which sounded AMAZING.. there was no flavor whatsoever, just basic, under seasoned lamb chops with mushy vegetables. I was so excited to try the lamb but it was just not amazing at all..   They did tell the server it was my birthday and they gave me a pretty bomb pink dessert assortment that i couldn't identify..   I won't recommend this place to people that ask me about it.

kUrXO4olM_7p3N0kUWEKyA.text: When it's your birthday, don't you want to gather all your 'Best Friend'....dsdzzzz.....!  Ok, I know that was a stretch.  But that is exactly what I did and even chose the restaurant to match.  I was quite excited to try this since KBBQ is my favorite food of all time.  A lot of my taste buds were tarnished right from the start checking in for my reservation that I made months ahead.  It was tricky to find the host stand and people eating right next to the host stand/seated there was a little off putting and I prayed I wouldn't get those tables.  The hostess, a thin light skinned girl with jet black hair hardly spoke and I had to take initiative in telling her that I had a reservation. She silently checked her computer and told me to stand by.  That was it, no "Are you celebrating anything? or other greeting"  We waited and after a while, we checked in with a different hostess who then referred back to the girl, she sort of just handed over a small piece of paper and had an annoyed look.  I tried to put that aside and not let it spoil the mood.  Very funky atmosphere, the front feels like a 'typical' Korean convenience store with storage for tons of snacks and goods.  Some so-so merch with just 'best friend' written on it like t shirts and beanies and tumblers.  Otherwise, you pass through these 'walk in freezer' plastic curtains to be in an entryway that looks like a club entrance. Then you get to the restaurant which has an LA feel.  Menus look like a yearbook with vintage photos of Roy Choi and high school 'best friends' OH!  Now we get it... We ordered a lot including the Kalbi at $30-$35 and shrimp $38.  Banchan/side dishes which is normally included (Kimchi, cucumbers daikon) was $4 per and a very tiny bowl.  Everything was a la carte including just white rice.  We ordered cocktails like a maitai and a strawberry daquiri and it comes in red solo cups like you're at a high school/frat party.  hMMMM...!  Overall the food was just A-OK but nothing extraordinary.  My mom, being full blown Korean adamantly stated that the sundoboo was NOT sundoboo and anyone would agree because I found maybe 3-4 pea sized pieces of tofu in the entire pot.  Our server rebuffed everything with excuses saying that it is not supposed to be traditional.  Even when I said that I thought the food was salty, he stated "yeah, eveyrything here is huh"  They also need to have a pow-wow with some of their servers because some of them had strong B.O. and it would linger when they passed by further weakening my appetite.  It was really nice that they brought me the red cake for my bday and the guy said "I am not going to sing" which is my preference but....what if you were a guest who wanted the song?  Anyhow.....Take it for what this place is worth....a shnazzy joint on the strip....I guess go for the ambiance and then........mosey your way over to one of the many other GREAT KBBQ LV has to offer off the strip.....just UBER or Lyft it if you have to...and don't forget to bring your 'best friend'
