Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq shrimp
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sundobooo

TkUpAI1Dyf_WM4hiyrNcIg.text: Considering how much I love Kogi and I think Chego is decent as well, Best Friend would have to be the biggest disappointment ever. I might have to declare that Best Friend might really be the worst restaurant I've had in Las Vegas. Idk how else to put this but it is what it is. I'll start with the good points of Best Friend.   The service was good/great and the DJ was great. The DJ played some great classic while it wasn't annoying loud. The Hawaiian rolls/breads were great and the salad(Los Vegas Salad) was great. In fact, the salad that we ordered was the best dish that we ordered and the Hawaiian roll was the best thing I had during that dinner. I am not kidding you.    We ordered the stirred fried octopus, army stew, Kimche Fried Rice, Uni Dynamite Rice, Fries, and the Tempura. With the Uni Dynamite being the worst, I really don't recommend this dish. It is over salted and all you taste is the soy sauce/dynamite sauce that COMPLETELY overwhelms the rice. You honestly can't taste the uni because of the sauce that overwhelms the whole thing. With the army stew being the 2nd worse, let's talk about how it is $44. It is $44 and everything in it is not fresh ingredients, everything is just can opened or to say instant. You just make the soup base/idk if they did but everything else in it is Spam, sausage, rice cake, and ramen. To think that you really can't fucked this up, but they did. It was like I got punched in the face with a taste bud full of salt. They give you so much rice but I'm pretty sure even the rice can't overcome how insanely salty this dish was. With this army stew, we ended up taking it home (we only had 1/4 of it because we couldn't even eat it anymore). We had to "save" this dish by adding a lot of water/chicken stock to overcome the saltiness of this dish. Adding more ramen, etc. Basically we took it home to save this dish. As I'm writing this review, I feel like the army stew is on the same level of being the worst dish as the uni dynamite rice.  You don't really go wrong with the fries and tempura but it also wasn't anything special. I already went on that rant about the previous two items so I'll just leave these two dishes as is. The kimchee fried rice was the complete opposite of the Uni Dynamite + army stew in which it was under salted. It's not awful...at least you can actually eat it but it honestly lacked the kimchee flavor to it which was the weirdest thing to a KIMCHEE fried rice.   I will not be back. The service was good and all but this kind of food is just unacceptable. I went back to LA, and got korean food because of how awful it was at Best Friend. In summary, Best Friend is more like a Pei Wei kind of place where they tried to get the foreigners to pay the premium for not so high quality korean food.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ylJSBVErJoPfp-aBkc0GNA.text: Hicheewahwah! This was the best meal I had in Vegas, the best tasting food I've had in months.  Came back the next day for the same things: the pork belly bowl and a short rib taco chaser.  Staff is awesome; even met Roy who is a mensch.  I might come back tomorrow on my way to the airport.  Its just that good.

Z-sCTrOcUuuuBYg97m_GVw.text: Had dinner there tonight with my husband and 2 young children and had one of the best dining experiences by far in a long time!  Our server Sam was super accommodating. He made sure our kids (ages 2 & 4) were taken care of first. He understood it was important to keep them fed and busy so right away he put in our order of plain fries for the kids. He also made sure they had their drinks in to go cups (plastic cups with lids and straws). One the kids started in their fries, he came back went over the menu with us. He made awesome recommendations, all of which we took. We ordered the uni dynamite rice, buttermilk fried chicken and spicy bbq pork. This is a Korean "fusion" restaurant so a lot of the items are marinated or dusted with Korean seasonings which can be a little spicy. Not intensely hot but mildly spicy. The food comes out when ready, so the food will no all be delivered at the same time. Sam explained this to us up front. We didn't mind because quite frankly we were enjoying the 90s LA vibe and music (90s hip hop and R&B).  Servers are dressed in adidas track suits and the runners have a kick back 90s attire as well.  The menu is fun and reminiscent of someone's high school binder in the 90s who is Asian.  To sum it up... EXCELLENT SERVICE, great food and a dope Vibe. We look forward to coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu cover
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni dynamite rice. Their take on seafood on top of crispy rice. It was described as a &#34;progressive&#34; dish. We loved it.
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medjool Date cake with salted caramel Ice cream. This was SO GOOD.

TWWnlDNakFxKLT93z08H1Q.text: A little bit of LA in LV.  Stopped by for dinner on a Saturday night at 5pm. Made reservations well in advance on the Park MGM website to avoid the dinner rush. We were seated promptly and were able to order right away. Had the elotes, kogi beef tacos, and the kalbi. Desert was medjool date cake. I really enjoyed all the food we ordered, which came out fresh and hot. Beers were served cold and reasonably priced. There's an area out front which sells souvenirs and gifts-perfect IG content. The main dining area is behind the gift shop, located in the back.   Service was great. Very attentive staff who cleared our table regularly and  refilled our drinks. Loved the track suit uniforms. Music was a tad loud, but it made the dining area very ~vibey~.  Prices are more on the expensive side, but hey, what do you expect? Definitely give it a try if you're anywhere near Park MGM just for the experience. Would I come back? Yeah, definitely. Located in the casino area of the Park MGM adjacent to Eataly.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medjool date cake with caramel ice cream. So good!
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Elotes!! Sooo good. Get &#39;em!
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One tall crispy boi

EHHhU3tVa5BXQP9qemXS4Q.text: Omg this place is a hidden gem.  Nestled in the back of the Park MGM Hotel's casino.    The front bar is deceiving and doesn't draw you into the back dining room behind the pink plastic slat doors.  Once you make your way you come into a well decorated very chic ambiance of a restaurant.   The menu is huge.  With traditional Korean items with modern Mexican spins on them.    There is a nice cocktail menu with great creative drinks.  I opted for Salty Dog cocktail. Wow what a great drink. They first brought out warm sweet rolls that were served in a hot pan right from the oven.   My entree was the Chego Pork Belly Bowl.  Wow. Best bowl ever!  It was loaded with the right mix of fried egg, radish, broccoli, cotija and peanuts.   This place will not disappoint!   A must try for anyone looking for a great meal in an outstanding location.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Back bar in dining room

ks_y67yChkpeOrze9OfZzw.text: Holy crap!! It was amazing went with a party of 8 and WOW they really took good care of us brought us refills on all our drinks before we even asked, And the food was really amazing. Yes there is way more seating than you see in the front. I'm definitely going next time I'm at the park.

-Lj-ON0nQJmcByXrA2wpCw.text: LA Inspired + 90s inspired decor/vibe + Korean + Mexican =  Best Friend...I'm so down with this...  BF Service & Ambiance: The facade gives this convenience store vibe that houses the host station and a full bar.  There's merchandise and cocktails to buy in this colorful room filled with 90s pop decor and the bar is overloaded with stickers on the bar top.  Walk through the hallway and you're in the main dining area that has it's own bar.  Vaulted ceilings have plants hanging down, DJ booth is pumping jams, and massive monitors display video decor.  Our first visit we popped in unannounced (no reso) and were lucky to get 4 seats at the bar in the main dining area.  Our bartenders/servers were awesome.  Friendly, good mixology skills and checked on us frequently.  The kitchen got our dishes to us quickly.  If there was a way to reserve seats at the bar, I would.  Great work.  BF Cuisine: They start you off with warm Hawaiian rolls and we ordered the Koji Short rib tacos as an appetizer.  Small in size but massive in flavor. FYI if you're used to complimentary banchan dishes at your local Korean restaurants, they're $4 a dish here.  I wish the Chego Pork Bowl had more pork but it was tasteful and overall very good.  The BFF's shaking beef saltado was the better dish: Packed with beef and fries, it was savory, she couldn't finish it, so I was there for the assist!   The A-Frame OG Ribs were decent but pricey considering the amount of ribs you received. The Elotes street corn was delish and definitely a repeat order. The strawberry cheesecake is their best dessert imo. The cheesecake itself is not too sweet and it comes with a strawberry mousse, and strawberry sherbet.  Fantastic.  I tried the watermelon and hibiscus soju slushie and it was refreshing and good-tasting but tame in terms of alcohol content.  This is a very heavy social media friendly resto for your fans.  Overall, the chow is pricey, full-flavored but on the smaller side in terms of quantity.   Your LA Foodie friends will want to visit when they come to town and this is a place to come with big groups so everyone can sample up.  I love the ambiance and the 90s theme.  The service is top notch friendly and I'm looking forward to trying more of their dishes in the near future.  That's another tale though, enjoy! =)

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Cheesecake
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A-Frame OG Ribs

F-zSjZVUdPbgTFPsBLHaag.text: Hip vibe; the waiters had cool 90s style theme sweat suits as their uniform. We ordered the chicken which was good but we were really disappointed in the $19 side of veggies. I think they need to add more higher quality veggies instead of adding a whole lot of sliced onions (which is what the dish mostly consisted of). I would've rather ordered the $22 ribs, which would've been a better value. Also the waiter didn't make it clear that the veggies were not included with the chicken that we ordered. Regardless the $19 veggies were a rip off.

kJHn4Q--pkb2qWfTOye5MA.text: Food was exceptional, super cool atmosphere.  Kimchi fried rice a must have, ( caution it has a kick to it).  Short ribs you must have and then before they come order another, you will thank me!

Gyj0Go7tV2jdRWKDOog2sA.text: So many restaurants in vegas try to sell themselves as a singular dining experience, only for most of them to fall disappointingly flat. Here, Best Friend delivers. The menu was fine tuned, with each item staying True to the restaurants unique upscale/street theme. Yet there was enough options to satisfy my group's varying tastes. And OH the Food. The complementary Hawaiian rolls, well there's really only one word: scrumptious. I have had many tacos in my life, but the Kogi Short Rib Tacos will definitely stand out in my memory. The slippery shrimp was another universal favorite. Between all of us, we had the Elotes, the Carnitas Tacos, the Cheggo Pork Belly Bowl, and cold noodles. The words "Fantastic" "Amazing" "Delicious" may have flown back and forth over our plates several times. My only warning is that the Pork Belly Bowl has some SERIOUS kick. If you dont do spicy, dont do this bowl. Also, I Have to mention that the service was on point. Danny was friendly, helpful, and informative. Maybe it's the LA in me, but I love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kogi short rib tacos

QwlatyAOTmpc_hXKUZ7wsg.text: No words to describe this place other than amazing! If you enjoy food as much as I do you can't go wrong with this place!

dQ4uUAyKxqqLNo8IYeEZuw.text: Dont have much to say besides this was one of me and my husbands best meals in vegas...and compared to much more expensive places. Laid back and delicious!

pUeeMvcBiMEFdMHcV_ztXQ.text: Everything was amazing! We had a great time! The date cake was delicious. I would definitely come back and recommend to other people.

LlhsL2Px1bl1OWsA9tDqMQ.text: I had the pleasure of introducing friends to the culinary carnival that is in every dish at a Roy Choi restaurant. And then I had the pleasure of being introduced to the man himself by our awesome waiter Sam. We shared a greatest hits tasting menu plus a few plates we couldn't resist trying. Pork Belly bowl was the table favorite, made me remember when I could have the Hen House on my way home from work. The date cake dessert with a candle for my girlfriend's birthday (and no singing! whew!) should be the new all-American apple pie.

SHAnodxerug-gX3UzBEOdA.text: Had the best meal here! It's hard to figure out where to go in Vegas with all the options, but SO glad we made a reservation and ate here. Every dish was unique and delicious and the vibe in the restaurant was so much fun, casual and cool. Amazing service too. We had to consciously not come back every night for dinner because we would have happily.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dumplings and wings

2adlsC2xBT2CmBFo6p1LCA.text: I reserved table for 2 through Open Table for 12/25/18 @ 8pm, arrived a few minutes early and was seated right away. On that particular day they were in operation 6 days total. The vibe was 90s era, great music, staff dressed in throw back hip hop wear (track suits, bucket hat...only thing missing gold chains). I came for the food so let me start off by saying it was delicious, very tasty. What I didn't appreciate were the up charges for everything from rice to kimchee, and the meager portion sizes. Waiter was inattentive. He made up for it by giving a 20% employee discount. I ordered Kalbi for $18 (equal to lunch size portion), my daughter had spicy pork belly for $15. The normally gratuitous side dishes and rice were priced at $2.50 for 1/2 cup rice, and $4 each for kimchee, spinach, bean sprouts, daikon, cucumbers, etc (with no free refills). The food arrives in spurts; I got my Kalbi first and waited another 7 minutes for the rest of food to arrive before we dug in. To keep the bill reasonable we stuck to drinking tap water, but when we needed a refill on the 8 oz goblet, waiter was nowhere to be found. The food runner accidentally brought us a bottle of carbonated water. Before the discount my bill was $72.   I would not recommend this establishment if you're trying to stay within budget; you can get more for your buck (e.g. Lee's Korean BBQ on Spring Mountain and Rainbow offers all you can eat for $19.99-$34.99/person....rice and kimchee included!)

WkKmbJd50yYHoiGK8LPTSw.text: This place was amazing and we wish we could have tried more things on the menu. Great place for two but super fun for a group. we ordered ALL of the banchan but our favorites were the tofu and the spicy cucumbers. We also had the dumplings, kimchi fried rice, Korean wings and sundae for two. Everything was SO good. If we had more people, we would have tried some of the bbq plates as well. Cocktails are a little pricey ($18) but hey, you're in Vegas and supposed to be having fun, right?  we are definitely looking forward to coming back soon and bringing our friends

yNobEHRVQWyl62dmc1o5nQ.text: Came from la to Eat here tonight because I'm a huge fan of Roy Choi food and it was such a treat !!!! Had a server named Danny , he made some amazing initial suggestions so once we started eating we got almost everything he suggested !!! The slippery shrimp were amazing and my boyfriend loveeeeed the kimchi friend rice , the kogi short rib tacos were so tender and had the perfect amount of spice to add a kick !!!! Everything was wonderful from the staff to the food itself , Danny made us feel soo welcome and really made it personable. Can't wait to come back !!!!

-CgvmZ9NNEeH9o45Rlre3Q.text: Food wasn't necessarily special when compared to other Korean restaurants, cocktails were GREAT and A+ for concept.  Overall fun experience.

OogQrhRKcEBICTRn_5Ztag.text: Vegan review: Let me start of by stating the positives- excellent service. With this being said, I want to focus more on the quality and quantity of food. The food quantity  is very little. The place is over priced and definitely not worth paying one penny for. The vegan options are very limited and the ones that they have are not at all worth trying. My friends and I didn't like the food at all. Just thought I would write a review to help out the vegan community out there.  Again this is vegan food experience not sure how the non vegan food is like.

-YEnSNHizJqRU29LT6Eb1g.text: My friends and I are vegan. The food was TERRIBLE. I honestly can't believe we paid so much money for horrible food and atmosphere.   We ordered the cucumber and jjang. You are given 8 to 9 cucumber sticks with some dip. We paid $7 dollars. Then we got the BBQ veggies .. Seriously we got a sizzler with veggies with no flavor for $13. Then the veggie hot pot. Just a bunch of curry and vegetables... The flavor profile was oil and curry paste. You can taste each one separately in different bites. Then we got the Los vegan salad. The fried rice was undercooked. The salad it self was better than any of the other options  The spoons smelled like fish.  Honestly it was TERRIBLE. I don't know the meat options but the vegan options were not worth the time and money to get to the strip to eat it

PYILfSrkSxMAlDSFgBBXWw.text: Good flavor you can get at Korean restaurant. Heavy on mayo. Will I come back?? No, unless I stay at this hotel. Not a place I purposely will go stay at.

6wmiRKiy6kxDGbA39qLCrQ.text: Our favorite place to eat this trip. We were fortunate enough to be able to walk up get 4 seats at the bar, Danny was the best thing to ever happen to a server & the food was on point!

emmTi93mEpEwGh0gszusWg.text: I have been wanting to try some Roy Choi's food for a long time! Since I was in Vegas I was so excited to go. The bar was awesome, loads of cool and interesting things to look at and the host staff was very accommodating since we were not able to make a reservation. They even got us a table writhing 10 minutes. Our waiter was awesome and explained how we should order to get the most out of our experience. We decided to get the chefs selection menu.  Oh did that not disappoint. We started with these rolls that were like little pillows of heaven. That was followed by these amazing Korean ribs that were spicy and sticky and sweet.  NExt was the tempura shrimp in this wonderfully spicy and sweet sauce. Then the big guns showed up in the form of the pork belly rice bowl. It was perfectly cooked with a delicious hoisin based sauce!! If all of this weren't enough, our next offering was the tacos!! MAN ALIVE... they were awesome. We each got a delicious carnitas taco and pork belly taco. Low and behold our next to the last item we're delicious grilled elotes. Finally, the dessert portion of our dinner, a date and chocolate cake with caramel ice cream and whip cream. Best Friends hit a home run in my book for the fabulous food to the exceptional service. It truly is deserving of all 5 stars!!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best friends

nlLPWBG4MyPAyou_R_elhA.text: We recently vacationed in Vegas, always a favorite dining destination, and found our way to Best Friend, recommended by our best friend in Los Angeles! A longtime fan of Roy Choi's other offerings, we were stoked to try this one.  Initially we were wowed by the cocktail program which was an updated take on favorite 80's cocktails. The updated fuzzy navel with muddled peaches was our favorite, and we doubled down on this one. So good!  The menu was divided between traditional Korean fare, and modern Roy Choi creations. We opted for the traditional Korean BBQ feast and weren't sorry for that choice.  The star of the show for us was the Uni Dynamite Fried Rice. Without a doubt the showstopper of the menu and the standout for the KBBQ feast option. Our server kindly noticed the kitchen was nearly out of the Uni Dynamite fried rice and snagged one for us and fired it on the front end of our KBBQ feast instead of the end, and that was a very clutch maneuver.  We'll be back for the progressive takes on the old favorite cocktails, and definitely for the Uni Dynamite Fried Rice. Honorable mention for the yummy buttery puffy rolls.

Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All the excellent KBBQ accoutrements.

VSDGXdigmSiWElJl4tIoyg.text: Completely and utterly delicious. From the outside it looks like a store front retail shop. Little do you know what's inside, much like a really good surprise or a good song. Give this place a try.   Renowned food truck in LA, now upscale and beautiful inside Park MGM. Servers in adidas track suits, super attentive, and just plain cool.   We ordered couple dishes served family style: street corn, kalbi tacos, grilled veggies, and Kim chee fried rice. No dessert because this was our second lunch of the day and we were full.   Thanks for the good time Roy Choi's. We'll be back again and will order everything on the menu.

XQPXbvD7pGI6-Oq4t_YzJA.text: This is one of the best dining experiences I've had in Las Vegas. The food was killer, the staff was awesome from beginning to end, and the bar in front of the restaurant serves up great, inventive drinks.   I love the aesthetic of the place and would easily visit time and time again. I can't say enough good things about it.

NcWxZWyocvv0jrW4i-1n6A.text: Ok... wished I could've given my BF a 5 star review, but a 4.25 isn't bad right?   Why?  Not sure if it's the new rage, but having club music blasting while trying to enjoy the company of good friends and great food doesn't seem to be our thing.     The food... the slippery shrimp was the best!  The what shrimp?!?  Yes, that's right... slippery shrimp!   As odd as the name, it was quite delicious.  Paired with the kimchi fried rice and kalbi or spicy pork, made for a solid dinner.    The dessert... a work of art and delectable with every bite.  Not sure how they formed a cheese cake in the shape of a swirl, but bravo!  The menu... OMG, chef's pics of his "back in days crew" inserted into the menu brought back so many memories, that I became nostalgic and momentarily longed for my Days of Thunder.

Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7va1eDgmDdQceMZXk7NR1w.text: WSOP Day 35 @ Aria Poker  "Did you hear me?  We didn't eat all day.   We're about to eat you if we don't get food NOW.  Not  5 min to Frogger across the valet and get the car, 5 for the light to change to cross the boulivard, 20 in traffic, 2 not to run over people in the parking lot, 1 to walk to the resto door just to be told the wait will be 2 hours.  No.  Food NOW!"  to nods of agreement from the group.  "And they better have kim chee".  Enter Best Friend.    Koreanish, Asian fusion food designed by bad a$$ chef Roy Choi  for the Cali palate AKA hipster street food all prettied up for its IG moment.  Good use of fresh locally sourced veg and microgreens, deeply marinated items, flavorful sauces all with well controlled heat for the masses.  And yes, they have kim chee.  Note:  Banchan is NOT free.  $4 each.  Fresh (except the in house aged, well fermented kim chee) but no different from your local KBBQ joint.  Rice is NOT free.  Carnivores, get the rack of lamb and/or dry aged tomahawk and share.  The rack of lamb is beautifully seasoned, cooked a nice mid rare and finished in a zesty kim chee chimichurri with enough garlic, fish sauce and fermented goodness to bring out the gamey notes of the lamb and add the umami finish.  The dry aged tomahawk, well prepared, cooked close to temp (slightly over) finished with a compound gochujang butter.  Slight heat and fermented bean paste works like the lamb enhancing the bleu cheese funk and boosting the umami finish.  The LA Sh*t selections comparison good but don't wow.  Korean / Mex fusion is played out.  Good Korean fusion tacos (kogi short rib taco), flavorful but not much different from others.  Tender, sweet,  but over seasoned  hoisin chili baby back ribs (A-Frame OG Ribs).    Korean BBQ items are good.  Marinades strong and sweet.  Zero complaints on the Kalbi and spicy pork.  Both have a nice char finish and hints of pear sweetness but neither  significantly better necessarily than your fave top notch KBBQ joint.  Energetic servers.  Some lapses (it's hard to eat without a knife).  Solid and thanks to the celebrity of the chef and understanding its Strip location, one where you won't mind paying 3x-4x what you would at an KBBQ joint.

pNRIS6u07-mdKBQe96N-oQ.text: The restaurant was full when we arrived for our Monday 7:30pm reservation.  We got there early and waited in their very cool-looking bar area in the front.  We waited less than 10 minutes before we were brought to the dining room past the vinyl curtains.  Lots of things on the menu sounded good, and we ended up ordering the Slippery Shrimp, BBQ chicken, and a dish with rice and veggies.  (I forgot the name of it.)  For dessert we split the strawberry cheesecake and to drink I had a non-alcoholic slushee.  Everything was really good and I'd recommend all the dishes we got!  Including the free rolls that came with our meal :)  I will say though that they use paper straws so my slushee was hard to drink after a little while, a bit annoying but won't complain about their effort to eliminate plastic.    Tables in our section were close enough so that you could hear your neighbor's conversation, but far enough for a person to walk through to get to the bench seat along the wall.  Also, their meals are served family-style which means portions are huge, so come with a big appetite if you come with a small party!  Our server was good, not as enthusiastic or knowledgeable as the guy who served the table next to us, but then again we really didn't ask many questions and I was pleased with the service we received.  (So perhaps she was just as knowledgeable.)  I definitely recommend checking out Best Friend!

ftH35eFpggUzcPNa9-VQEg.text: Looking for a fun and chill vibe from the 90's? This restaurant has it going on. I love the whole aesthetics. The entrance vibe is almost like a liquor store/hang out you've seen in the movies. I love the liquor store vibe and even the merch they sell. I definitely want one of those best friend jackets, and hat. The restaurant itself is dope, and the music selection was off the hook. I found myself singing along admiring the staffs jumpsuit. I am definitely jealous, u wish my employers would of let me rock one.  Onto the food, both visits I ordered the tomahawk, and both times they were amazing! Perfectly seasoned and cooked, it pairs well with the kimchi fried rice. Which the kimchi fried rice is delicious and has a perfect texture. I am drooling just thinking about it! The banchan sides are sold individually or as a sampler- I wish they were included like most Korean spots. But I guess you gotta pay a lil more for the experience.  Overall the prices may be high, but the experience and quality makes it except-able for special occasions or date night! Hey! Would I come back- hell yah! Anytime soon, nah- I don't wanna burn myself out from over indulging.

HQlwfWHeYOyv8pPVlHNFBw.text: "Sometimes, in the deepest moments, there are no words. There is only food."  Roy Choi  Have you ever been to a backyard BBQ in Koreatown, LA during the 90's? Yeah, me neither but this was the vision.  I was hoping to love everything about Best Friend and with all these great reviews, I was shocked when our dinner didn't match up with everyone else's. We ordered a wide variety of items like banchan [kimchi, cucumbers, and brussel sprouts], Korean wings, dumplings, tacos [carnitas and short rib], and some itaewon [army stew] for good measure. We also had some cocktails and a bottle of wine. So what the heck happened?  The carnitas were dry, the Korean wings were okay, the dumplings disintegrated as soon as you try to pick them up, the banchan was vinegary, and the itaewon was a super concentrated sodium bomb. The itaewon was the thing we all got hung up on the most and were the most disappointed with. There was pretty much no broth in the itaewon so it was like we were eating spoonfuls of Gochujang and nothing else. Check out the picture I took. It may look like tomato paste but nope... just over-rendered army stew, folks. That stew is seriously like the ex-lover with more baggage than a bellhop. Just bad flavor and bad texture all around.  Roy Choi, I came to Best Friend wanting to walk away with you as my best friend but we're more like best frenemies. I guess a "Roy x Joy" collaboration wasn't in the cards. I wanted a mix tape of love songs but what I got was a diss track.  :(  Posted on April 1st because I felt like a True April fool for trying this place out.

8NRNZfGMVQLWWAhrzhYP3w.text: Sorry, Roy Choi. We are not "Best Friends." This reason for this 1-star review is the food quality. The customer service is great but this place needs improvement to validate its ridiculous prices.  If you are looking for drunk food with salt bomb, this is the place for you. I did not look at the reviews on this restaruant since I wanted to come here blind with no bias opinions. I rather go to Chinatown to get better food or throw $200 on black on the roulette table in Las Vegas.   The stew was done technically wrong. It was suppose to be a stew and it came out as a thick spaghetti sauce. You are known for your tacos since you came from a taco food truck. Guess what? The meat is dry with no flavor.  We had two different tacos, some Korean wings, dumplings, banchan, and a stew. The tacos were way dry. The dumplings are okay but they fell apart. The wings were okay too. The banchan has too much vinegar and the stew was thick and salty.   Thank u, next.

BSoBxzWxOrROZcJ4WZv7cw.text: One word, delicious!  Tip: Expect family style dining. It's best to share a couple dishes. Our party of 4 shared 5 plates and we were stuffed and had leftovers.   Umi dynamite: So tasty, I could eat this all day. It is a little small for what you pay, but it's Umi!  Slippery Shrimp: Yum, the spices has a nice kick!  Dumplings: good, thin skin, tasty filling  Short rib tacos: Honestly I expected more, they were good but didn't blow me away  Overall, excellent!

LFm6HVHSS9QjXQmc0v0R6Q.text: I've been to Best Friend a few times now and I've enjoyed the food and service the times I've been here. I highly recommend getting a reservation because you'll be sorry if you don't especially on a weekend where the wait could be at least 2 hours! Yikes!  Upon entering, the place looks like an Asian market selling Asian snacks and junk food from different countries like Japan, China, Korea, Philippines, etc. You can also buy Best Friend merchandise. They have dining tables here too. On our first time, we assumed that people at the table next to the host booth worked there and we were about to ask them about our reservation until we got closer and saw they were eating! Oops!  The hostesses wear a red dress and a red jacket and they lead you through the red plastic dividers to get into the restaurant that looks busy with murals, pictures, and plants hanging. At the table, you'll find those Catholic votive candles with Our Lady of Guadalupe and Archangel Saint Michael, and other hints of Mexican culture since this place is owned by Roy Choi - the man who started the whole Korean - Mexican food amalgamation with his Kogi food truck in L.A.  The servers wear Adidas track suits in green or red. And they're all fantastic. You'll be handed a yellow binder which is the menu. The vibe and the music will take you back to the late 80's-early 90's. They'll give you some Hawaiian rolls while you wait for your food.  I love everything I've tried here:  Dumplings - 4/5 Slippery Shrimp - mild spicy kick. Lightly breaded and pleasantly crisp. 5/5 Elotes - no fluff, just good Mexican corn 4/5 Uni Bowl - 4/5 Veggie Bowl - slightly on the spicy side but all the banchan combined with rice and egg on top. 4/5 Kalbi - 4/5 Kalbi Tacos - 4/5 Strawberry Cheesecake - I love the presentation! Very creative and whimsical. I hate to say this but it's IG-worthy and it tastes good 5/5 Mango Budino - 4/5

U87qx5vCq8UV9PdMFthaUA.text: There's no better place for a late night best friend dinner date than at Best Friend in The Park MGM.  My best friend and I were eager to get our grub on after an watching an exciting Knights game earlier that evening. While we were worried their might be a long wait when we arrived at Best Friend, we were pleasantly surprised as the hostess greeted us and told us we could be seated immediately. She walked us through a short hallway with large red plastic blinds. As you push through, your suddenly enter an cozy candlelit oasis with hanging plants on the ceiling and cute city themed decor around all edges of the restaurant. I really loved the spin they put on their decor to where it has an Asian flair and city vibes with a cozy ambiance all in one. Who knew all three of those things could work so well together!  Now let's get to the important part, the food! While their late night menu is smaller than their traditional menu, it still had a great selection of Mexican and Korean bbq inspired items to choose from. We ordered the LA street dog, Korean wings, Kobi tacos, Carnitas tacos, and a side of kimchi. Everything we ate was extremely delicious and flavorful with the slight exception of the carnitas tacos (they needed some sort of sauce to add flavor because the meat itself was somewhat bland). The Korean wings were so deliciously spicy though that I honestly wish I ordered more than one order of them (although my mouth may have been on fire if I did that haha).   All in all I really enjoyed the food and ambiance that Best Friend offers. I also enjoyed the music selection the DJ was playing that night-nothing better than late 80s and early 90s jams to get your night going! Thank you to the wonderful prompt staff at Best Friend who seated us and waited on us. They were absolutely wonderful and thank you to the chef who made the most amazing Mexican and Korean items for us that night! We will see you soon Best Friend!

RIsNGosG7CtDl75X6k9K-g.text: This *should* have been a 5 star review, but two major points made it a solid 4 star. Let me explain...  We travel to Vegas two or three times a year and are always in search of new experiences and places to dine. While staying at the Bellagio back in December we heard some buzz about Best Friend. We looked into it when we got home, became excited and booked a reservation for our March trip.  We made an early reservation for Friday evening before heading to The Cosmopolitan to see Opium. We loved Best Friend. We loved the decor. We loved the vibe. We loved the music. We loved the service (our waiter was awesome). We loved the drinks. And we LOVED the food.   So let's start with the food and drinks. We opted to go with the Korean BBQ ($65 per person). I had a couple of Asahi Super Dry beers (highly recommended light tasty beer with dinner) and Heather opted to try a Watermelon & Hibiscus Soju before switching to a beer with me for her second bevy. Drinks were great.  The Korean BBQ was absolutely amazing. Banchan Sampler to start was plentiful and delicious. The salad was crazy good. The Uni Dynamite Rice was served lava hot and amazing. We loved the BBQ Garlic Chicken, but the BBQ Spicy Pork was our favorite dish.  And we asked to sub the Strawberry Cheesecake dessert for the Mejool Date Cake (which is the dessert offering on the L.A. Love Story dinner option). We were glad we did as it was fantastic. This was honestly SUCH an incredible meal and fun time.  So why only a 5 Star Rating? As I said, two reasons. First off, we paid by Visa. We tipped generously (as was deserved) but when we got home and it converted to Canadian dollars this ended up being a $310 meal. Now as awesome as this was, it WAS NOT $310 awesome. A comparable Korean meal at home would run us a third of this. I understand we were stung by Vegas strip casino restaurant mark up, but my god that was excessive.I'm not saying we wouldn't return, but we would be much more cautious on the pricing of items.  Issue #2 is that we never did receive the BBQ Kalbi beef that was part of our meal. Now to be honest we never asked... there was already more food than we could handle and we weren't interested in taking leftovers as our room didn't have a fridge (and we didn't want to cart a bag of food with us all evening). But at the price the are charging here they should probably be   bit more conscious that you actually get all the food you are paying for. Again, we just decided to let it go as we were full and our server would have been all over it had we mentioned something. Just worth noting when pricing was so high.  I think next time we would look at sharing something smaller and a beer. We aren't cheap, but the price here for Korean food was a tad shocking.

5--IfmgpOsM6FCTQ0FCF1w.text: Had some friends in town and had this place bookmarked for a while so decided to give it a try. We came as soon as they opened at 5pm Saturday (it got busy pretty quickly) and ordered the following items: Korean fried chicken, short rib tacos, the slippery shrimp, kalbi ribs, kimchi fried rice, and the veggie bowl (which is basically bibimbop). So I had higher hopes for this place given the owner (who actually happened to be there that night with a camera crew), but after trying everything I'd have to say the food was just too bland for me. My friends thoroughly enjoyed everything but the shrimp (I don't eat shrimp so I couldn't give my opinion). So I thought that the beef missing something, maybe it was not marinated enough I'm not sure, but I was expecting a more savory bite. The same goes with the chicken wings. They just seemed to be covered in a generic hot sauce, which did have a slight kick, but was not sweet or savory like I'm used to. The dipping sauce was very watery as well and did not add any flavor to the wings. However, I truly did enjoy the kimchi fried rice the most, which was unexpected. So even though I wasn't super impressed with the food, I really did appreciate the decor of the restaurant with LA style art that had Mexican and Korean influence. The waiters were dressed in track suits or white t-shirts and khakis. The music was awesome lol we were jamming to it. The service was very quick and the staff was super nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchi fried rice
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slippery Shrimp
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short run tacos

IYeK7T2wmFmwRC_mvmdw1w.text: So nice we had it twice.    Just returned from Vegas yesterday and I'm so happy we decided to ditch our original dinner plans on Friday and try Roy Choi's Best Friend.    The location:  Front of Park MGM.  The throwback 80's style signage is hip and fresh. The Vibe:  This place is best summed up in one word....Cool!  DJ spinning hip hop from the 80's and 90's really added to the cool factor here as well as all the servers dressed in Adidas jumpsuits with a few expos dressed as B-Boys.   The service:  Top notch.  We were late arrivals (on both nights) so we had to grab a seat at the bar which was surprisingly easy considering how packed the place was.  Our server/bartender was attentive and incredibly friendly.  She made some great recommendations. The food:  OMG THE FOOD!  Do yourself a favor and try the slippery shrimp.  It was perfect.  We also had the pork belly bowl which was great as well.  The rice soaked up the spicy sauce and really paired well with the beer we got. The price:  It actually was not bad AT ALL!  A meal for 2 with 2 drinks was about $70.  In Vegas, that's a deal!  For the ambiance, service, food quality and overall feel, this place has earned it's spot as one of my absolute favorites in Vegas. As the title said, we ate their twice.  Friday and Saturday night.  This is rare for my wife and I as we always like to try something new.....but this place made such a great first impression, we had to do it again. Do yourself a favor, try Best Friend.  You'll love it!

cfnOFQUCIBgnZPQZHA12QA.text: Had an excellent dining experience with best friend in Vegas! I have heard about Roy's food truck long time ago, and noticed that he opens a restaurant in park mgm hotel, and I happened to live at mgm! Fusion of Korean  Food is very creative! And galbi is in a A+ quality! Service is good too! The only disappointing dish is the kimchi fried rice! It looks like but not that flavorful! I know it is the kimchi that make the rice very salty and spicy, but this is the only taste of that dish!!!( I have tried kimchi rice from so many other Korean restaurants, they are more flavorful). And the rice is tooooo wet for the fried rice! Besides that, all of my other dishes are outstanding! Definitely recommend the kalbi and pork belly bowl!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken wing
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complementary Hawaii roll

NJy0juzQId08zmOLSoUsFg.text: Great new place at the Park MGM  The front is styled like a Bodega from the 80's and then you go through freezer curtains in to a 90's styled nicer dining room. Had the watermelon cocktail which was amazing. We also had the pork belly bowl, marinated cucumbers, dumpling (sooooo paper thin and delicious). Finished up with a shaved ice! Bartender in the bodega last night was awesome, bar stools were comfortable, atmosphere was friendly and fun. CHECK THIS PLACE OUT!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paper thin and amazing dumplings
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QhdC4YxrVQbJzqw-MxHoAQ.text: Bummed to post this follow up but I've been to Best Friend 2 more times since the opening and the experience has been subpar.   The second time I went, half the food came out cold and we had to send it back. We tried the Uni Dynamite Rice and it came out cold and was not good. When they brought it out again it was piping hot and delicious. The spicy pork was bland the second time around. On the other hand, the tacos were even better than the first time. Also tried the Shaking Beef Saltado and it was the standout dish for us for sure. Tried a couple more of the pots, the doritang and itaewon. This is definitely a fusion that does not work for me. My non-korean friends seemed to enjoy the doritang but it was a little too different for my taste. The itaewon was a pretty big miss for the whole time - too salty for everyone.   Third visit, the spicy pork this time was WAY oversauced and again came out cold. The beef saltado was not as good as the first time as it was also too salty. We got the bingsoo and the date cake for dessert again and the bingsoo had huge chunks of ice in it that were hard to eat and the cake was very dry.  Overall, I still love Roy and his vision and respect his recipes. I think the biggest issue is that the other times I've gone he has not been in the kitchen. Because both the 2nd and 3rd visit were a very different experience from the 1st. Hopefully, I'll catch Roy the next time we go.

612mPOlzRkGRPMgtou-aDQ.text: This is a late post but I still wanted to review this place. We went during restaurant week and they had a great prix fix meal. It was a great deal to be able to try a variety their menu that includes apps, main course and dessert. We had the slippery shrimp, banchan and kalbi tacos for apps, bbq chicken and pork belly with fried rice for entrees and date cake with toffee ice cream for dessert. Everything was tasty and flavorful. It all had that authentic Korean flavors with a twist on some. It was so much food and great for sharing. My absolute favorite was the date cake with ice cream. It was one of my favorite desserts eaten at a restaurant for me. The cake was served warm with the delicious toffee ice cream. It was heaven. I thought I wasn't going to have room for it since I had already ate so much but it was demolished. The vibe in the restaurant is busy and very L.A. street vibe. It was very busy so be sure to make reservations as we did and still had to wait an extra 15 min before seated. It was worth it and the price was good since we ate there on a special week. I would definitely return here to try more food. They have really cool cocktails too but I know I want more of that dessert.

Ct-Z5pui2sVOy3wqoeNiAg.text: Fantastic spot! We orered pretty much everything on the menu and it did not disappoint. The atmosphere was awesome! It's definitely and experience going there.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ntg4en-Tzn0Acfb8sG6PgQ.text: Headed here after the Janet Jackson show. The ambiance is really cool, it felt like a store with multiple items. The actual restaurant is really cool and our server is great! We ordered KBBQ chicken with kimchi and rice - food was more than enough for the two of us. Kid ordered an alcoholic beverage and she said it is very good. Highly recommended!!

xN2hvsZXFZaoeKVHIRLdLg.text: It was soo fun eating here! Reservations a must btw, they just opened this month. There's a really cool set up in the front with open seating bar. The hostess is in the front under a cash register thing when you check in. The entrance to the restaurant is through two red slat openings and it turns into this cool LA downtown vibes with a real DJ and everything! The music was pretty cool for a Sunday night.  The free bread in the beginning is delicious like a salty warm Hawaiian bread. I highly recommend the kogi tacos and the pork belly bowl, I was stuffed! The French fries and the dipping sauce that came with it was amazing! The kimchi fried rice was meh, wouldn't order again. Almost forgot, the strawberry daiquiri slushie was awesommmeeeee!

Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bZtksDhreSVYKlIRobKmxg.text: I used to eat Kogi every week when they parked outside my work in LA. Love Roy Choi's vision, big fan of him personally.   Ate here last night (Tues)...Wish I could give it 5 stars but the service was just bad. The hosts were rude and seemed put off that we wanted to sit, despite having a reservation. They had us wait and immediately sat another group who walked in after us. We let it go..   Our waiter, Korey, was running around with such haste we could barely get a word in. The one time he came by (to take our drink/food order at the same time) he was so quick to take off it felt like we were being completely cut off. Expos brought our food out and Korey never came back despite checking on all the tables around us. He forgot the kimchi I ordered probably because of his haste I mentioned above. Finally we had to go order a 2nd round of drinks from the bartender directly. Korey dropped the drinks off but was clearly annoyed about us taking matters into our own hands. Later he dropped the check and just said "here you go." No thank you, no sorry it was busy, no have a good night. Zero acknowledgement. After reading other reviews, it seems like the bad service is a trend here.  Food was good. Kimchi fried rice was burnt but I guess that was intentional? We still liked it. The spicy pork was good as were the short rib tacos. Everything was overpriced though.. and the soups? I've never seen a Soondubu or Kimchee Chigae for more than $10-15 usd. $40 usd is insaneeee. I'm Korean I can go to Korea and get the best tasting stews for $5 usd, c' mon.   All in all food was pretty good but service really makes or breaks it. There's nothing worse than having a bad experience when you're spending all this money. Probably not gonna come back any time soon when there's so many bomb restaurants in Vegas.   For Roy's sake, retrain your staff on respect for customers, also get more servers on the floor! We never saw a manager.. didn't appear to be anyone running things last night.   Really cool vibe/aesthetic tho... makes me really miss LA and the Kogi truck.

E94BQT8yIxNYMXVc9ubHMw.text: The Journey of Two Words:  Excited. Hopeful.  to Disappointed. Regretful.  Preface: When Kogi first started out, I was waiting in occasionally hour long lines on Wednesdays outside of the Golden Gopher just for a taste of those scrumptious short rib tacos with a squeeze of the triangle orange slices they used to give out.  Order: Hennessy and Coke slushy Kalbi Korean wings Short rib tacos  Situation: We got there after 10 PM not knowing that there was a late night menu so that's our bad. We were hoping for the dinner menu and tried to make the best of it. The Hennessy and Coke slushy and kalbi were awesome. I was so excited for the short rib tacos of yesteryear, but these weren't it. The marinade wasn't right, which the meat had been sitting in too long. Not fresh and completely overcooked. The slaw was all wrong and where was the salsa flavor?! The Korean wings were basically buffalo wings, which I hate, so not impressed at all. No hint of that Asian sweetness AT ALL. I provided feedback to the waiter when asked how everything was and he was indifferent. I will never go back. I'm upset I wasted a Vegas meal here!!!  There are varying priced deliciousness just mere steps away. Good luck competing with that...

DOIpg7RnkO60CA07Cbr7bA.text: Was happy to hear that a Korean place opened on the strip and in a casino however I was really disappointed in the food. This is not a traditional Korean place nor a Mexican place but whatever it is the food ought to taste good unfortunately it was not. Here's a rundown our group of 4 had   Mixed Tempura :  2 small pieces of shrimp and a heap of vegetables. Just decent   Banchan: in every other Korean restaurant these are free and plentiful here they charge you for it. We ordered 2 Kim chi and it was not good. It came in a tiny metal bowl and was over fermented. We didn't even finish what little they gave because it tasted that bad.   Kimchi Fried Rice :  has no flavor. Tasted like rice and sesame seed oil with an egg. Not good   Dumplings :  this was actually probably the best dish we had. They were flavorful and the dipping sauce was great.   Hawaiian Bread : neither Korean nor Mexican but they were good. Had some oil brushes on top and salt.  These were complimentary there was no charge for this.   Kalbi: just decent. Not very flavorful and meat was tough. This tasted like what someone who got the recipe form a cookbook whipped up.   Salmon teriyaki :  think this is a Japanese dish but it was decent.   Soondubu:  this was the worst soondubu we ever tasted. A real stretch to call this soondubu fusion or not. It was so bad that we actually sent this dish back.   We were so disappointed in this place. We were hoping for a good Korean meal and what we got was just plain pretend Korean food.  We wouldn't even mind the prices if the food was actually good.  The service was good our waitress was friendly and nice..  four of us dined 3 were Korean and one was American. Unfortunately we will not be back.

ggz7Y36qoYFxxHNOyMiecQ.text: LA hip hop Korean cuisine. I dig it. Everything in there encompassed the LA 80s-90s culture in the eyes of a 3rd grader Roy Choi into one restaurant, like you just time travelled back to see N.W.A. and Tupac. Music is loud like a hip hop club; definitely hard for a conversation if you're not face to face.  The food we ordered was all executed well. Chicken was juicy and fell off the bone. Octopus was not too rubbery like it was massaged before it was cooked. Chicken wings came from chicken like they actually enjoyed a good life - small but full of flavor. Everything had a heavy hand of gochujang, a Korean spicy paste.  But all easily findable in LA, but not so easily in Vegas.   Service is good. Even Roy Choi the man himself came through.  The place has room to grow, but definitely off to a great start.

3J9cscVM_lTjE7L9T8PQyQ.text: Omg this place is a awesome! The front looks like a bodega where you can get anything you would typically get from your favorite local corner store or bodega as well as a full bar. I had their "Henny sour apple".....so bomb. If you like henny get this drink!

zoIM6ueygsdg-CaR2UYqlg.text: Came with a large party of twenty so I don't know if that threw things off because we had a prix fixe menu. Almost everything was spicy, which I expect from Korean food, but it was one note spicy...  Everything else was nothing out of the ordinary...nothing you can't get in Korea town in la or from a Waba Grill (specifically the chicken). The tacos became fall apart soggy in the ten steps they took from the kitchen to our table. The spicy pork was mostly fat...  The joke was that the dessert that would fit this meal the most was vanilla ice cream...which we were given hidden under a mountain of whip cream.  Did I mention that the meal ran each of us about $100...  Good thing the company was good!

ROtPLylZdf4htm9IutfEUw.text: We stayed in The Park MGM and Best Friend came highly recommended by my hair stylist. Being from LA we are very familiar with the genius that is Roy Choi so our expectations were high.  The place is so freaking cool. I honestly have never seen anything like it. I really, really appreciated the attention to detail that charmingly reflected   LA's diverse multi-ethnic comfort food scene.  For those not used to eating Koreatown and LA street food, you may not appreciate the experience. It truly is a palette specific to growing up in LA (and I mean LA not Beverly Hills, The Valley or even Santa Monica).  Therefore, many of the dishes, if not all, will seem very foreign to you. Know that the flavors are intense and hot. But if you are open minded and want to take your palette to the next level. BEST FRIEND IS A MUST.  I ordered the Kogi Tacos for which Roy Choi is infamous. I have to say, that they did not taste the same as the ones I eat here in LA. Still good, just not the same.  We also got the house ramen seasoned fries. To die for. I could have eaten those every day. I highly recommend.   We also had the elote (a staple of LA street food.) This is served off the cob which was perfect because my daughter wears braces. It was pretty damn accurate in the flavor profiles but slightly elevated which made it unique to Best Friend.  I have to disclose that because I can't do super spicy anymore because of a weird skin condition, I was limited but we did find familiar and scrumptious items on the menu to enjoy.  The house "Hawaiian rolls" were all kinds of buttery fluffy just sweet enough deliciousness.  The service from the door on the table was top notch. Also, extremely well priced for the quality of the food and the experience.   Good job, Chef Choi! Way to represent The City of Angels! We are fans.

en2XLB33Z2TLe2eg1YxTAA.text: This could only be a one star when you see how much they charge for rice. It's 3 fricken dollars for the size of basically a tea cup. It's like $40 for a 50lbs bag of rice so inono where this price is coming from. Roy choi is betraying the Asian community by sticking it to us with rice. Other than that had the kalbi and spicy pork. The flavor is nothing special. You can get all this at a korean restaurant in Oakland for like half the price. And the jaymo & ginger was weak as hell. $18 for a normal size Moscow mule mug so not that big maybe bigger than my rice bowl. Tasted like a Moscow mule with zero jaymo and 100% ginger. Overall it's a 1 time thing for me, tried it didn't like it. That's $100 I'm never getting back.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The rice cup is smaller than my water cup

v3_ilH1KFCfrwBIIpfofNg.text: We came here with the family. My kids were a bit confused bc it has a bar feel. They thought this wasn't a kid friendly place. So, I had to explain this is just one part of the restaurant, the full bar. Whoever decorated this place did a great job. Very young LA vibe with all the cultures mixed in.   The food was very pricey for "street food" korean/fusion/Mexican. We ordered kimchee rice, korean wings, gogi kalbi tacos, octopus dish, shrimp, and some drinks. Food was ok. The octopus dish was my favorite and chicken wings were my least favorite. The gogi tacos were disappointing. The kimchee rice was decent. I could have gotten more for your buck in K-town. But we figured this is Vegas.   The service was awesome. Love the Hawaiian bread. The cucumber cocktail was very good. Overall experience was great. There was no wait bc we arrived at 5:00 Friday night. We sat right away. I hope they would add the octopus sauce on the wings, then maybe would be ok. Also the batter needs to be crispy seemed baked. Gogi tacos needs more flavor on the marinade.

m8EUFJeeLxcBZBUqzjkmKg.text: We had the $50 combo. It was a great mix of different foods. The dj has a fresh vibe going on. Definitely recommend!

loiFZczG5DlO4eG68eaAVA.text: Great vibe. Tasty food. We got the kimchi and slippery shrimp. The chego pork belly bowl said it had cotija and peanuts - I couldn't tell. The spicy pork was too die for. Everything was SPICY so if you are sensitive to spice best to choose something else to eat. Eat the slippery shrimp while it's hot. It doesn't take so good cold.

V_gjcyTBWtWDFT7sb1zSyw.text: Very disappointed in the service. We were sat down by the hostess, 5 to 10 mins later no one came by until we flagged the hostess down by eye contact as she saw and noticed we were unattended nor taken care of. Even our menus were closed which should be a cue or indicator we are ready to order? Seeing that our waiter was managing several tables around us but the fact he failed to even stop by to even introduce himself and that he will be with us shortly. Even others that was seated after us and adjacent was even attended before us. Honestly I would not recommend this place based on this horrible first impression. With the addition of overpriced Korean fusion, the service was just not there to justify the overall experience. The food was just ok considering that I have dined at other concepts of Roy Choi's in LA. Take your business and experience and spend else where in Vegas that is worth your money.

pwsO7EvuFXSQbkocHDmUlQ.text: The atmosphere and their tacos were good but if you're looking for efficient service then maybe go somewhere else. Our tacos and noodles came out fast but we were sitting ducks for almost an hour waiting for our family style pot of Itaewon soup. The manager didn't even know we had placed a complaint because our server didn't communicate that to him so he was dropping by every table greeting people but ours. Both server and manager blamed their slow kitchen getting adjusted to their grand opening. Maybe you should've held off on opening til y'all were ready to hustle then?? The place is cute but we're leaving here on Christmas Day hungry and beat.

7q3kWBFcJc1i0pfHLJxyJw.text: I don't know man. If you've ever been to Korean BBQ you know that banchan and rice are included with the meal. Here, each banchan item was $4. As soon as I left I wanted to go to a typical Korean bbq place to make up for the money spent here. As much as I love the aesthetics, I didn't think it lived up to the hype food-wise. One of the best things we had here were the complimentary Hawaiian rolls that come out hot and super delicious. We also ordered the kimchi cucumbers which were also very good but not any different from what I've had at other places. The wings were really good but I think we got about 6 for $15. Knowing how much food actually costs makes it really hard to enjoy things like that with such a high price tag. We also got the Chego pork belly bowl. The pork belly in it was cooked to perfection but they used waaay too much cotija cheese. It really overpowered the dish for me. We also ordered kimchi fried rice which was delicious but I didn't think it was any better than the one from the off-the-strip restaurant Komex. Overall I think I hyped this place up in my head and was left a little disappointed. Coming from SoCal I LOVED the nods to LA and the overall vibe. I also loved the menu choices but knowing how much these foods actually cost and how much they're charging ehhh left a bad taste in my mouth. I think I'd come back to try the more traditional items or large format items with a group.

_5l9692SZhXhaBxc-X6fgw.text: The finest Korean fusion food that is famous in Los Angeles is now in Las Vegas! I've been to many traditional Korean restaurants and while I loved them, they stick to the traditional taste. Roy Choi has taken Korean food to the next level and set the bar very high. The kimchi fried rice is one example of that innovation. If you are on a diet and could only eat one meal at the restaurant, that's the food that you should order. We also tried the Kalbi and spicy pork and they are superior than the other restaurants I have tried. They were perfectly marinated and were very tender. (You can tell that the meat is of high quality). I also recommend their freshly baked pan de leche. It is very aromatic and soft. If you have not tried the Kogi short rib taco, you must order it also. The combination of the crunchy marinated thinly sliced cabbage blends perfectly with the short rib and taco shell. We loved all the food (kimchi soup based with noodles, desserts, etc) that we ordered and were extremely satisfied with it.  If you like traditional Korean food, and have the willingness to try a unique take on it, I highly recommend trying Best Friend.

TPX1JBWMLW-kKHY6lGSw4Q.text: The food was waaaaaay too salty. But the kimchi jiggae was legit except for how salty it was. I was desperate for Korean food in Vegas. Otherwise i would've never eaten here.

NPTgokjVP1_fjUvXoEg9aA.text: Hey I have a nice review to the restaurant a few days ago. I guess it was taken down for that I will say honesty is a got thing. Sorry friend

3ciBtar1C6JxfiA8XvkMlQ.text: Huge Roy Choi fans and big Korean bbq eaters from LA, so we were excited to try out Best Friend. Super cool, kinda speak-easy entry from what looks like a rag-tag Korean liquor store into a big room with tables. Casual, great photography and art.  Creative menu and large portions. The tempura and dumplings were great. Surprisingly tho, the bbq wasn't  so good - the beef was so thick and fatty all my bites ended up in my napkin (the first round came out so over cooked already that it was burned and we asked for a new batch); and the chicken was just ok.  I'd come back, however, and try other menu offerings, there's a lot to choose from.

iD2ssRu6Jmzk78WCmRwNpA.text: Ohhhhh this place was awesome! Loved all the food, decor, and overall theme; different! We ordered the grilled shrimp and BBQ beef...amazing! Try the Korean tacos as well to enjoy an LA staple! Any of their grilled dishes should be safe to order as we truly enjoyed the corn as well! Make sure you make reservations in advance as they do stick to them and don't allow many walk-ins on busy nights...we tried lol. If you have the MyVEGAS app, get the free appetizer added to your account to redeem here as the bill will quickly add up. We paid roughly $100 for two people with apps, entrees, and drinks. Restaurant setting is more on the causal side.

yb_zcAns4yHCup4aIZf-cg.text: Fantastic. We had a great time. Tried a few different things from the menu. The elote was probably our favorite. We will definitely go back next time we are in Vegas.

Btm8cHTBqoqnz2qTTt5nww.text: We loved the decor and theme. But their vegan options are just ok, and astronomically over-priced.  The eggplant schnitzel was delicious. The Las Vegan was nicely-grilled veggies and rice. No fancy sauce, just veggies in oil and rice. It is $38!!!!  I mean, seriously. What the hell.

US37TaKE1oYT_75zrfV1-Q.text: Unique concept and interior design. Get the Pork Belly Bowl, tacos. Reasonable prices for the strip.

KxJCm7HVZICiQBQVYGlGzg.text: Really enjoyed the food here. Been a fan of Kogi ever since I tried their tacos more than 10yrs ago. We had the uni rice, slippery shrimp, garlic chicken, and the elotes. Great flavors and textures. Loved the butteriness of the uni. Garlic chicken came out sizzling and had a strong tare taste but seemed to mask the garlic flavor. Hawaiian rolls were a nice touch - sweet, salty, and came out piping hot. Plus, throwback theme gave me flashbacks to my own childhood. Will definitely come back!

oHVZqLX069wWXPZq66achg.text: Being that I am komex and raised in Vegas this place hands down the best in Vegas!!! Wyatt, Daniella, and Rudy have been so pleasant and informative! Gotta try short rib tacos, arancini kimchee balls, and korean wings! Fast, hot n delicioso!

AEZjIkB3vBXtFwnQLGEh-g.text: Excellent. Really great meal. Service was fast. Attentive and the food was hot and tasty. The short rib tacos were absolutely fantastic.

ZgZOqoAjdgVXpEkXkmMgWg.text: The kimchi filried rice was amazing as a shared side, and the elote brought me right back to the farmers markets I would go to in California. The tacos blew my mind, and the vibe was totally unique!

Bvw1ViU_OE1d06Imf798xQ.text: Fantastic food!  Kitschy atmosphere and fun soundtrack in bar along with the great selection of sharable eats make this a perfect pre or post event meal stop.

prl-k_q7IODCKjTcYTdoiw.text: A hot a$$ disorganized, chaotic mess. They really need to retrain some of their staff on the basics of hospitality and customer service. Very cute aesthetics and uniforms though.

gf8EnlnDW24r-r65q3CNmg.text: This place is dope! The vibe from the minute you walk in to the minute you exit is great! The food hits the spot. The flavors take your tastebuds for a ride to K-Town. It's so good we went 2 days in a row!

KotBEG06Sojl3uWCbU_8vw.text: Don't bother going here if you're alone. Tried to book a reservation on Opentable and it was wide open for 2 or more. Nothing for 1. I decided to try so I walked from the Mirage to Park MGM and got denied at the door. I won't be coming back. Too many great Korean restaurants off strip that are a lot cheaper.

5-fSbkNI2JvIcPNJ7F2r9A.text: We ordered KBBQ, fish tang, couple different ban chans, fried chicken appetizer, spicy pork & kimchi fried rice everything was so good and service was great too!  Restaurant has really cool vibe.

SeA8J8iEbfAc2dFWn9bJNg.text: Dig the vibe in here. The staff is nice. And there is a good hand full of vegetarian options. All the bar tender is nice. Pretty cool place to eat after gambling for a bit. They close at 12midnight on weekdays.

qZk2ABrkdOGBekZsh-zDMQ.text: Had dinner here with my husband family and it was the best meal I had while visiting Las Vegas. I gave the restaurant 4 stars only because I feel like the portion was pretty small compared to the price while they hype up the place to be family style. Im not a kimchi fam but the kimchi pork belly stew was bomb! Will definitely try to recreate that at home. I wasn't able to take photos as the place was too dark and it was hard to see.

cJGBDqby_XrF5ecASxtjDw.text: Really cool spot to eat but would not recommend for people over the age of 40. Food was great and the service was pretty good also. I give the servers credit because it's so hard to hear anything. Overall really cool place and would check out again with some buddies but not the best place for a date.

ExfXe_G68-P_Dex-87f4zw.text: Beautifully designed, fun and energetic staff, and delicious food.  This is now my favorite spot in Vegas for a fun cocktails and dinner experience with friends.  The chili spaghetti and bbq spicy pork are not to be missed.

CRPFhzuV3zm4Z0vOz5i7_w.text: The food is delicious, something we expected after trying Kogi in LA. The atmosphere of the restaurant was amazing! Felt at home and our waiter was great about recommending food choices and drinks. Highly recommend

pUT2X2tKOkaor-OUeXxLcQ.text: Jacke GM and our server Maritza were bomb thank-you , not only they went above and beyond but also very professional and friendly. Would surely be back

s7BB77gdgN99hCiNJgV1Iw.text: Our waiter was fantastic. We told him to surprise us and all the choices were great. From fried chicken to tacos to duck all great.

r-pIhA9Fe3pzPNMaC7JJdA.text: This place is FRESH! The outside of the restaurant makes you feel like you're in a neighborhood and you forget where you are. You see people standing out like there at the corner store. As you enter you get the feeling you're going into a Korean grocery store located in Korean Town. Then once you're in you realize the store front area is a bar. Within the bar area you realize your surrounded by pictures that represent food, culture, people, and the evolution of LA with a Vegas twist. Some might not even realize to the left of the entry way there's a fringe curtain which is a tunnel to the rest of the restaurant. Which I won't spoil the rest for you. This side is mainly entered by reservation unless you get lucky. The food was amazing we got the chego pork belly bowl, spicy pork, fries and the sundae for two. This is a place worth going to. You might even want to bring your best friends. It's a experience worth sharing.
