Bj0MDLCFtswG7SUCZlpM6g.text: Super busy! It was a game night plus a concert so we only were able to sit at the bar. Service was great, always attentive refilling our drinks. Food came out on time and relatively fast considering how packed it was. The kimchi bbq tacos were outstanding. These were far the tasty tacos we've had in a long time. It nice having a great place to have tacos on the strip. Price was fairly reasonable for what we ordered. Highlight that night... Roy was there that night, seemed like a nice guy( he didn't come by our table). He talked to a few patrons then went back to cook.  Overall a great time!

-UXTtYEZ5J_9IH5YvJ5_aA.text: 4 years gone from L.A. now after 12 living there. Frequented the A-Frame and excited to get here. Thank you Chef Roy for reppin the LA culture. Kogi Short Rib Tacos snd dumplings on point! Coming back tomorrow to get my A Frame OG's.

_qlROCko6JMvwm9l8EAbDg.text: I liked this place. Always funky fresh vibe melds LA and Vegas and the late 90s. The ceiling was a little weird with fake plants hanging, but overall, I liked the style, especially the old school velvety chairs. The entrance was fun, bodega style. Bar area was a little cramped.You can order take out and eat in the entrance area, but I wouldn't with everyone walking around to check out the store.  Waiter was super upbeat and friendly. Roy was walking around chatting - probably with VIPs and taking selfies with people.  The food: we (2) ordered chicken wings, dumplings, cold noodles, kimchi fried rice, and elotes. The wings were dlish. Spicy gochujang sauce. Yum... Dumplings were ok but after the strong flavor of the wings, the flavors may have been missed. Cold noodles / kimchi fried rice --- I would probably order one and not both next time. Very similar flavors. I expected - my fault - naengmyeon style cold noodles.  For drinks, I had Hite, which I didn't see on the menu but specifically asked about Korean beer. I prefer OB, but they didn't have it. Also, my partner wanted to get a watermelon slushie and they were out. A little surprising so soon after opening, but whatever.  Will go back again soon to try the larger format dishes. Note about pricing: surprisingly reasonable given typical Strip prices at $100 for 2. These days, you can barely get a burger, fries, and a beer for 2 for that price on the Strip and this is way beyond.  Give it a try!

LH3Hzb8559h7sbE8eFTjyg.text: Showed up an hour before closing time and they had already closed. Terribly disappointing. Don't advertise a late close of 12 am if you aren't going to abide by it.

wW0YJkKqWRTcjExrcawgTQ.text: Very disappointed I'm the only one that ordered the ribeye and I watched everybody else get their tacos salad and teriyaki salmon yet my food ever showed up I hope management sees it so they take recollection for future and understand that the expensive plate is there they just went there to get it

hpq3dk1Mv5PvBVd1kFE39A.text: Was looking forward to dining at this establishment.  It is one of the first main stream Korean restaurants on the Las Vegas strip however it left much disappointment.  Also with all the promotion of Chef Roy Choi coming to Vegas, thought this place would have been better then what was experienced.   The ambiance is definitely unique. It's very "street" and I can see a lot of LA influence.  When you walk in you enter a convenience store where they sell snacks on one side (Korean as well as other Asian snacks/ramen) and the bar on the other side. It was a bit confusing as the hostess is at a register on the snack side of the convenience store and this is where you check in for a table/reservations. The convenience store is separated from the restaurant by two red plastic shower curtains entryways that you have to walk through.  It did feel a bit disgusting to have to walk through these entryways thinking about all the people that have touched the plastic hanging down.  The dining area was neatly decorated with a 90's street feel.  We were seated at a booth. The booths were positioned a bit close to the table and there was no way to move the seating back so you weren't so close to the table area.  If you are used to Korean flavors, look elsewhere.  The food here taste more like cooks cooking Korean food without traditional ingredients but substituting them for what they had in the pantry. The food was either overly spiced, overly infused with vinegar, or overly wtf.  Many of the ordered dishes were left with food still on the plate as no one in the party wanted to touch them. The dishes we tried were Kimchi Jjiggae, Kogi short rib tacos, Spicy pork BBQ, Silken tofu with dipping sauce, Eggplant Schnitzel, slippery shrimp, Chego Pork Belly bowl, and Spicy Cold noodle. Total cost around $170.  Breakdown of the individual entrees- The good/average dishes: Spicy Pork BBQ: Only thing I would order again if I actually decided to come back (I prob won't be back). It's weird that the dish with the name "spicy" in it was actually the least spicy of the bunch. The flavor was good, it was mildly sweet and mildly spicy. It was cooked very well and was quite tasty. Portion size was small though as it is for most of the dishes ordered here.  Kogi Short Rib Tacos: Tacos were average however after having several bad dishes back to back, it was a relief to eat something that was edible.  The meat is a bit tough however the flavor of the whole dish was decent.  Slippery Shrimp: Decent, spicy sauce with fried shrimp. They give you a small portion and use the tiniest shrimp however. Not super impressive but one of the more edible things that we ordered.  Eggplant Schnitzel: Average. Fried eggplant over mustard sauce. Good option for any vegetarians that decide to come. Small portion.  The bad dishes: Kimchi Jjigae: All their shareable pots/stews are pretty expensive ranging from $42-$50.  The stew comes in a big pot and you also get a bowl of rice.  They are pretty stingy on their portions so the rice you get isn't that much and if you want more, you have to pay.  This is probably expected since they charge $4 per banchan (Korean side dish) whereas most Korean restaurants you get them for free.  The Kimchi Jjigae is terrible and when I say terrible, I mean it. It is extremely spicy and not in a good way. It does not taste like your typical Korean spice. It tasted like they just used too much pepper paste (gochujjang) and they bought the bottom shelf gochujjang to cook with. It had almost a chemical taste about it. Most of this dish was left on the table and unfortunate considering it was one of the more pricier items.  Spicy Cold Noodle: The Korean name of this dish is Bibim Naeng Myun. Avoid at all costs. I read a previous review before I ate at Best Friend saying they put too much vinegar. The dish is supposed to have vinegar in it so I thought maybe the reviewer wasn't aware and the vinegar wasn't to their liking.  This dish surely has too much vinegar to the point that it was inedible. 3 people tried one fork serving of  the dish and thereafter it remained untouched. Would avoid this dish at all costs.  Chego Pork Belly Bowl: "Chego" means Best in Korean and this was nowhere close to that. The meat was tough. Usually when you order a pork belly bowl, you get that rendered fat and tender meat. Not here... the pork belly felt more like steak where it was a bit tough and you needed to chew quite a bit.  Would definitely recommend to try a different bowl if you come here.  Silken Tofu with Dipping Sauce: Basic. Just your basic tofu you buy at the store sliced up on top of a dark sauce (soy sauce based).   Conclusion: Extreme disappointment. Small portions and pricey (usually not a problem if the food actually tasted good). Would recommend to go next door to Eataly if you wish to have a satisfactory meal.  We ended up there after since Best Friend left us unimpressed and not satisfied.

cCMqBDTuWt-4oUM4yiQbsA.text: Terrible service I walked out after people all around me received food ordered much later than mine. The excuse given was flimsy at best, especially given I was getting short rib as opposed to pork. Felt like because I don't drink and wasn't drinking that I was being mistreated. I will never be back

1ek8U6sXqA-8MduNoWT_Yw.text: The bartender was awesome but the food and drinks were overpriced for the quality and amount served.

xq1FhNkrflYGluxNhLjWiw.text: Super fun atmosphere and the food was very good! I love the music, the food and the ambiance! My teen daughter especially loved the paper straws! Our waiter, Gabriel, was the best! The entire staff was friendly, attentive, and fun! I can't wait to come back! We are huge fans of Roy Choi!!!

SEBKbl-XOSV2sCCI0z1iMg.text: Amazing experience from the moment we were led into the bodega-esque storefront that masks the real seating area. We were in a rush to get to the airport so we got there as soon as they opened at 5pm. The staff understood our rush and did everything within their power to get our food out quick and get us in and out as quickly as possible. We ordered an assortment of things so we could sample all their best dishes. I would literally order each dish again! Make sure to check this place out if you want a great experience and are looking for great Korean bbq style comfort food.

UewEMJseiIQ3GLujIAig2A.text: I'm a fan of Roy Choi's restaurants in LA so I was really looking forward to trying Best Friend since it was conveniently located downstairs at Park MGM where I was staying. We came to celebrate my bf's birthday but unfortunately, the service last night was pretty bad.   We ordered the spicy pork and the server put down the plate awkwardly so hot oil spilled on the couch/my bf's clothes. The waitress also put in the wrong order so it took a while to get our food and the drinks we ordered at the beginning didn't come out until the end. She was nice enough to say that she would comp one of the dishes she forgot, but it was still on the bill so I had to remind her for an adjustment. Also, I had let them know that we were celebrating a birthday on the reservation but didn't get an acknowledgement which was a bummer.  Overall, the atmosphere of the restaurant was cool. The food was ok but pretty pricey. I probably won't be coming back though because of the service.

t7Rt6U9_xTw9g5JW7xFcpA.text: Enjoyed sitting at the Chef's Table and trying the prix fixe "menu B"  I always love to eat great food and watch the best chefs prepare that food and this was more fun than seeing a Vegas show!   Kogi tacos, kimchi fried rice, Korean dumplings, BBQ bulgogi ribeye, yuzu prawns...each dish is gorgeous, delicious, and perfect! "Sam" served us with flair and love!   Definitely put this on your list!

SuW0vp_UV1l3HZy332obqQ.text: Not good. A friend and I had dinner and tried an array of items. None of which were good. 3 tacos for $18...reallly?  We ordered it thinking it was going to be spectacular for $18 bucks...it's was ok at best. Also tried the slippery shrimps which was eh. I could've made em at home. And also had the corn...for $10 . There was also Kim chi fried rice for $15 (no protein)...oh come on!  Straight robbing people!

r-DZip5-IMbrr2RNijX1Eg.text: So good!!! Came here right after Janet Jackson, Great Location and ambiance, love how the Butcher Curtains transport you into this hidden, underground electric city/dining room! The Wonton Sliders are straight fire OG Ribs and Kobi BBQ were perfection! Service was flawless (love the track suits) Thank you!!!

OfLAQMW72L-eroqO5rJv-w.text: Well let's see.  Cool place with a neat vibe.  Service was a bit slow but they just opened so I forgive that.   The food  The special was Hamachi woth truffle and caviar.  It was an expensive appetizer but so worth it. 5+ stars  The dumplings 4 stars.  Very good but I had a hard piece in my first one that I got down on hard.  Pork BBQ 3 stars.   Too much sauce  Kimchee 4 stars we preferred momofuku's kimchee.   Overall I will go back but I won't do the pork again.  That was the big miss.  It's still so new there are a lot of VIP tables that seem to get all the attention

-6nW2bbv2N3B60eqK_Fe1Q.text: Thank you, staff at Best Friend. My wife and I were there Friday night and ordered the $65/per person deal, and it was absolutely delicious. Every dish was superb. Our server, Christina, was a delight and had super recommendations for both food and drinks. We had come there before the big Beck show Friday night and couldn't get to desert before we had to leave. The manager, Megan (I hope I spelled your name right), said it was OK to come back after the show for dessert. The only reason we didn't is because the Beck show was five hours (if you can believe it), but we appreciate the superb service and will be back soon. We've lived here in Vegas for more than a decade and have dined at every last spot in this town, and Best Friend is among the finest we've ever patronized. My god, the kimchi fried rice was so good I wanted to curl up with it and wish the world away as I overdosed on this delicious dish.  Thank you, guys, for making us feel welcome. We'll see you all again very soon. Your food and service is surely among the finest in this city.

cpbQQQiXK8uafftHC6AKhA.text: It's a great place. I love the dessert very much! The ice cream is so delicious, the cake is in right sweet level! Rest food are also tasty and nice! Also their waitress is very nice and knowledgeable, she knows what to order when I show her the dessert picture. Good place!

eNnlhF15XWFeOE1fB_FTdg.text: I got the pleasure to eat here with my wife on NYE...  Let's start with walking up it looks like a Korean market place. When you walk in to check in at your table it's like checking out in a Korean minimart... brilliant!!!!   Once you walk in the Decour is a retro 90s and there's a live DJ playing old school beats... Add a perfect setting the waiters and bussers are wearing ADIDAS jump suites and Kango hats. The staff is amazing Roy himself walks around from table to table to greet you.   The food: everyone is screaming about the pork belly but my favorite was the BBQ SHRIMP, and KIMCHI FRIED RICE We also tried the short rib tacos, and I have to say everything was fire!   After receiving the bill my thoughts: Over all the experience, the food, and the service was worth what our bill was! (Which was not that high)   Congrats Roy Choi as a life time resident of Las Vegas I can say you are going to do well in this market!

AHQfZJvz5DeSgcmpW-ak7Q.text: My friend and I had a blast at Best Friend. We ate at the bar, and the service was fast and friendly. The menu is eclectic, but there's something for everyone. The ambiance and music was great. I'd easily eat here again!

EST7E6lkPUMcZjSzByokGg.text: This restaurant has a great vibe all together!! The music and the servers are amazing! Corey and Hot Scott were super knowledgeable and provided great service! The food is even better!! Get the Garlic Chicken and Kimchi Fried Rice for sure! You won't regret it! We also got the street corn and Korean tacos and they were great. They also have fun and interesting cocktails. It's a casual spot and it's sooo good. And affordable!

APdoZt1XXCvVIxmEmSzC3g.text: Best food! Huge portions! Expensive AF! Drinks are not that great, old fashion was not filled to the top and beer was not chilled... the food was the best and our server was very nice!

p_Jmq9RhRN1ohl_yrWepBA.text: I just wasn't impressed. To not a good value for the money. I got the eggplant at first but didn't like it. Then I got the barbeque vegetables which were on a bed of onions. Like too many onions. Like they were using onions to make the plate seem fuller. They were ok. The fried rice was ok. Nothing was spectacular. I wouldn't eat here again. I would recommend different places to eat being that Vegas has so many. I actually am finding a lot of the restaurants in the big hotels are underwhelming.

pzKxkPxVCWBCH3MUOqQ-gg.text: A girl friend and I decided to eat out on a Friday night at the Park MGM.  There was a long wait where we wanted to go, so we walked around checking out the other places.  It looked like we were going to have to wait everywhere.  Getting a bit desperate, we walked into Best Friend.  After checking out the menu, we decided to go for it.  Surprise!  No wait!  We were led into this cavernous room which was about 3/4 full, and our ear drums were greeted with thundering dj house music.  I ordered the cold soba noodles with clams and mussels.  My friend had the kalbi. Well, the mussels were dried out.  What pulled the dish from the dead broth it was in was the fish roe, which gave it a little taste.  It was different but I would never order it again.  My friend liked her kalbi but it couldn't save the day.  Not even the house bread which reminded us of those sweet yummy rolls from another mother country.  Service waa great but the music was way too annoyingly loud.  Would have been okay in a club.  But we were there for food, conversation, and fun.  Definitely not the place for best friends who want to catch up without a screaming conversation.

P-VrlLYpVbKZ4whi48dMRw.text: At first when u walk in you can't tell there's a restaurant in the back. But this restaurant is very unique looking and the atmosphere and decor is just so uniquely nice. The servers and staff are very friendly and seem so down to earth. I really loved the whole vibe of the place. We ordered the beef kalbi, dumplings, and b&c octopus. The food was soooo good. My whole family loved it and kept saying how good the food was. Especially the beef kalbi. One of the best Korean bbq I've ever tasted hands downs! We ended with the bathtub sundae for two which was so delicious. Filled with ice cream, marshmallows , whipped cream, rice crispy treats, cotton candy and much more toppings. Over all our experience here is very good. I would recommend this place to everyone. Excellent food and service!

YeY-zAiAOpmpW4X7PnNZwA.text: This place is the real deal. If you've ever been to Kogi or Chego in LA you'll find the same great tastes here. Living in Utah this is the closest place to me to get some of Roy Choy's creations. Everything from the cool entrance to the music is really working for them. I'll be back many many times.

L0ZRsz5ydNENO5QQ4lcU5Q.text: My friend wanted to come here for her birthday. We originally had a reservation for 6 at 530 and called earlier in the day to change to a party of 10, but they told us they were completely booked. When we got there, it was pretty empty and it still wasn't crowded when we left, plenty of empty tables. They could have accommodated us. The service was great, waitress was nice and they were very attentive. However, I was quite disappointed by the food. Had higher expectations. We ordered the kalbi (many pieces were burnt and the ones that weren't, the meat was chewy), spicy pork ( only 1 person in our group liked this fish) , garlic chicken (best of the 3 bbq we ordered, but nothing special), wontons (again, just ok), kimchi fried rice (not good), and the dori tang (ok). The Hawaiian sweet rolls were yummy. Overall, the food was just ok. I've had way better Korean food at other restaurants.

7yHkVOYaYFlnjAMhCzc3JQ.text: Great decor and ambiance, good staff, the food was ok, definitely not Roy Choi quality or hype, a little overpriced for what it is, favorite item was korean wings, the banchan can be avoided.

a6CqefhdDWB3Y1UUVfwpFQ.text: Love Roy Choi from my time in LA and his Kogi trucks.  BF is even better.  The food is amazing.  Loved the bulgogi, kimchi friend rice, dumplings.  The cucumbers were just ok but it didn't take away from the experience.  Casual atmosphere, super helpful servers, amazing food, what else could you want

G712oLDGvCoA_-_BnZqGhA.text: Such great food and drinks! This place was weird, wild, and wonderful. It really felt like the place had food truck charm while keeping up with the glitz & glamor of the strip. They even have their own branded slot machines... get three tacos in a row for the jackpot! If only the jackpot equaled an endless supply of their fusion food & inventive kitchy drinks!!!!!  Word to the wise, don't be fooled by the seemingly lower price of this place. Vegas is crazy expensive, and this is coming from a New Yorker! With tip, the bill was $100 -- 1 watermelon sesame tequila cocktail, 1 ginger whiskey slushie, korean tex mex tacos, siracha fried rice, and prickly pear dragonfruit bingsoo. Yum yum!   The best way I can describe the food is that the tacos tasted like sex in my mouth. I loved this place so much I'm coming back on my birthday!!!!

Uc4bPWid4cJNDmyW6C7MmA.text: We made reservations and were sat right away.   Took back to the last they had binders as menus and dividers.   It's a Mexican korean fusion  KOGI tacos are a must  ELOTE is a must do not as more lime until you taste it. It is spicy so ask for it to be less spicy is needed.  SHRIMP is a must is also very spicy get rice with it.  UNI rice is a must but was also too spicy but wasn't suppose to be that spicy so we did say something.  MEDJOOL DATE dessert is a MUST!  Trust me.   This was more than enough for me and my husband.   We got drinks too michelada was on point. Pina colada they added passion fruit so it was too tart for me but if you like strong drinks. This one is for you.   Definit a fun vibe with a dj. Wanted to try more stuff we need more people next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. MEDJOOL date dessert
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kogi taco, elote, uni rice.
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Michelada and pina colada (their version is different)

-SAsvCD804rSdwbvBfdF2Q.text: GOOD VIBES.  Maybe it was the combination of the dope DJ and the laid back menu that makes Best Friend your best friend. This place just puts you in a good mood. It feels like you've been transported to a hip block party. How fun is that? The playlist and the city decor really gets you in the mood to devour those Korean tacos (and an alcoholic slush!). From walking in through the convenience store through a speakeasy like entrance to the real street art and photos of the palm trees on the wall, this place gets five stars.   Okay, so five stars for the overall atmosphere but when the food came this is when the magic disappeared. Our table ordered the Korean wings, kimchi fried rice, kalbi, and the slippery shrimp. There were tons of things on the menu we wanted but decided on these dishes for this visit.   First off, that table bread was crack. Seriously. So good. Not sure what it was exactly, it sort of a sweet bread but not a King's Hawaiian roll but has the density of a Filipino pandesal. Whatever it is, it was the best thing I ate the whole night.   Korean wings-- Delicious! The sauce was unique. I wish the wings were crispy though. I love me some crispy kwings!  Kimchi fried rice-- It didn't come hot as I would have liked. The raw egg just kind of sat there and it didn't cook all the way despite coming on a hot pan. The overall flavor was rich and overly seasoned.  Kalbi-- Korean short rib. You can't go wrong with this. This was probably the safest thing to order. It was just like ordering Kalbi at a your favorite KBBQ spot.   Slippery shrimp-- I really wanted to like this dish. Like really REALLY wanted to love this. This was something that I saw on Yelp and knew that I had to order. It was just too much sauce, so little shrimp and the flavor was tiring. After two bites I was over it.   The slippery shrimp and the kalbi should have come with white rice or some sort of greens to bring down all of the overwhelming flavors. Maybe an order of fries or something would have helped with the heavy flavors. Talk about food coma.   Overall, Best Friend has a cool vibe and I will be back again. I am a huge fan of Roy Choi and I love how he's been changing the food game since his Kogi trucks, Commissary at the Line, and Locol in Watts. The food was lacking in certain areas (a solid 3 stars from me) but that also could be my high expectations for a Roy Choi establishment. The fun vibe of this place is a solid 5 stars. But it's never good when the complimentary table bread steals the show. Definitely going to go back and give it another shot but maybe this time I'll stick with my trusty Korean tacos!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread!
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slippery shrimp

jzS2H74nZboRGK5QJOjfwA.text: What can I say...this place was absolutely FANTASTIC! This restaurant is located on the strip side entrance of the Park MGM. My husband and I were staying there for the Lady Gaga concert to avoid having to walk along the strip in mid summer heat to attend the concert. We didn't make any reservations for Dining prior to the concert. We walked around the Park MGM until we found a spot with seating available. To our surprise, we were able to score some seating here and the bar area. That was perfect considering we wanted some quick food and drinks prior to attending the concert.   Our bartender/server was exceptionally friendly and walked us through the menu making recommendations based on his favorites and popular dishes. The Korean inspired menu was right up our alley. We got some potstickers and Korean tacos as an appetizer and shared a chicken entree. All of the dishes were fantastically seasoned and weren't too heavy. We had plenty of vodka sodas, which brought our bill up quite a bit. It was worth it though. For a nice meal and good ambiance, I'd definitely come back again on my next Vegas trip.

Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef taco

0z7pyS8sexyTvk6-wl8aeA.text: This is probably a place for an awesome splurge and taste of LA in Las vegas. My husband and I ordered the watermelon and cucumber mixed drinks. They were truly refreshing on such a hot day. We also ordered spicy pork bbq and kogi short rib tacos. It was the perfect amount of spice and juicy meat. We were not surprised since it paired well with our drinks. The ambience is that of a liquor store and a bunch of candles for a chill vibe.  We definitely wanted to try more, but we are glad our waiter suggested we wait and see how we feel after what we ordered. We will definitely come back and try other dishes.

ApdUFUtlpaQ29e5ARlXyig.text: Roy Choy is really my Best Friend after this dining experience! I was mostly excited to try this place after seeing Roy on The Chef Show on Netflix. Most or all of the dishes here are meant to be shared family style, but no one will judge you for not sharing!   Tacos & Tall Boy Tuesday's is what really drew me in! 3 Kogi Beef tacos for $10?! Can't go wrong! The perfect blend of Korean and Mexican flavours, the Kogi beef tacos will surely not disappoint!   The Kimchi friend rice was bomb! Slightly spicy and vinegary in-house made kimchi combined with sticky rice paired perfectly as a side with our tacos. Next time I would probably ask them for it to be a little crispier.   The Banchan... oh man the banchan... I was excited to try the in-house made kimchi, but the cucumbers, wow! The cucumbers were probably my favourite thing that we ordered, I enjoyed them so much I took an order of them to go. Do yourself a favour and order the cucumbers!!!   Service was great, the vibe was chill, all around a good time! I'm looking forward to coming back the next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary Hawaiian sweet rolls
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchi Fried Rice (without egg)
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banchan cucumbers &amp; kimchi

iiBAeLTX9V7i5BEsVEodvg.text: Roy Choi has done it, yet again.   Before you enter the restaurant there is this cute little space that is very much your corner store. The hostess escorted us through see-through red strip curtains into the main dining room.   The music was poppin. The decor was somehow hip-hop AND hipster AND plant daddy. As we wove through the crowded space I couldn't help having a dance in my step cause playlist is IT.   I had the Veggie Rice Bowl which is pretty much what is served at Chego! in LA.  Still jammin. The strawberry mango daiquiri was the perfect start to my Vegas stay; as it was refreshing, tart, sweet, and strong.   It is most definitely a place I'll be back to.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Daiquiri

ztPqEHfynJfVZC0yCsDqRA.text: The hubs and I wanted to try Best Friend during our last trip to Vegas. As soon as you step into the restaurant, you're transported to a different place - one minute, you're standing in a Vegas casino, another minute, you're standing in the middle of your neighborhood liquor store. The walls are plastered with posters and soju ads that screams old-school K-town nostalgia, and as two people who grew up in K-town, it really took the hubs and me back. Once your table is ready, the host/hostess will take you to through a pair of plastic curtains into the dining area.   The dining area is large with tables sprawled everywhere. The design is very modern, but there's an eclectic mix of atmospheres and feels depending on where you sit. I especially loved the wall of s (large Korean clay pots).  The hubs ordered the kimchi fried rice, I got the uni bowl, and we shared an order of carnita and kogi tacos.  The meal started with a warmed Hawaiian Roll brushed with butter and sprinkled with salt for each of us. It was heavenly.  I wish I could say I LOVED the uni bowl... but it was so heavily drenched in the dynamite sauce, and the sauce was so tart, that it completely over-powered EVERYTHING in the bowl. To be fair, the pieces of uni they used in the dish were plump and delicious, but overall, the dish was a disappointment.  When the kimchi fried rice came out, I was expecting another disappointment. Instead of a vibrant red, the rice actually looked rather flavorless and dry. But this was a classic lesson in why you shouldn't judge a book by its cover. Despite its bland appearance, each bite packed great kimchi flavor, and the texture of the rice was on point.   The kogi and carnitas tacos were delicious as well, but the hubs and I kept going back for the kimchi fried rice.  Get the kimchi fried rice.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tF3nxUt72o1RRR5kfIuM6g.text: What the F. The vibe in this place is pretty damn dope. Servers in 90s adidas track suits. Dj playing really good summertime-in-Los Angeles backyard vibe music. Bomb ass Kogi truck Korean fusion.    True story. As we were walking in there was this douchy guy walking out he put his hand to his mouth as if to tell us a secret and with his southern accent said, out loud, "don't order too much... food ain't that good... know what I'm sayin". The hostess looked at him and gave him a rightly deserved  what-the-fuck stink eye.  So much is right about this place. I mean, the kimchi fried rice could have had more kick but the flavor was delicious. The kalbi was tender and bbq chicken was something to stand in line for.  Choose Best Friend if: you are anywhere between Bellagio and Luxor, if it is past 5pm, if you like good music while you eat, if you like bbq.

Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roy Choi!

jEtZ74_iNKrECn1kkjfAYQ.text: Super cute younger crowd very trendy spot. Next to Eataly in the front of the hotel and opposite from the parking garage so expect to walk. Front looks like a convenient street shop. Dining can be offered there. Hostess stand is the makeshift cashier stand.   Once you enter into the main dining room you are imported into a lively street art kind of atmosphere. The menu has nostalgic photos of Roy Choi and calling out army Asian pastime..we ALL took those photo studio group photos back in the day.   Ok so food we chose the $50 set menu and I thought we were going to be just context BUT no we were so full. I think cause I go to local cheap cheap spots sometimes I didn't want this to be a tourist trap but no pretty cool. Shrimp was Spiiiiicy so tread carefully. My favorites are the garlic chicken and bulgogi paired with that oh so amazing Kimchi fried rice. Oh and the dang bread. Other items that were also tasty was the taco and date cake but I just kept eating that rice!   I didn't care for my drink. I had this watermelon tequila drink. Sounded a little light and refreshing but it was a little strong and sweet for what I imagined.   The wait staff was super cool and chill. Active throughout the whole evening and just letting us have a good girls night. I would absolutely do this again with the same experience with a group of friends.

Aq4jJA1HMY5kUmPK-7nI4w.text: Of course i followed Chef Roy Choi to Las Vegas. I'm definitely excited to give this review. I am a huge fan of his and of course, i love supporting his businesses based on the fact that he has amazing intentions of wanting everyone to have access to healthy food options.   But this review isn't about that. This review is about his new spot in Las Vegas!   I went crazy and ordered everything possible! Kimchi fried rice, all the banchan, kalbi and of course-kimchi jiggae. I'm so hungry right now and all i Can think about is that kimchi fried rice. I could eat that daily! Sooooo bomblicious!   And the decor? Where do i begin? Check out my pictures and make sure you head to Best Friend w your bestie and order it up! You won't be disappointed!

ESLeWB0lGzaBjn0Q1CIBZg.text: Other than the cool 90's nostalgia, there's nothing about Best Friend that would bring me back. Service was okay, a bit slow but it didn't bother me too much at the time. And food was good... but just as good as any other Korean restaurant in the Valley for a fraction of the price...   I would recommend going once for the atmosphere.

Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7sen1n_Q3zx2gyvKBHBaZA.text: "My best friend is Roy Choi," so says the neon sign outside of Best Friend at the ParK MGM.  Since I was with my actual besties, we decided to have our last meal of our girls trip in Vegas here (plus, it was the only time we could get a reservation LOL)!  Normally I do my research on Yelp before eating at a new restaurant, but I went in somewhat blind, only going by Roy Choi's street cred as the founding father of Kogi (first food truck in L.A. serving Korean tacos) and from what my friend recommended after watching " The Chef Show."  When you first walk in, it looks like some kind of brightly lit Asian mini mart/ dive bar/ diner/ souvenir shop.  It's colorful and lively and just a bit overwhelming trying to look at everything.  The welcoming hostess then took us in the back, past the heavy plastic divider panels (that you might find going to the warehouse of a grocery store), and we were instantly transported to a very dimly lit, trendy, cool, urban restaurant with awesome old school hip hop and R&B being spun by a live DJ.  "L.A. street chic" is the best way I can describe the vibe and the atmosphere.  All the servers wear Adidas track suits and the food runners/bussers wear white tees, khakis, and baseball caps to the back.  The art, furniture, and decor is a mix of religion and music, modern and vintage, Asian and Latino, and elegance and urban.  It all works together to create an authentic Roy Choi and Las Vegas dining experience.  That being said, expect to pay Vegas prices for classic Asian-inspired dishes that can be found on the menus of most Korean BBQ restaurants or on a trendy taco truck for a lot less.  But the food was delicous!  The four of us decided on the family-style set menu of "A" side ($50/pp) and the ribeye plate ($52), served a la carte.  Included in the set menu was Kogi's signature Korean tacos, spicy pork, garlic chicken, kimchi fried rice, slippery shrimp, banchan (4), and a dessert of ice cream and cake.  Our server brought us out the housemade warm Hawaiian rolls to start off with.  It was a lot of food, people!  But not only that, after the last entree came, our server let us know that if we wanted more of any of the dishes (with the exception of the tacos), to just let them know.  What?  I didn't realize it was basically an AYCE!  That made the price worth it!  My favorite was the ribeye steak, melt-in-your-mouth tender and seasoned well, served over a bed of onions, and the "slippery shrimp," crispy and served in a rich sauce, it was quite addictive.  My only gripe was that we asked for more of the kimchi fried rice and our server came back 15 minutes later saying they ran out!  So we just had white rice which actually tasted better with all of the grilled meats.  The date cake was super moist and not too sweet, balancing out the rich and creamy caramel ice cream and whipped cream.    All of the staff were genuinely friendly and helpful, laidback and sociable, adding to the positive, fun, and cool ambiance.  Cheers to good food and best friends!

WD8m0FhHfECBgUAcR3slbA.text: A bit steep in price but sooo worth it! Came with a group of 4 and walking in you can tell the vibe is retro and fun.  Theres a "souvenir shop" in the front and opens up to the dining room with open kitchen through the plastic back.   There are set menus but our waitress says they have an option where the chef chooses what we get and would feed us better, we felt adventurous so we opted for that at $65 a person.   Great music - 90's R&B and hip hop until they switched djs and it ended up.. different.   Service was a 5 star - bubbly and eager to help with any questions, the food came out with great suggestions and waters were always filled.   Food - there were were some dishes were a little bit less my taste (the lobster) but the other dishes far outweighed the ones I didnt like as much.   *They also charge for the banchan   Will definitely be back!

15uVK_1piFhT6d3uNWz8Yg.text: A bright neon yellow sign saying BEST FRIEND indicates you've arrived at the restaurant. Reminiscent of a mom and pop restaurant in a cheap strip mall somewhere in the middle of nowhere. Had I not known it was Roy Choi's place, I wouldn't have stepped in here. Not sure why, but I just don't particularly enjoy the old retro vibe you get here. The bar area is decked out with tons of visual noise. Stickers everywhere. Convenience store look with tons of Asian inspired snacks on the shelves. I thought that was all there was to it. Service was a little lacking in that the hostesses didn't seem to want to seat me? I just went up to the bar and the guy whose name I want to say is eliott? maybe he just reminds me of my BEST FRIEND's boyfriend hahahahha. Asian guy with glasses wearing an oversized pink ROY CHOI IS MY BEST FRIEND t shirt. He takes my order... I asked if there was a back because people seemed to be coming out. there was! It was popping in the back, fancy decor with murals of LA. Preferred dining in the back much MUCH more. No glaring glow of pink neon lights attacking your eyes.  Anyways, I ordered the Uni dynamite. It had 2-3 pieces uni on top of a bed of hot Yuzu rice sprinkled with toasted seaweed, sesame, and daikon sprouts?  I loved this dish, I was so surprised. It has crunchy bits where the rice got a bit over toasted? Or maybe there was something else in it. The rice is spicy and has a nice kick to it and the creamy, cold uni cuts through it and adds that savoryness that you crave. The tartness of the yuzu, spicyness, crunchy bits, savory seaweed, creamy, and cold sensations and flavors all blend so well together in this dish. It's not cheap sitting at $22 for something the size of a pizookie at BJ's but I think it's worth it.  The dumpling sliders were interesting and I didn't like them at first but they grew on me. It was sweet and I could taste dumpling filling instead of the typical hamburger patty. It's got like. Plumb seasoning or something on it. Some yuzu? Like bulgolgi? Every bite tasted different. I wouldn't get it again but it was interesting to try. The fries with ramen seasoning was amazing. for $10 not a bad deal especially in vegas.   I was surprised that these two dishes were enough to fill me up. The two bartenders were friendly enough and made nice conversation. Food came pretty quickly and service was good. Maybe because I was the only one seated at the bar? Hostesses suck though. No one gave me a history of the place or talked about the concept.  Oh yeah. After 10pm they switch to their late night menu. lameeee. I didn't get to see or order from their full menu. might have to come back...

jQfeNfkFb1I53kgJ_tcYTg.text: There is some special kind of magic going here. How did I not know if this place before. All I can say is everything was fricken amazing. Roy you out did yourself with this place. The cheese cake is on point and if you dont try it you are missing out on something amazing. Our waitress Christina was on point, Professional and very helpful. Get in your car and go try this place NOW!.

SqcucCMxt20mCHPOGh1Rfw.text: The midori sour was AMAZING. We tried another midori sour at the Cosmopolitan bar shortly after, and it fell way short. The watermelon tequila cocktail was disgusting though, could not finish it.  The chicken wings and the slippery shrimp were my faves, and the chego bowl was great as well. I would pass on the Dori Tang, the legit Korean version is much better. Still had an amazing experience, and I'd be happy to return.

ZHjnMoKUiHkNrbs0uIuvNg.text: I did come back to best friends during restaurant week and was very happy with the food this time. I did get the garlic chicken and it was cooked to perfection. I really wanted to love this place and now with the kitchen having consistent cooking I am happy to go back.

lg6SKr4q6GJ7LGukIBTzSw.text: Now I'm out here looking like revenge Feelin' like a ten, the best I ever been And yeah, I know how bad it must hurt To see me like this, but it gets worse at..BEST FRIEND! - Demi Lovato (sorry not sorry)  Full disclosure: I had Kogi tacos from their food truck in LA when they first started before Roy Choi was a household name - I was not impressed at all and haven't had his food until now.  Enter Best Friend. In addition to the positive reviews, they have a Chef's menu that's only $50 a person for dinner (Vegas standards) for a ton of food so I was ready to give it another shot. I appreciate the story: the convenience store front into the restaurant with a Vegas vibe and club music to back it up, the menu with pictures of him and his childhood friends - seems like he put his life story in this restaurant and wants to share it with the world - good for him.  Enter the Chef's menu. A. Kogi short rib tacos - wow much better than I had 10+ years ago - expectations going up for the rest of the meal B. Chili shrimp - basically walnut shrimp but with chili mayo - very tasty and a bit of a spicy kick - something I've never had before - off to a very good start.. -------------------------------------------- These lines represent the amount of time it took for the next dish to come out. They came out blazing and then almost 20 mins of a lull time AFTER we had finished the first two dishes (so like 35 mins total) -- everyone knows that the food is going to start settling and you're going to start feeling full if you don't have food coming out at a reasonable time. This isn't a french restaurant..its just meat coming out next.. the server offered more bonchon and we said sure but it never came..cool.. C. chicken + pork - honestly the chicken was super dry and I'm not even sure what sauce was on it - the spicy pork was a bit better but it felt like the food sat on the line for a while and just didn't make its way out to us in a timely manner -- we ate less than half and didn't even want to take it to go (first its Vegas and second I wouldn't have wanted to take it even if I was going home) D. kimchi fried rice - it wasn't bad but I probably would've enjoyed it more if I wasn't full from the waiting and getting impatient with the excuses coming from the server who blamed it on the kitchen (they both deserve blame for this)  E. dessert cake with ice cream - wasn't too sweet which is nice and the  best thing we had all night next to the shrimp and tacos / although again it took them a while for it to come out even after they kept apologizing for the timing of the previous dishes..sigh there's communication issues going on for sure - it wasn't due to a "busy kitchen" because when we were there, it was maybe half full  I would say to not eat here if you have a show to get to (plan 2.5 hours before the show if you really want to eat here lol or eat after since they are open late) - the speed of the food coming out was super inconsistent and this was when they were half full..imagine what it would be like during prime dinner hours when its packed. My impression of the Kogi tacos however has been restored so yay!   2.5 stars overall -- lots of food for the cost and tacos were delicious - the story of the restaurant is touching and feels real - the disconnect between the servers and the kitchen was clearly showing and they didn't do anything to rectify the situation other than a seemingly unauthentic apology. I do appreciate the front of the house person coming by the tables asking how our meal was so props to her at least for doing that. Saving grace for them is that it is Vegas so there will be no shortage of people coming to try - retention rate might be a difficult ask though from my experience.

3qLcF7UanOsvXLYnTQGYaQ.text: The best way I can sum up this amazing meal is to say this: I had the same excitement and expectations for both David Chang's Majordomo in LA & Roy Choi's Best Friend in Vegas- where Majordomo let me down, Best Friend went above and beyond!  Located in the Park MGM, Best Friend is a loud, bright, fun homage to late 80's/early 90's LA life. I loved taking the time to really notice all of the small details and deco that make this restaurant so special- from retro stickers and candy to kimchi pots arranged on a wall, every detail has a meaning.  Service from the hostess was so-so but our server was great! Super friendly and helpful while guiding us through the menu. We ordered Kogi Short Rib Tacos, Kimchi Fried Rice, Uni Dynamite Fried Rice, & Korean Chicken Wings.  So the thing about Best Friend is that they take dishes that are inherently Korean or very "LA" and elevate them to a level that's out of this world! At first glance, my husband was super annoyed to be paying $19 for Kimchi Fried Rice- a dish you associate with leftovers from your Korean mom's kitchen. But as soon as you taste Roy's, you realize you are eating something very, very special. The harmony of unexpected, new, unfamiliar flavors in a childhood staple is genius!  It's more than simple Korean "fusion"- Choi takes these dishes and re-invents then in a way that honors their roots and elevates them with the addition of new ingredients and flavor profiles.   The first starter of buttery Hawaiian Rolls come out~ its a good harbinger of the dishes to come: it's a classic staple with a fresh twist. We've had the Kogi tacos in LA, and they didn't disappoint! The Korean chicken wings were perfectly cooked and crispy with a fresh new taste. The Kimchi Fried Rice topped with a perfectly cooked egg was savory and delicious.  But the star of the evening was the Uni Dynamite Fried Rice~ AMAZING!!! I literally dream of that dish~ it was THAT good! I can't recall the last time I've wanted to lick the bottom of a fish clean until I had this (lol)!!! Don't come here without trying it!  We were just so impressed with the meal, everything from service to ambiance to music to food! We questioned whether or not people who were unfamiliar with Korean dishes would appreciate just how delicious Roy's are, but from the reactions of our fellow diners and Yelpers it seems like people loved Best Friend as much as we did! DEFINITELY stop by if you're in Vegas~ you'll be glad you did!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unit Dynamite Fried Rice
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean Style Chicken Wings

CmsSchRdxbVQVvBFcyq1Eg.text: Hello Yelpers, it's been a while. But this fat kid came out of hibernation to give you some very important information for the newly opened Best Friend.   Everything was on point. The food. The music. The service. But, do not, I repeat DO NOT order multiple delicious dishes and a pot if you are two people.   Everything is meant to be shared, and share we did....  We started with the wings, which were my least favorite dish of the night. I'm more a BonChon fan, sorry Roy. Then came the slippery shrimp and the short rib tacos. The slippery shrimp was the best! The tacos were delicious too.   So just about when I'm getting full, we had one last dish coming. The Dori Tang... I LOVE dori tang, and it's almost impossible to find anywhere.   When it came out, it was a huge cast iron pan, the giant one you make meals for 6-8 in (plus it came with rice). I literally exclaimed holy shit when she brought it out.   For the price and for it being a shared plate place we expected it to be less than half the quantity of what it was. Holy god, that thing should come with a warning, don't order unless you're a part of 6 or only plan to eat this. We made the smallest dent in it and called it a night. But it was effing delicious.   Speaking of prices, they were super reasonable, especially for Vegas. At Catch I think it would have cost twice as much for half the food.   I expected there to be a few hiccups with it being open only a few days, but not a hiccup to be found other than me not realizing the hostess was where I thought you buy the souvenirs.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CYx508fHn_jnIHRcKwsipw.text: This place was great. We went 2 nights in a row.  Tried the tacos, elotes, Itaewon Pot, kimchi and cucumber kimchi, steamed dumplings, and galbi. All of it was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IpPDBaEuj9HUDl8uZHxSEQ.text: Amazing addition to Vegas and my personal favorite of all of his restaurants (although I still miss the commissary). Went over opening weekend and loved the vibe. From the decor, servers in Adidas tracksuits, DJ with all the best /80s/90s hits, the photos of what looked like my youth splattered over the menus- everything was thoughtfully executed.   Slippery Shrimp- everyone is raving but it left me unimpressed. The shrimps were tiny, not battered correctly and left super soggy, which really ruined the texture of what slippery shrimp is known for. My least favorite dish of the night.   Kimchi Fried Rice- while I appreciated the fact that it's a vegetarian dish, personally didn't love because the kimchi wasn't aged enough. Everyone knows the stinkiest kimchi is what makes the fried rice great. However there was an overall charred smokiness to the rice that had me going back for more.   Short rib tacos- perfection like always. Much bigger portions than the food trucks. Comes 3 to an order but you can always add an extra taco.   Spicy Pork BBQ- Perfection. Wouldn't change a thing.   Tamarind Black Cod Stew- you can order the large pots in half orders so don't be afraid! Spectacular dish and full of flavor. Tangy sauce with perfectly cooked cod. There are a lot of fish bones in this so beware, but a really special dish.   Bingsu- chef does magic by foaming up the condensed milk and this dish rivals bingsu in Korea for me. Prickly pear sorbet with dragon fruit and a light dew of foamy condensed milk over shaved ice.   Date Cake- sounds like a strange choice but it was phenomenal. Moist but not too sweet with a salted caramel ice cream and graham cracker crumble.   Last thing- don't be weary of the 80s drinks. Got a midori sour and fuzzy navel and these are nothing like what you've had before. Fresh juices make them inventive so give them a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ctwRpi9e1X0XsWocyz7aPg.text: This is one of the many great restaurant additions to Park MGM. The decor and ambiance is hip and modern, it makes you feel like you are back in the 80s-90s. Just looking through the menu will bring you back to your high school days and photo mania group sessions. The servers wear adidas track suits! I came for dinner prior to going to an event at the arena. The service throughout the night was great and we barely had any wait, which is rare esp. at busy restaurants on the strip. To start off, your table will get honey hawaiian rolls-which is nothing special, but the rest of the food is bomb. We had ordered the Slippery Shrimp- this has a great kick to it, Kalbi ribs, and Uni dynamite rice- this was my favorite!. The portions are enough to share and prices... are Strip prices hahaha! Don't forget to get the Coke/Hennessy slush in a to-go cup so you can finish it outside. Go grab your best friend to eat at BF.

Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni dynamite rice
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slippery shrimp

G-Qbip4Y-YZt69Z9BIx2DA.text: I had a chance to check out Best Friend recently on my last trip to Las Vegas and I have to say it was a great time. I ended up learning about the Restaurant on YouTube when Timothy DeLaGhetto interviewed Roy Choi inside the restaurant thought the concept sounded cool so I had to give it a try when I got into town. I have to say I was disappointed at all the whole concept and 90's vibe and aesthetic was great and very different from anything you normally see in a restaurant. The staff was friendly and helpful, the food was solid, and just an overall great experience all together. When you go somewhere like Las Vegas you are looking to have experiences you can go it anywhere but Best Friend give you a special chill, fun experience plus good food can't beat that.  So my wife and I weren't super familiar with Korean BBQ so we sampled a few dishes that caught our eye we started off with the Korean Wings and the Slippery Shrimp which both were amazing and really set the meal off on a good note thanks to our waiter for suggesting the Shrimp. Next we both order a plate of the Kogi Short Rib Tacos which were mind blowing so much flavor packed into those tacos it was crazy. Then lastly we tried the Garlic Chicken which was really good as well, all the portions where a good side had plenty of food to take back to the hotel for later and left more than satisfied. The retro 90's music was great and all the throwback details down to the wait staff wearing the Adidas-style jump suits from back in the day was just cool and great attention to detail for someone like myself that grew up in that era.  In closing I would have to highly recommend Best Friend if you are looking to have a memorable experience with great food in a great environment, next time you visit Vegas I bet you won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kogi Short Rib Tacos
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slippery Shrimp

FwzPRKDW4KUAHYbvmlAl3g.text: Awesome concept restaurant with a front store that mimics a little corner neighborhood market and also has a bar. The restaurant itself had an old school hip hop vibe and live DJ while we were there on a Saturday night.  Ordered the Chego Pork Belly Bowl and the Fries. All meals are served with salted buttered Hawaiian rolls. Chego Pork Belly Bowl- absolutely incredible braised pork belly with crispy edges, served over rice sauced with a spicy savory sauce and topped with crushed peanuts, a fried egg and roasted broccolinni. Easily one of the best things I've ever eaten.  Fries- delicious wedge cut fries that we're crispy outside and soft inside and well seasoned with ramen packet seasoning. Served with spicy mayo and overall was a flavor punch. I love salt so this was great for me! Overall the restaurant was an experience in itself from the decor to the amazing food. Definitely worth checking out!!  Also got a chance to meet Roy Choi himself who explained that the Chego Bowl is originally from one of his restaurants in LA Chinatown. Can't wait to go get it there!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chego Pork Belly Bowl
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries, Salted Hawaiian Rolls and Chego Pork Belly Bowl

1kkVLDvbpLlpIbwLhpdiXg.text: Read a lot about this place and asked a few friends before finally checking it out. I keep wondering how much busier these places would be if parking was free, but thats another story.  We ended up walking over from a free to park hotel and I really enjoyed the entire experience. Service was great and prompt, ambiance was lively and laid back and food was pretty good and priced well.   We had a show to go to and had only one hour to make this dinner happen. I asked a friend what they ordered and apparently they ordered all the wrong things so be sure you look at the pictures before arriving. Everything came out quickly and simply put was- a great experience. They brought out complimentary hawaiian sweet rolls to start. We ordered the short rib tacos and as presented they were great but personally had too much of both sauces and they drowned out the flavor of the ribs. The sambal fries were a gigantic portion and the dipping sauce was phenomenal. My friend enjoyed it thoroughly.  We also ordered the garlic chicken and while jidori chicken thighs tend to be juicier and more tender these were a bit on the tougher side or just cooked really well done. I thought theyd have a bit more of a garlic punch to them but it kind of fell flat. Also the onions came out more on the raw side instead of grilled or sauteed. Either way it was a nice dish to experience. We ended the meal with the strawberry cheesecake. It was really well presented with a melting strawberry mousse, strawberry sorbet and also the cheesecake. Overall, it lacked the punch of a well crafted cheesecake. It wasnt creamy,  tart, or smooth. Just kind of bleh.  It may seem like I didnt enjoy it but taken as presented we had a great time. The music, price point and service made up for the personal food preferences.   Would I go back? Sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The cheesecake dessert.
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic chicken that needed more garlic.
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sambal fries and amazing amount of dipping sauce.

gvi8EBov6sZl4dF8BNlw3w.text: I was really excited to try this new restaurant by Roy Choi, but sadly, this restaurant did not meet my expectations.  I do love the decor and concept of the restaurant- very old school LA vibe with the DJ spinning. I love it.  But when it comes to the food... I will say there are way too many good eats in Las Vegas and Best Friend doesn't really stand out. I ordered cucumber and Jjang (do yourself a favor. Don't order this I can go to the store and buy cucumbers and jjang sauce for less than $7.. I was hoping they did something more with the dish but they did not). Bbq vegetables, carnitas tacos, short rib tacos, and dumplings. Short rib tacos are the only thing worth ordering... and even then the price point does not match the quality of the food. One order of tacos come with 3 small pieces and that's $12..   Normally I am not that anal about portions or price points. But the food here is so mediocre I do mind paying this much money for it. I probably won't be back.

QaVTtUMOjrjP6E3vPgCfTQ.text: Definitely surpassed everything I thought this restaurant was going to be, the whole atmosphere is definitely on a different level compared to many restaurants here in Las Vegas. The staff was very friendly and constantly asked us if we were enjoying our food, which we absolutely did!  We had to get drinks of course. I ordered myself a Mai Tai and my man ordered the Mango Slush. Both were very delicious, but be careful when you drink the Mai Tai ... definitely creeps up on you. It is so refreshing that you forget there's rum in it! We also had complimentary hawaiian rolls and a spinach type banchan which I loved! The Daikon banchan was my personal favorite!  Kalbi ribs was great and the Spicy pork was to die for! But the real winner for me was the half rack of Lamb chops we ordered! It was beyond delicious and those garlic veggies the lambs were sitting on were to flavorful.  I cannot wait to bring back my best friend so she can also experience this type of atmosphere and food! The restaurant will definitely be a hit with locals soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Cheesecake
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary hawaiian rolls. Drinks pictured: Mango slushie &amp; Mai Tai. Two types of banchan: Kimchi &amp; Daikon.
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roy Choi greeting guests!!

S8jVVzBWGdrRhtBRZHU66A.text: We decided to try this place because it is by Roy Choi who which ive been a big fan of. Now this place is a Korean inspired restaurant which combines some of the local LA foods and your typical Korean dishes. If you want straight Korean food there are much better places for Korean food.   We ended up making a reservation for 945pm and when we arrived we were advised it would be about 15 mins. Well 30 mins comes around and we still have not been seated. They advised us that they were not seating anyone due to food orders being backed up. Well after almost 40 mins we were finally  seated. Once seated we were excited to try some of the dishes we had in mind. Well the server tells us they were out of the korean wings and few other things. Well we wanted the Korean wings and were disappointed. Anyways we ended up ordering each side dishes which were $3 each(in Korean restaurants these are free and unlimited), The army soup, short ribs, corn, bbq tacos, shrimp, dumplings and few other items. I will say everything was delicious and food came out pretty quick. The army soup was my fav and served in a huge bowl which can be shared by 3 or more people and included ramen, spam, sausages, tofu and rice cakes in a spicy soup. I would give a 4 1/2 stars if I could due to the long wait even with a reservation and them being out of Korean wings. Other than that the food and service was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now this dessert was awesome.. Shaved ice w dragon fruit n prickly pear sorbet.. Sooo yummy
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bbq short ribs had alot of flavor but was sooo fatty.. Every piece had a huge piece of fat on it which didn&#39;t leave much meat
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Korean chick wings were not good. Not your typical Korean wings.. More like Chinese style.

xpsFxtPL4Z3fNPPqaLoTVg.text: We came on a Monday night and already they were not taking walk-ins. So make sure you RSVP if you want to get seated inside. Instead we waited for seats at the bar. It is first come, first serve. We ordered the short rib tacos (comes with 3), kimchi fried rice (with egg on top), and the pork (big dish to definitely share). They give you complimentary Hawaiian rolls as well. I love how there are pics of Roy Choi's life but I also wish there were pics of the food. Nonetheless it was a cool place to try.

fSyK8YyC0Fg8D2seqdDydQ.text: I absolutely loved my experience at Best Friend! Roy Choi does it again with a concept that pays beautiful homage to Northeast LA, a part of the city that is often neglected in pop culture. It's next to Eataly at the Park MGM, which has easily become my favorite Vegas hotel.   As for the service, we had a top notch team taking care of us. We told our waiter immediately upon getting seated that we were seeing Janet Jackson in an hour, and he told us they are used to expediting meals for exactly that purpose. And they were True to their word: all the dishes we ordered came out within 15 minutes, which was SO impressive.   As for the food, also top notch! I certainly wasn't surprised, having followed Roy's creations for a while, but still awed at how amazing everything tasted. Much of the menu is touted as an LA Koreatown experience, and it truly is in its best form! We ordered kimchi fried rice, Korean wings, uni dynamite fried rice (my personal fave!), kalbi (another fave!), spicy pork, and tamarind black cod stew.   As for the ambience, what a cool one! You first enter what looks like a Korean convenience store with snacks for sale. That's where their bar and the host station are. You walk through a small hallway into the dining room, which is adorned with hanging plants on the ceiling as a callback to Choi's Commissary in KTown. There are beautiful light box photographs of NELA on two of the walls. And the menus are probably the best touch to it all -- a yellow binder full of Choi's childhood photographs, from photo gallery poses from the mall (I used to get those all the time, too!), to prom and homecoming pictures. The music was mostly 90s hip hop, what I consider the golden age of hip hop. I grooved to it the entire time.   Best Friend is an excellent restaurant. Thank you, Roy Choi, for yet another incredible time.

tdkkbHHkREFdKXDFiajYUw.text: The atmosphere is on point food is amazing. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an authentic experience. It's a must go see!!!!!!

VCpvoKftJLag1E5w4OBo5Q.text: If you have kids DO NOT go here! I was so excited to try this place so my family made a special trip to Park MGM. We had three kids with us and arrived at 8:30pm. We checked in with the host and she told us we would need to sit at the tables in front of the host booth since we didn't have reservations as these tables were first come first serve. Saw a small table and my family crowded around that table for 30 mins until we were able to combine two tables. After 40 mins of sitting around and being ingnored we were finally told by our waiter that our party would have to leave the seating area because we have children in our party and the reason they gave is that kids can not sit on stools and that it would be a liability to the restaurant if they fall off the stool. I couldn't believe that the staff of 7-10 people who worked the front area would watch us struggle for 40 mins to sit down and combine two tables where our children are clearly visible and sitting on stools just to tell us that we were not welcome. (no one said anything for 30 mins as we sat at the first table with our kids) I could not believe it and neither could the other patrons in the restaurant people all around us were making comments like..."thats messed up" as we picked up our kids to exit the restaurant after the waiter publicly shamed us for bringing our kids.   Don't go to Best Friends if you have a kid, care about kids, or was once a kid.

Q3VtstzaRS5ycn_9lm46vQ.text: Loud and a lot of fun! I lucked out and it was Monday and there's an all you can eat option. This isn't the usual AYCE with small tapas portions but full size portions. The ribeye was outstanding. The shrimp, spicy pork and chicken were all very good too but the ribeye was the show stopper. I loved the vibe in this place and the staff was over the top helpful. They're only open after 5pm but I recommend giving it a shot.

Cm7Yp6FoDpHaaIR3jWLCDA.text: Inaugural Grand Opening!!! Amazing food. Amazing atmosphere! Everyone is so friendly.  The flavors in all the food are phenomenal! The spices and sauces have a kick to it that adds flavors to the dishes. We had reservations and were the fist party to come in, first table to be seated, and the chef himself came out to greet us.

T9Uvc7V_fYgY0CEhLeBlAw.text: If my best friend charged me these prices with the tiny portions that you get here, I'd be kicking his tortilla all over his restaurant. The money per portion vs the atmosphere of hoity-toity ritzy ditzy feeling that you have makes this a place I will NEVER step foot in again. The problem with being a local is these kinds of places just don't do it, which is unfortunate.

t4BvGlg4PM39yk7qGJxgPg.text: So delicious!! We came here 2x while here in Vegas. The first time we did the prix fix with the ribeye and we couldn't stop thinking about the tacos and the Kimchi fried rice so had to come again before our night out. Loved everything about this place and the LA vibe is so spot on. Service was amazing - don't miss this especially if staying at the Park MGM.

zXCtwO_QnAJf8lSBWysVWg.text: This place is pretty cool.  We are from OC so we know the Kogi truck movement well.  My daughter and I enjoyed a great meal here on a Saturday night. The decor and ambiance is a hodgepodge homage to the 30's, 60's, 80's and today mixed in with some alleyway Chinatown and hip LA all mixed together and somehow it works.   On to the food.  It is also fusion food LA, meets Korean BBQ while the drinks make you feel like you are in a speakeasy.  We had the elotes and they were by far the best elotes I have ever had. They were honestly my favorite item.  We had the kogi tacos they were solid, however, I have not ever been a fan of the sauce flavor, which on this point I know I am an outlier because people will drive two hours to find a Kogi truck for these tacos.  We also had the shrimp which also was a little heavy on both the mayo and sriracha for me.  We tried the hot tub sundae and it was solid taste wise but off the hook on presentation.  What really made our experience was our waiter. He was fun, attentive, and helpful.  I would definitely recommend checking this place out.  Make reservations in advance.

Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bathtub sundae for the win.

pp4kIxVfH2ytQtfQsjXFPQ.text: Been here 5 times and it's legit.  Fantastic food.  Great fun staff and solid management.  Shout out to Gabriel the server.

ETHQ3kW9MKdoJp6ymV7gfw.text: A few friends and I visited Best Friend over the weekend. Probably one of the best Las Vegas dining experiences we have had in a long time. Everything was perfect from the DJ spinning old school hip hop to the servers dressed in Adidas tracksuits.  Highlights from Best Friend: fried chicken, Kogi short rib tacos, kalbi. The winner of the night went to the kimchi fried rice. This has to be one of the best fried rice plates i have EVER had. There were no grains of rice left behind.   Thank you for an amazing dining experience.

uY4HACpnKxCpE4j44IWMvA.text: I really, really wanted this place to knock-my-socks-off but it didn't. The Ambiance and Setting were cool and the cocktails were great, but the food and service didn't hit all the right marks for me.  Note:  My mom ordered a Salty Dog cocktail... IT WAS FANTASTIC!  It's not a complicated drink but it was Perfect in Every Way.  I wonder if maybe it was that the Grapefruit was Fresh and perfectly ripened?  Hmmm... or the bartender is just magic.   We ordered: * Corn (Elotes) - it was ok, nothing special.  We had ordered Corn at Bobby Flay's Shark the week before and were blown away so I was un-impressed with this corn  * Eggplant Schnitzel - it was what you would expect... breaded Eggplant... but the eggplant was mushy and the sauce it was served with was too mustard-y  * Kogi Rib Taco - the tortillas were dry but the meat was fantastic.. tender, juicy, flavorful  * Pork Belly Bowl - REALLY, REALLY enjoyed this dish!  It's big enough to share, but honestly if I go again, I'm ordering this and not sharing.  The flavors were sweet, spicy, a hint of sour...and all of it with that luscious pork belly.  YUM!  * BBQ Veg - a big plate of BBQ-d veggies that was mostly onions.  * Garlic Chicken - a big plate of chicken! Good for sharing.  It was a little dry but That Sauce Was Money!  Sadly, it didn't warm up very good the next day.  That's my True test of any dish... if it's still tasty the next day then you know you have a Winner.  * White Rice - it's rice... it was made properly... not too sticky, not too dry.  The service was good, but a little lackluster IMO.  Maybe it was just an off night or maybe the servers are instructed to be a bit stand-off-ish.  I don't know... maybe it was just our guy?  Maybe he was having an off night?  Maybe we were just reading him wrong?  It just didn't feel like he cared whether we ordered anything or not, and the servers couldn't put the food down fast enough and run away.  They didn't even bother to say what they were delivering.  For all the food, plus 4 drinks our bill before tax/tip was $180.  For a strip restaurant, that's pretty average.  (P.S. I didn't take any pictures because the lighting is kinda dark inside, and I don't have a good camera.... And let's face it, I suck at taking night time food pics.)

597aybTcHh26-qwP4QQWNg.text: Chef Roy Choi brings the best Korean Food to the the Las Vegas Strip with his extremely delicious dishes that all live up to the hype. We tried the Chef's Menu A and it was an epic feast! There was so much food for just the two of us. We had left overs for lunch the next day. Our faves were the Kogi Taco, Spicy Pork Belly and the date cake.   Service was wonderful. Great super kind staff. The sauce in the taco was really spicy for me and without question, they swapped it out without the sauce.   10/10 would definitely recommend.

Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu is in a binder with dividers. Brilliant!

HYwrz3NnEvuLEX2gPk2XxA.text: After landing in Vegas & checking into our hotel, my husband and I decided to eat at Best Friend since it was inside ParkMGM where we were staying.   I was able to make a reservation on my phone before heading down & we were seated immediately.   Food: Uni Dynamite Bowl - This was a rich dish. It was good at first, but as I kept eating, the dish got sour & I wasn't sure what was causing it.   Pork Belly Bowl - My husband enjoyed this! Flavorful & filling.  Slippery Shrimp - This was delicious. It can be decadent feeling, so I would suggest eating it with rice or veggies to cut the fat.   Service:  Our servers were nice, but we didn't see much of them except for taking our order and bringing our food out. The food came out quickly though.  Side note: On Mondays, they have AYCE Korean BBQ! Unlike other ASCE kbbq places, they bring out the prepared food out for you instead of you cooking it yourself.   My husband and I didn't go with this option, maybe another time with more people.   TL;DR - I'd skip the uni bowl & try something else. Don't expect the best service.

MtL1zSeZkFsN2Re64GhQRQ.text: This place really became our best friend last week. Amazing music (live DJs!) and a very cool vibe. Food is crazy expensive but of course it's Vegas. You can spend less than $50 on a pitcher of Modelo and a huge portion of fries with the delicious spicy ramen seasoning and dip.   Can't wait to go back!

ayF2vByt3U3J1EM6Reaz0w.text: Coolest restaurant vibe ever.   I love the 90's theme! From the moment you walk in with the bar, decor and apparel, to the moment you then enter the actual restaurant through these red plastic draped curtains, to the DJ, to the open layout, wall art, menu layout which is in a 3 ring binder by the way....we were just blown away throughout our entire experience. I LOVED the adidas track suit uniforms of the wait staff and literally could not stop looking at all the pictures in the menu. Roy Choi's yearbook photos!! SO CUTE!  Our server Stacy was the most patient with us as our double date arrived very late. She even tried to get Roy Choi to stop by and say hi to us since we are big fans but he was there with his family. Was definitely cool to see him though and he brought us potstickers on the house!  We opted for the Prixe Fixed option B and loved every single course. It was a ton of food so you will definitely leave full. We even added street corn because we really wanted to try it. Delicious as expected. Would definitely come back for both the ambience & food!

uRSDie3z8EIAkxT9nj8Kyg.text: I don't wanna say disappointed but it was a bit of a let down. I've been a fan of Roy Choi and was really looking forward to eating at Best Friend but honestly everything tasted underwhelming. I guess I was expecting to be wowed with the price I was paying. We ordered a variety of food and shared among 9 people and it left our stomachs empty just like our wallets. I probably would not recommend this restaurant for anyone coming to Vegas because it is not worth the hype.
