1qbG34c5nKoFLa3feaF-mA.text: Cool spot, plenty of Asian snacks such as chips, sweets, instant ramen packs and knickknacks, sell to go at the front entrance, a few high tops, and a full bar to the right! Really busy looking design, it brings back some memories of street vendors in Asia busy night market and bar places.  Pass the bar, is the main restaurant, nicely designed, small and cozy enough, casual and chill vibe.  "Hip hop-to-bibimbop. Kimchi-to-spaghetti. BBQ and late-night food. My neighborhood mixed with the Vegas good-good. I want Best Friend to energize the minds of people looking to experience the best in life." That's the idea chef Roy Choi offers here.  This is his first restaurant outside of LA. In Los Angeles chef best known for his Kogi BBQ trucks and since closing his restaurants at the Line Hotel in Koreatown and since transitioning Locol into a catering operation.  Good Banchan  CUCUMBERS AND JJANG, persian cucumbers, soy bean chili paste, sesame, I always love cucumber salad!   LOS VEGAS SALAD, mixed greens, farmer's market veg, chili soy dressing, light and solid.   KOREAN WINGS, chili, citrus, lychee, try this!  UNI DYNAMITE RICE, santa barbara uni, sriracha, yuzu, sesame, quite good!  KALBI, korean BBQ marinated bone-in short rib, cant go wrong with a classic!  KOGI SHORT RIB TACOS, korean BBQ, salsa roja, cilantro-onion-lime, chili soy slaw, since his food truck time, 10 years ago!   Check it out when you are in the area! Oh and the yellow binder-lime-menu with chef photos is dope!  Put in the room so you earn your MLife reward points!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lWCkxBbwyWGgUylCyWo5Bw.text: Ah yes, looking at Roy Choi's menu took me down to memory lane....to dem good ol high school dayz. Not because of the food items but he added some of his personal photos from back in the day. Talk about a throwback. From Sadie Hawkins dance, the aZnBbYGuRLL lifestyle/studio photo shoots with your HoMeGurLz all the way to the white tee with baggy pants style the guys used to rock back then....2002-2005 flashed before my eyes.  Athmosphere was hip and 90s-early 2000s music was blasting over the speakers. Music does get a bit loud. Personally, I didn't mind it one bit....but just an FYI. Waiters were either in green tracksuits or white tee with beige baggy pants.   Boyfriend and I ordered the following items: -dumplings (enjoyed this VERY MUCH.) -braised and charred octopus (got a spicy kick to this) -slippery shrimp -kogi short rib tacos (OUR FAV OF THE NIGHT. One order comes with three tacos, you can add extra if you like.) -garlic chicken (least fav. Wasn't anything special. No hints of garlic whatsoever. Tasted like a regular teriyaki chicken bowl you can get around your local city. PASS!)  Located at Park MGM Hotel and Casino, you can expect Vegas prices so yes, what you're getting IS a bit on the pricier side. We shared everything and the bill added up quick! Wish we tried their Korean Wings though...we saw a few tables around us who ordered that and it looks delicious!

Lc2HxpWhuT3gGkjRKJMEPQ.text: Roy Choi is by far one of my favorite chefs! Even to the point of having Kogi(his food truck in LA) cater at my wedding. The best part of Best friend is it puts together all his restaurants in LA under one roof. You can get food from his restaurants like A frame, Kogi, Chego and even his restaurant from the past Pot. Must go to the MGM to try this place out if you love Korean food  We went here on a Thursday night and they have a DJ spinning vinyl all night to add to the awesome designed restaurant. Really fun environment to enjoy delicious food!   First thing I needed to order was the short rib tacos which I order all the time from Kogi when I'm in LA. Just like I remember them with a slight difference in the size of the short rib but I ain't complaining on that at all. Love those tacos! We also ordered the spicy pork and the Kalbi ribs. Kind of the traditional Korean but the taste is perfect. Roy Choi really sauced up the spicy pork with a gochujang all over the pork with grilled onions coated with the sauce. Love this dish! The Kalbi ribs are delicious and perfectly marinaded to have that awesome Kalbi taste. Good portion to easily share too.  Great restaurant and Chef Roy never disappoints me with his cooking. He can just make anything taste excellent!

Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi short ribs. Excellent!!

M2g9BQiF2Wu_2wrVQQd8yA.text: First time dining here, party of 5. The ambiance is very cool, feels like downtown LA. Everyone was really friendly and the food was awesome.  The Kimchi Fried Rice was my favorite and the short rib tacos were my boyfriend's fav. Our server was nice, she just didn't explain anything  You can choose a preset, priced per person,  a la carte or "pots" for the table so we had to wait about 25 minutes after sitting to order, we weren't sure how it worked or what was recommended. She was sweet just not attentive at all. Other than that, we enjoyed it.

lbKNeU_wMU1khxeAKug6kg.text: Came here with my roommate on valentine's day haha (how sad right?). Well it was cute because it was best friend (Anywayyy).   We sat at the bar as they were fully booked for the evening. You walk into a convenience looking store that also has a casual bar here. You are lead to walk through these red plastic entrance as if you were walking towards the back of the convenience store. It opens up to a 90's LA street decor. Staff were wearing jogger suits.   The menu was very simple. It had a variety of awkward 90s photos. It was as if I was ordering off a food truck. I had the uni dynamite rice. So here I a thinking I'll be getting a massive plate of rice and uni haha well it actually came in a small little dish. Gahh! It definitely wasnt going to fill me up. Thankfully they also gave us hawaiian rolls.  The dish itself was full of flavor. It was a burst of uni and spices. I liked it a lot (I just wish there was more to it). It was an evenly balanced flavor of spice and savory.   My roommate had the chego pork belly bowl. He claims that it tasted like the meat was frozen prior. (I liked it still).   I'll have to come back and try the other food options!

-SOnNguWgeruZ5apjLIlpA.text: Love this place, casual indoor design, nice employees.  Staff: Danny took care of our table that night. We love him, super friendly and helpful.  Food: Every dish taste amazing, especially for the meat dish. My friends and I love the Kalbi beef and the spicy pork. The sauce of the slippery shrimp is bomb, kimchi fried rice has nice texture, little moist and sticky. They seasoned the Elotes so well.  Price: every reasonable for the strip price, we have 4 people in total, we paid like $100 ish.  We will visit again.

cpfuofm5ASCekrIM7lMU7Q.text: Move over David Chang, Roy Choi is in town! The restaurant decor is kitsch in the best sense possible. Think vintage Korean convenience store with 80s neon funk.   The restaurant is inside MGM Park (previously Monte Carlo) next to Eataly.   Came here on a Tuesday night during restaurant week. Without reservation, an hour wait for formal dining room but plenty of seats available in the front casual dining/ bar area. Seemed family friendly.   I had a variety of dishes from the restaurant week set menu ($50/person). As with my experience with his one of his other taco joints in LA, it's a bit heavy in taste for my Asian palate. I drank a lot of water during this meal. If you like your food on the heavier side, this won't be a problem for you. Meat is tender, dishes are satisfying. Date cake was phenomenal.   Unfortunately not as head over heels for its flavors as its decor. Still a fun enjoyable dining experience though.  Side note, Roy Choi life story documented in his autobiography is super interesting!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar/ informal dining area
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean starters, Kimchi fried rice, BBQ meat

5C6RvkEQi6Mda_kg1GJF7A.text: Hands down this was one of the BEST meals I've ever had in my entire life. I was 100% sober while eating this food so trust that it's bomb.  HIGHLY recommend the elote corn dish and kimchi fried rice...could seriously eat that for the rest of my life!!! Roy Choi is the man this food is the real deal!  On a Sunday night we walked in and were seated in the the main area right when you walk in (if you want to eat in the restaurant make a reservation ahead of time) the vibe feels like an 80s LA convenient store but in a cool nostalgic way.  Can't wait to come back next time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drinks were good!

vzdAKNAnCWi5iqrA24bRMw.text: RIP OFF!!!! Be ready to spend at least $50/person for minimal amounts of food. They charge $10 for a side of French fries and $4 for Kim-Chi....seriously WTF Roy "Rip-Off" Choi???  The menu is set up so YOU PAY for every little thing. Want a side of white rice with your $30 order of meat? There will be a charge for that. Want some banchan with your meat? There is a charge for EACH ONE.  Food was ok but no better/worse than your standard Korean BBQ on Spring Mountain.   Roy Choi is no best friend of yours or mine.

jYgZKdv2gO_2_mG6NkGNoQ.text: Wanted to love this place as I am a fan of Roy Choi.  I didn't love it but I did like it.  There were 3 of us and we ordered the 65 pp tasting menu as well as the Dynamite Uni Rice Bowl.  Let's start with the uni rice.  A bit of a let down here as the dynamite sauce completely masked the delicate flavor of that Santa Barbara uni.  Won't be ordering that again.  Some standouts were the ribeye steak which was delicious.  The Korean Dumplings were delicate and well seasoned.  The sauce was on point as well.  Kimchi fried rice was outstanding.  For dessert the date cake was a flavor bomb wish I could have  fit more in me.  Now the not so great side.  The Kogi taco was good but the sauce was on the sweet side for me and the tortillas tasted like they came out of the bag. At this level I kind of expect a house made tortilla. The grilled shrimp were okay nothing to right home about.   Bonchon was good nice variety.  All in all if I was in the area I would go back but would I make a special trip to go there.....maybe not

NiYgrYKLRjpF3rTsiIYGew.text: This place is extremely busy and it's kinda a small restaurant, so you have to make a reservation for a table. My friend and I decided to go last minute but we were able to get a spot at the bar.   The fries are amazing and the sauce that comes with it is super spicy. I liked them better without the sauce. ($5) I ordered Short Rib Tacos for dinner ($12) and they were also spicy. I thought it wouldn't be enough for a meal but I was full after and I only had a couple fries.   For dessert, we both ordered one because one of the waiters said we had to try the Date Cake ($10) and my friend really wanted the Strawberry Cheesecake. ($12) The cake was good but it was a little too "light" for me and didn't have enough flavor. The Strawberry Cheesecake was yummy and comes with two different desserts. (See photo)

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary bread
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib tacos

RZ2wqmS3jljIuiO4jJjRVA.text: When you show up at 11:30 n they come to they tell you to go find another place to eat, awesome. I get if its slow close down but dont post you're hours til 12. I love this place and have given them a 5 star and always til good, when i walk in the servers usually remember me. I never expect any special treatment but when you act like a richard half an hour before u close and tell me to find somewhere else to eat then i say screw you. It was a black male that came to the door and told me to bounce. Thanks richard, thats not his name but thats what he should be called. Went outside to crack shack and was welcomed no issues and theyre awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jfBGriBLpsPgkNUgYXrBYg.text: I've been wanting to try Roy Choi's famous tacos and was excited to hear that Best Friend opened up at Park MGM! We didn't have reservations for Saturday night, so we came right when they opened at 5:00pm. The dining room was fully committed so we just ate at the bar. His restaurant is such a cool concept and we loved the bar decor filled with stickers, posters.  For food- we chose the Kogi Short Rib Tacos, Kimchi Fried Rice, and Spicy Noodles. Definitely get the tacos, it was our favorite! The spicy noodles were too vinegary for us and the kimchi fried rice was just ok.  The experience was fun and will probably come back for drinks/snacks.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LHfaDBk9Uk1lviXs0vqGIg.text: All. The. Yum. This is THE perfect taste of LA. I got to have Slippery Shrimp again for the first time in a few years and it was spot on! Very cool vibe, wait staff was attentive; loved their Adidas track suits. Also, that bread though!!! I'll take 72 bags to go please and thank you. Like, there has to be cocaine in the dough. So good!! I had Kimchi Fried Rice as well. Fyi, very generous portions here as it's made to be shared family style. Will absolutely return. I'd like to try the tasting menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchi Fried Rice
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get in my belly!
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slippery Shrimp

z21rqlF09wup7q04M_Bk3A.text: I was super-excited to try this place based on everything I'd read. It didn't disappoint! The ambiance is great--from the corner store entrance down to the adidas track suits the servers wear. And an awesome DJ spinning some trance music in the dining room. There were 4 of us, and we were a bit overwhelmed by the menu. We couldn't decide, so we got the prix fixe option, which had everything I wanted to try any way. Kogi tacos, chicken thigh BBQ and pork shoulder BBQ, kimchi fried rice, and slippery shrimp. The Kogi tacos were way spicier than I expected, but delicious--the beef was falling apart-tender. Slippery shrimp were rich, but also delicious. Couldn't quite put my finger on it, but there was something crunchy in the sauce--maybe cashews--that just made the dish. Both BBQs were delicious, but HUGE portions. We couldn't finish them and hated to leave any behind. My fave thing was the kimchi rice. It comes in a clay dish and the bottom got a little crispy--the best part. It was topped with a poached egg. I'm not usually a dessert person, but the prix fixe comes with the date cake. It. Was. Amazing. It is served with caramel ice cream. I wanted to lick the plate. This place is def worth a try. I don't like to repeat restaurants in Vegas because there are so many fabulous ones I haven't tried yet, but I would def go back here and get something else on the menu. I'm sure it's all amazing.

rwx4j73R5rux-YQScVZWAA.text: The menu was a bit difficult to follow but I did think the idea behind the menu was cute, like our binders back in our high school days lol. Other than that the staff was super friendly, service was quick, and the food was sooooooo good. We had the Kogi short rib tacos (which were an amazing blend of Mexican and Korean flavors) and the street corn, I cannot wait to go back to Vegas just to try more food at this place!

8ZZ81zynVuwVNAdRXJI4ZA.text: I dined here in May with my daughter in law for my mother's day gift before we went to the Janet Jackson show. It was delicious! I have been talking nonstop about the short rib tacos, I had to bring my husband and my cousin from Arizona to check this place out too. Our server was G and he was fun. Mishka also made a couple table visits to make sure this culinary experience was just as good as my first time there if not better. We had the Kogi short ribs tacos, the spicy pork, the slippery shrimp, and a couple of cocktails.... all the items were amazing and so flavorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. KOGI SHORT RIB TACOS korean BBQ, salsa roja, cilantro-onion-lime, chili soy slaw PEACHES COCKTAIL Elijah Craig bourbon, lemon, frozen peach
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SLIPPERY SHRIMP rock shrimp with chili-mayo
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LJoUw4dzdMvM2BG8pP9Gsg.text: Heard a lot of hype from this place including from my friends who are also locals. You will fall in love with the decor and theme here. Seating is comfy & playlist was great (they were playing Kaytranada and lots of chill hip-hop). Honestly , the food was mediocre (3.5 out of 5). Much better Korean restaurants off-strip. Nothing from our experience was horrible though.  Everything from the menu is share-able portions for two (or 4 or family style if you order A LOT). All of our food came out fast on a busy Monday night , none of our dishes came out cold. Tried variety of menu items and truly only enjoyed the slippery shrimp , the complimentary Hawaiian rolls , and the dessert strawberry cheesecake & Medjool date cake. Slippery shrimp was crispy & juicy and covered in some delicious spicy and tangy sauce .. should've ordered another one of this instead of the other items we got to be honest. Complimentary Hawaiian rolls had a nice touch with the sea salt and butter. Desserts were HUGE (felt like it was bigger than the appetizers & entrees lol). Strawberry cheesecake is my love - not only dessert had a nice presentation but cheesecake and the yuzu sorbet was tasty. Our server recommended the Medjool date cake and was not disappointed. The cake was warm & gooey and the toffee/salted caramel ice cream had some crunch inside. Date cake was more of a rich dessert while strawberry cheesecake was more refreshing - I'd still just get both :).  The items I wouldn't recommend were the dumplings , Kogi short rib tacos , shaking beef saltado & kimchi fried rice. Well the dumplings , short rib tacos & kimchi fried rice were alright but tasted like any other ones you can find for half of the price. Shaking beef saltado wasn't anything special even for meat quality - too many peppers & onions and the side of french fries took up almost more than half of the plate.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchi fried rice
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dumplings
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kogi short rib tacos

HvWtCiMTTD2lTHy1XVq4Hg.text: So glad I was able to stop by the legendary chef Roy Choi's special new restaurant at the Park MGM! Ever since I've moved to Northern California I've missed the savory flavors that Roy Choi has been cooking up and I was glad I was able to get a great taste of it again during a recent visit to Vegas.  Chego bowl and tacos - can't go wrong with these options! The former had a really savory and delicious viet-fusion style taste to it and the latter brought me back to the days of eating Kogi truck on the occasion we luckily ran across it in LA. Would come again.

g0FfVqEweMvEXxVvsGf-Tg.text: Very hip restaurant serving street food style dishes! Seems to be a mix of korean, Mexican and some Hawai'i flare to the dishes. I really enjoyed the uni dynamite and kimchee fried rice. Kalbi was on point! The fries were not anything good at all. Jazz up those fries Roy! The Mexican corn was good too. Chicken wings were ok, I just felt like there was too much of the same gochujang sauce flavor on everything. Our waitress was in the cutest track suit and we had great service and the restaurant is so funky and really neat! Very fun place to eat! The Hawaiian sweet rolls were good but didn't match to me. But regardless, food and experience was awesome and I would go again! Little pricey but worth the whole experience.

LBXhU3VRVHjYztCc6bGD3A.text: Overall, everything was great. Our only complaint is about the hostess. We arrived late to our reservation and our table had been given away. Totally understandable. She informed us that we'd have to wait and she would "see what they could do" this was at 9pm on a Sunday night. After 40 minutes of waiting and watching 10 other tables get seated, I asked another hostess that temporarily took over her spot, if they had an estimated wait time. She checked on my name and it turned out another table had been seated under my name. Again, we were late so I understand that the table had been given away, but our names were never re-added to the list!   We were quickly seated and the rest of the evening went great. All the servers and bussers were fantastic and the food was amazing. We sat in these super comfy swivel chairs and basically ate till we burst. Everyone knows the kogi tacos and pork belly bowl are delicious, but a pleasant surprise was the tempura. It was lightly battered and perfectly cooked.   It's unfortunate our experience was marred by a hostess who did not deign to seat us and made us feel less than.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bingsu dessert
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfectly battered tempura

cxqh5dZNnz04XjJwEgAd1w.text: Hella ill. Came to visit our close friends in Vegas and had a dragon boat race in Henderson. They took us out to Best Friend and I instantly loved the Korean liquor store front. Too too ill. Hennessy slurpie too? Oh my god, this place was meant for me. I had a little bit of everything and the music inside just made it hard to leave. Swear it played better music than all the clubs on the strip. Real hip hop music. That good goo music.   Food, had the tacos, deconstructed elote (my favorite), wings, and the pork belly bowl. I'd come back for the elote, tacos, Hennessy slurpie and environment fa sho. Pork belly bowl was ok. I think I waited too long to eat it so it didn't taste as great by the time I ate it 30 min later. I was clearly enjoying myself in the restaurant and with the Hennessy slurpie too much.   Highly recommended and I would definitely come back. Loved it and the servers in track suits.

WrsvcUyAZtcnHwqJTgLTkg.text: The most unique, fun and entertaining restaurant on the strip!  As soon as you walk in, you get that OG LA vibe.  When you walk through the red curtains you get a little bit of chic, but at the same time uptown funk feel.  The staff is on point and the food is some of Roy Choi's finest collections.  If you're not sure what to get, Kogi tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings, tacos and bibimbap!

7ADxRUD--aLLdvytPGU8rA.text: What an amazing place to find! It's bright, fun and then things they sell in the front are fun and interesting. The menu is super fun and the atmosphere is electric.  The place is loud with the DJs so be prepared for minimal talk and lots of food (not a bad thing). We weren't super hungry when we arrived which was unfortunate because everything sounded amazing.  Ordered the Uni Dynamite Rice and husband ordered the Braised and Charred Octopus! Both delicious and arrived pretty quickly to the table. Highly recommended can especially if you have a bigger group as things are served family style (more opportunities to try a variety of dishes!). Wish we got to try the cocktails but I'm nursing a little one, so wasn't an option, but they sounded really good. Hope to go back soon!

6bb5BtYa356T9yOSGlZGOA.text: We went here not too long after it opened, so I was expecting to see a few kinks as far as service or food, but that wasn't the case. There has been a lot of buzz and anticipation around this restaurant opening, and it did not disappoint.  From the Park MGM parking garage, it's a bit of a walk allllll the way to the other end of the property, but is a great way to work up that appetite before you indulge in all that Best Friend has to offer. I already knew that the entrance to the restaurant was a bodega facade, but I'm glad I read in another review that you have to check in where the the cash register is, because it might've taken a while for me to figure that out.   Upon check in, we were seated right away. All of the staff was friendly and knowledgeable, and our server provided great recommendations on what to order. We ended up getting The Big E from the OC, kimchi fried rice, kalbi, BBQ garlic chicken, short rib tacos and wok veggies, plus bingsu & date cake for dessert.  Everything we ordered was delicious and came out pretty quickly. I know that this place deserves 5 stars because my dad, who is pretty picky and critical of everywhere we eat, didn't have one negative thing to say.... and we didn't hear a peep out of him all night because he was too busy stuffing his face with all of the amazing food.

tDpQnn7HPUUb144kZevf3A.text: One of the best meals of my life. Loved the decor, the service, the menu. For food, they just kept bringing out amazing stuff. The short ribs, the fried rice, this pork/rice/egg bowl, the CORN, the shrimp, the tempura, the little bread rolls dipped in the cucumber plate's sauce. The TACOS. It was all bomb.

O4hT7J-t6KDWX0lAWNOmng.text: This place was awesome! I even came here with my best friend. I love all the cool ideas they thought of like drinks in the red solo cups or tall boys in a glass that has "tall boy" on it. We ordered a shit ton of food because we wanted to try it all. Our server was super friendly and accommodating to my friend whom has celiac. Definitely coming here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside of restaurant
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu and interior
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salty dog drink and slushie

gYrXlxmaa38bTNDm3w43Ug.text: You will pay 2-3 times as much for below average Korean food. This place is trying to just appeal to the masses in Vegas. I am so disappointed as I love Kogi and Chego in LA. The kimchee and pickled vegetables are literally the worst I've ever had in my entire life which is an automatic fail if you cant even get this right. Everything else is far below mediocre, very disappointed Roy signed off on this menu.

BUlXHocKxzE7bJ6La37jPQ.text: Hot n Fresh Hawaiian rolls? Check. Boozy Slushies? Check. Kogi tacos? Bbq? Check, Check. Elotes and spaghetti?!? Check. Travel through a k town portal and enter a room of bomb music, good vibes and deliciousness!! I didn't want to leave after finishing our meal and wanted to order another round of everything again! Super sad that by our 7pm reservation, they were already out of chicken wings, but we will be back to try those out...for sure!

Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Utt6BmoyP7SaRYBgzR5Ycw.text: Let me just say, this is hands down the best restuarant I've had in Vegas. My bf and I are big kbbq fans, so we had a lot of expectations were pretty high. Everything about this place was awesome. Too often in Vegas you walk into a restuarant that is boujie that charges $30 for a piece of bread, this place was just cool. From the decor, to the menu, to the uniforms, and the service. Our waitress Christina was attentive, friendly, and accommodating. Her suggestions were on point and when we were ready to over order she stopped us and told us we wouldn't be able to eat that much food between two. We will definitely be back, because I am dreaming about that spicy pork.

Hxqvcxn5VIi6geijljaqbw.text: We were walking by and stumbled upon Best Friend without prior knowledge of the location. We've heard of ton about Kagi, his famously popular food truck, and knew we had to check it out. We jumped on the hotel website and made reservations for the same night. We went on a Sunday and were able to get a table right after opening.  I was happy to see Hitachino Nest beer on their menu and grabbed one. My wife had a sake.  We ordered the Korean fried chicken appetizer with cucumber on the side, which was as delicious as you'd expect. We'd just eaten at Pok Pok (another great Korean place) in Vegas the day before and couldn't decide which had the better wings. Best Friends wins hands-down for the beat menu.  For our entree we split the Tamarind black cod stew. It was creamy and delicious - everything we hoped for and more. It was similar to a curry, but with noodles added in. I'd go again just for this dish.  Atmosphere wise, the place has an intentional vibe that screams "we're not in Vegas anymore". After entering through the literal curtain, you're in the back room of a bodega eating with a few dozen other tables.

f8e63RJXaJAXJSnxH-123g.text: Love the ambience, love the music, love the staff, but everything we ordered was salty and very hard to eat. I wasn't able to finish half the dishes I ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FQyZ4Ziyo5bZxM9qHRn2dw.text: Went here about 10pm late Vegas dinner had just woken up from a disco nap. Saw the fries being served to another table- had to have those also had the bbq pork,short ribs, wings, and tacos. Alright let's go... pork similar to spicy bulgogi was the best, that needs to be in a taco please. So we ordered tortillas and sure enough what a great balance to the spice. If I had a mulligan I would skip the short ribs and the wings -same reason for both items-good flavor/too dry. Service was great, I had an old fashioned nice and strong . Food came out pretty quick and we will be returning, still some stuff on the menu I want to try definitely with my mind on tortillas and tortillas on my mind

Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All the smells

VjteMZUhn2DqaOjCpL02Kg.text: Delicious flavors! Reservations only but we got lucky and were seated at the bar! Good jams while you eat and drink

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumbers
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm butter deliciousness
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old Fashioned

gx8xin3XdggbKXaQide5YA.text: Roy smashes it once again. The food is nothing short of amazing. The spicy pork is on another level. Killer cocktails too! Fuzzy navel and mai Thai both highly recommended. Over the top flavours + top notch cocktails and a cool decor push this restaurant into the "must try" category. Just hope it's not too hip for the property and fizzles after 6 months. Do yourself a favour and catch a meal here. There's more to Korean cuisine than AYCE bbq!!

GMZgKstpSN9sePuB4OoU5g.text: Theme and vibe are spot on. The playlist is great and the space looks cool. The menu is hilarious with the throwback photos. If you're Asian, you'll truly appreciate it because we all took those photos at the mall or school dances, don't lie.   Service was great and attentive.   Cocktails: we tried the fuzzy navel and midori sour, both great and not too sweet. But $18 is a bit up there for a cocktail, even on the strip. I'd say maybe 15$ is fair. But there was a lot of fresh fruit juice in there so that may justify the cost for some.   Food: all great flavors but i am a spice wuss and literally everything except the Hawaiian rolls were spicy. Those rolls are DELICIOUS by the way.   Tempura shrimp and veggies: great batter, super crispy, and liked that it had a lot of veggies. A bit overly salted though   Saltado dish: almost every Angelino i know, loves Lomo Saltado so i had to order this. beef was a bit tough, fries were nice, pepper and onions cooked well, and for me it was spicy. (I know most people will disagree but i did say i was a spice wuss) a regular person will say this is a 1 and I'd say it was a 5   Slippery shrimp: i knew better not to try this cuz i didn't wanna burn my mouth out. This was my boyfriends dish and it was executed well and medium spice.   Pork belly bowl: SO good. Great medley of flavors. Rice cooked perfectly. Belly cooked perfectly. I knew this was going to be a spicy dish but i wanted to try the flavors anyway. Yes it was spicy, it has gojuchang so that's a given. But this was probably my favorite dish.   I definitely want to come back and try other dishes as the menu is fairly extensive and try "basic" things that aren't spicy.   Only reason i gave 3 stars is because i personally cannot eat that much spicy food so menu is limiting for me. That being said, the food is great and if you like spice either a little or a lot, this is a good interesting spot to try. Prices are a bit up there for the type of food and many people may have an issue with paying this much for dishes this "casual" but you have to take into account the hotel and ambiance, which whether you like it or not, you're paying for

1pSk2ljz9LrO3ihX446kpw.text: So stoked I was in Vegas to eat here during their first week. The date cake was probably the best dessert and ending to an absolutely wonder dining experience. Our server Sam was very fun and informative. He pointed us in the right direction on every dish!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short Rib Tacos
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian Sweet Rolls, Kimchi , Cucumbers.
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Dumplings

Qn7A5hKgW67Bkfyxk6n29A.text: Legit. Loved the vibe here and the atmosphere. It's colorful, well thought out and is not fussy.  Win number 1: our server Sam. This guy made our night, seriously, Valentine's Day can be super lame out at dinner without a fun banter with whoever is choosing to spend their Valentine's Day making your night out better. Sam I am, we'll be back for the food and your banter. But all joking aside this guys was well versed in the menu, super friendly and a little sassy. Loved him!  Win number 2: the food here is soulful, delicious, unpretentious and fun. Roy Choi is a super star in my book. Things not to skip: the kimchi, the spicy pork (although I thought it was more sweet than spicy) still delicious. Huge portion though, so bring your appetite. The dumplings were out of this world, maybe the best dumplings we've ever had with a spicy, umami dipping sauce that was dope.  The octopus, could not have been better, it was perfectly cooked and tender and came in a super yummy spicy, salty, stew. We'll be back!

CZ85h5Gut87R83OnTf7MKw.text: Korey the server was fantastic- all the staff were very friendly. All the dishes were AMAZING - but the Kogi taco was the best thing ever!!  The vibe is really cool, lively, and fun. Will definitely return!!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Logo tacos

gcWTod9VZ2mmd21HgOLnvw.text: Exactly what the strip needed. Bringing that downtown flavor to Park MGM. The Kimchi fried rice is a must!

Eha6L2AEpZP_XRWL4skhiQ.text: This place is AMAZING!! I loved everything about it! The spicy food is actually spicy, so if you aren't used to it make sure to tell your waiter/waitress, otherwise enjoy it!

Up9Ickov-7wwGVoTMLhUYg.text: My husband and I were very excited to try best friend. The Decour and ambience was amazing. It brought us back to the 90s of Southern California. We loved the music! We highly recommend the kimchi fried rice, the Korean chicken wing appetizer, the spicy chicken thighs, and the chili spaghetti. The food was outstanding. The Hawaiian rolls that came at the beginning, after we were seated, were absolutely mouthwatering.  We actually used the Hawaiian rolls to dip into some of the chili spice seasoning from Korean chicken wings. We're definitely going to return.

ryD98ZavxjyAImQFksbjHw.text: The atmosphere was so dope. The music was the best music by far I heard in any restaurant. The food and service was incredible. You have to go!

gMGteyz5JTLVxNdGlw06gw.text: I had the pleasure of enjoying Best Friend a couple weeks ago and had a great time. The atmosphere is casual and cool. My favorite items off the menu (that i tried) were the kimchi fried rice and garlic chicken. Christina was our server and she was amazing, definitely request her if given the opportunity.

mM1kfQd0TCp-mf3K__0FOg.text: The uni fried rice is ridiculous!!! So so good! And the short ribs is the best I've ever had!!! Chef was walking around and kindly let us take our pic w him! Loved the music and vibe!

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2zTF_rcvzUjG5tEzBljo4Q.text: Probably the best thing I've eaten this year so far.. I can not get over how ridiculously delicious it is.

photos.caption: Photo of Best Friend by Roy Choi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So much yum! Pork Belly Bowl

JXM99e5wkqHiST2uq1OUkA.text: Loved it!! Food amazing, service great!! I was looking forward to coming when we planned our trip-watched 'The Chef Show' a while back and was delighted to find Best Friend!!!! Food exceeded my expectations-so delicious! Definitely include the Kogi Tacos and the Kimchi Fried Rice in your order!!!

6HmYXmT1Hp3v6FWbXfM7Qw.text: Okay so first off the vibe of the restaurant is great! It looks like a subdued corner convenience store out front and then you go to the back and it's like a crazy disco. When you have the tacos, you know it's the real deal. The bulgogi is very sweet and you can tell they marinated it themselves while the soju cocktails are mixed absurdly well

0eS5CPx5OtjmV1wuXSZVEw.text: Great with groups. I called and made a reservation the process went smoothly. Food is delicious we got street corn, tacos, spicy shrimp, and wings loved the family style because you get to have a little of everything.

2aFnd6VDR0ktt1o23B1yDA.text: 'Best friend' just recently opened, and I had no regrets making my visit. I love the culture, dynamic, and the story behind this restaurant!  Your first look from the outside, you may think it's just a little store that sells snacks along with a bar on the side... But it isn't just an entrance that gave you a vibe of a liquor store/market, it's an entrance to give you an insight of Roy Choi's childhood and teen life.. throughout your visit in the store, you may notice a red drape, which is there entrance to the restaurant where you will also be led in and seated by the hostess. The art on the wall, to servers outfit, the portrait, the lounge area and the menu allows you to sit at your table wondering what all the art meant and how can this be relatable to Roy Choi's life. Some the host/hostess had adidas track suit on, and some had khaki shorts with white T on. This gave such a chill vibe, I LOVED IT! Also, Their intentions of creating a menu that almost looked like a yearbook wowed me most! I spent my first 30 minutes looking over that menu and the pictures in the menu, trying to piece his stories together... I couldn't help but to ask our server about it, but there was so much more I wanted to know!  Came with a party of 4 and can't wait to return! I loved it! Basically it was a story about the positive changes he made in his life! :) Ask about it!

sAtksMaNwA3tI7bLUkD6QQ.text: Awesome atmosphere with the music and a great experience with Christina and Scotty. The food was amazing!!! Thank you Chef Roy

bxrs-ls0WIeD6fXcHKfw3g.text: I had literally no expectations going into this restaurant.  I thought the place looked cool.  We ordered some chicken, and prawns and honestly I've had better food at mall food courts.  I read a lot of the reviews after eating at this restaurant and I feel like most people are just fans of Roy Choi.  The price of the food is ridiculous.  The chicken was mediocre at best, and the prawns for some reason had a new car taste.  That sounds like a weird way to describe food but that's really what it tasted like.  The other annoying thing is that they were constantly trying to clear our table, even though we were clearly still eating.  We felt rushed even though the restaurant wasn't busy.  It was actually quite rude, I mean at least let me eat your mediocre food at a decent pace.  Idk who you are Roy Choi, but you are certainly not a very good best friend!  Save your money, take an Uber to an off the strip Korean restaurant!

Tzfq1ONcxOG0aeCD_06RMw.text: Overall it was a good time, but I expected more from all the hype that is Roy Choi. Maybe the kitchen is still working things out, maybe it was just an off day. We work in the service industry and can completely relate to that being the case. The best things we ate were the elote and the fries. Legit the best elote I've ever had! We also ordered slippery shrimp, short rib tacos, and kimchi rice balls. I'm sure the shrimp were crispy coming out of the fryer, but once they were coated in the sauce and served, they were a bit soggy. The tacos and kimchi rice balls had tons of flavor but seemed like they were each missing one component to round out the dish. I'd like to return sometime and try the korean bbq menu items. Service and ambience were excellent.

f2uTcGt44RSlhlqFbWUhpw.text: Before I think this is a grill Korean BBQ but they're cook for you already and I think the special dishes is sea ocean blow but it's finish so fast (I'm can't get it) but all good!!

tEfpQrS6oNP2NPZHMKRjXA.text: Loved everything about this restaurant from the moment we walked in till the end of our meal.  Food was great and we enjoyed the atmosphere.  We look forward to coming here again!

Wix9mpGnCfpIz0_uEorkTA.text: While vacationing in Vegas, I was throwing away my diet and looking for delicious food.  I happened to walk into Chef Roy Choi's restaurant and I am so glad I did.  Just by walking in I knew I found a great place.  The music and the environment was great!  After we were seated, our waiter Sam was just amazing.  He suggested many items and he did not let us down.  First up was cocktails and Sam suggested the Old Fashioned and it was delicious!  Next up was the LA Love story.  We were in heaven with the big portions of food.  The star of the meal was the Kim Chee Fried Rice.  I felt as if I had died and gone to heaven with my first bite.  Overall this has been such an amazing dining experience and I can't wait to return to Best Friends!  Thank you to our waiter Sam for an amazing dining experience!!  I hope next time I return, I can meet Chef Roy and personally thank him for such an amazing dining experience!

XHwocw5oXO2_CPug-y4Rvw.text: Not my best friend so far. Making us sit at the bar to eat while there or no less than 9 open tables because we didn't have a reso on a Thursday night. Lol. Will update based on food as it comes out. But not a great start  Food was ok. Not great and not even overly interesting just ok. But the service remained bad throughout. I don't recommend. Big on concept small on execution and basics. Bummer I had high hopes

bjRGbM3JCjXSsK_nZXSgmw.text: One of the few Korean joint to make its mark on the strip at a name brand resort.  I like the concept but boy did this place under deliver in almost every way.  We had the wings (fried to hell) with underwhelming spice less sauce.  The octopus was smothered in gogijang sauce with a few onions.  Not what I was expected for an $18 appetizer.  The Kim chi fried egg had a non runny poached egg.  What's the point? Again over cooked with mushy rice.  This is probably the hardest thing to screw up (all u need is a wok)and they managed.  Thought I would get the original kalbi tacos to save this meal but it came with mini sized cubes of beef that tasted like beef jerky.  They literally over cooked every protein we ordered.  The only saving grace was the flavors on the tacos.  Overall,  I thought LA Korean food brought to Vegas would crush it but I felt like corners were cut and there was no QC!  You can charge an arm and a leg for amazing Korean food on the strip and people would pay.  I would!! Instead it ended up being a tourist trap next to eataly on MGM property.   Service was fine but there was no follow up during my meal.  Food 2 Service 3 Overall 2.5

1I7ezHTcsiuWJK0u5GT5Cg.text: Awesome decor & atmosphere. Food was decent but pricey. Can get same stuff, tastes better and cheaper, from other location in Chinatown.

WfK2xcinF5Ia-SJ-W-K9dA.text: We arrived on the Wednesday before the grand opening at 10pm. Staff and server were very friendly. We had the wings, cucumbers, fried rice and Korean tacos. We found all the dishes to be very one note, spicy. The rice tasted as if it had sat all day and the taco meat wasn't very tender. I am assuming coming in towards the end of the night didn't help but if you are open the food should be the same quality. I will say the server was very good and the place had a very cool vibe. On the strip there are tons of options and I don't think I would return for another try...

jeT_H755ggd0l8yMp8uqXg.text: This place is awesome. Very upbeat and fun! I felt very nostalgic. Also being celiac, they had plenty of gluten free options such as kimchi fried rice, carnitas tacos, elote, banchan, etc. They were able to modify several of the dishes and each one was delish. The place has a great vibe, but can get a little loud. And the service was great.

aXXTJgVU-X3yzNdGDsbWNA.text: Friendly staff, creative twist on Korean-Mex fusion food, and a great value make this a new favorite. The Korean pork tacos were great! You walk through red plastic slats to go into the restaurant, kind of like a car wash/bordello only to find people totally digging their food. I'll be back!
